1.content:
The world is much as it always has been. Internal combustion engine powered vehicles ride down the streets, planes fly across the sky, skyscrapers tower over cement roads, and people hustle and bustle through the streets trying to get to homes, jobs, or wherever else they may have to be. The only difference, is the populace. Humans have lived side by side with the anthros for as long as they could remember. Average Joes walking down the road right next to upright, bipedal fox men chatting it up with busty Rabbit women. Lions, Tigers, Bears and every other animal imaginable littering the streets across the world, intermingled with humans at every turn. Even dinosaurs, dragons, and other mythical creatures are intermingled in with the other anthros and humans.

The world adjusted slightly for some of them, of course. New clothing lines made specifically for those with tails, some airplanes made to support the 'larger' furs such as the dinosaurs and dragons, who tend to be bigger than the average person, New food chains cater to more specified diets, and a multitude of other miniscule, tiny changes that fill the cities and suburbs.

Today would start as just another day for all of these people, but little do they know that a few of them are about to experience something abnormal, unusual and potentially amazing, or terrifying. Things they never would have dreamed of are about to come forth, and the only question that can be asked is... How will they handle it.

Our story starts in a small suburb on the outskirts of a major metropolitan city. Its a quiet little neighborhood. No real crime to speak of, no major natural disasters of late. Just a modest, almost generic looking compilations of homes and those that live in them. But that's where it always starts, doesn't it. An unsuspecting person in an unsuspecting town.

And Today, that unsuspecting person is...



1: Tyler Matthews: A little 5 foot tall dragon with smooth, scaleless purple flesh that lives at home with his older brother, David. He owns a small game and hobby shop near the edge of the city, and spends most of his time either there, or at home playing video games or reading. He's always been a bit Jealous of David's size, and his lack thereof, and though they fight a lot, they don't really HATE each other.

2: David Matthews: A big, beefy 7'3" tower of athletic dragon. He lives at home with his brother, Tyler, and spends most of his time either at College, at football practice, or hanging out with the rest of the football team. He teases Tyler rather frequently about his size, bordering on bullying at times, but never really seems to notice how bad he can be, as to him he always does it jokingly, and Doesn't think Tyler takes it seriously.

3: Jessica Hallows: A lean, modestly curved and endowed 5'8" tall arctic fox, with her hair Dyed bright pink. She's a fireball of forward, aggressive little fox that loves to party and hates not getting her way. She likes to 'toy' with guys, teasing them with playfully mocking insults usually veiled as compliments, or compliments veiled as Insults, rarely ever being actually up front with anyone. She'd never admit it but she secretly has a 'thing' for big guys, and has had a crush on David for a while now. She shares an apartment with Allison

4: Allison Parker: A Towering, curvy, endowed and plump amazonian behemoth of a 8'2 green scaled rex. She towers over everyone else and even if she didn't, would probably beat any other girl in the curves or chest department with ease. Though despite all that shes incredibly shy and self conscious, usually hating to be the center of attention despite Jessica always trying to make her into one, which she can't often escape since she lives with Jessica.

11.content:
Tyler Matthews is a runt.  There can be no other word that describes so simply and wholly what this purple-skinned dragon is.  Standing at 5’1” at age 20 he is absolutely dwarfed by his older brother, David, a 7’3” behemoth.  Tyler is overshadowed by his brother not only in height, but also in proportional body mass.  Being a “runt” his whole life suppressed any urges Tyler had to partake in sports, and as he got older he felt no need to work out excessively, unlike his brother.  Thus, Tyler retained a rather lean figure, even having a slight paunch of a belly that barely obscures his abs.

Although Tyler lacks the physical size, strength and prowess of his football-playing older brother, he makes up for it with his intellect.  Aside from spending his free time reading and playing video games, Tyler is a more than competent student at the local university, which his brother also attends.  These two dragons live together in a small house near the university, where their “brotherly love” is constantly put to the test.  Growing up, Tyler had to deal with constant teasing and playful bullying from his older brother.  And while David never has never truly hurt or humiliated Tyler excessively, the purple drake still wishes he could somehow get the best of his older brother.

More recently Tyler has come into ownership of a small hobby and game store, which he runs on his own to sell tabletop gaming products, trading cards, and comic books to the neighborhood. His minor success in the business has awarded him a few luxuries and some extra cash flow, something that allows him to exercise a certain amount of control over his older brother.  On multiple occasions Tyler has found himself – rather smugly – looking down at his older brother when the cobalt drake has come asking for cash to take out one of his latest girlfriends.  While being forthcoming and generous with his extra cash Tyler is not shy about asking his older brother to return the favor, a practice which often puts David in the very rare position of doing something humiliating at his brother’s request.  In this manner, Tyler takes advantage of his brother’s weakness for wining and dining various gorgeous females, and has renewed the fire of competition between himself and his brother.  Because although Tyler is often able to manipulate his brother into doing humiliating things – such as portraying a comic book or D&D character in front of Tyler’s shop – David has begun to eagerly and viciously “wage war” to get a little revenge on his younger brother.

And thus is the state of David and Tyler’s fraternal relationship.  While Tyler exercises a keen wit and the occasional bribe to keep his brother at bay, he often has to endure physical torment at the hands of his stronger older brother.  Tyler’s learned to enter and exit the house with stealth, and often keeps his door locked to avoid any extra harassment from his brother.  Despite the volatile nature of their relationship, Tyler still has affection for his older brother, and recognizes that David, too, is showing affection in his own way.  Tyler’s greatest pastime is to continually search for ways to outsmart his smug older brother, tiring as it may be for him to do so.  And when he sleeps, Tyler dreams of being able to best his brother in an outright physical confrontation, rather than being wrestled and teased on a near-daily basis…

111.content:
The package that arrived at the shop that day didn’t bear Tyler’s name, or any name in fact, but it had his address and the postman even made him sign for it. If it hadn’t been an unusually busy day at the shop, he might’ve opened it there. But instead, he’d put it aside with his personal mail and ended up taking it home with him. The short walk to his building was uneventful, but as always he felt a bit of dread as he climbed the steps to the house he shared with his brother. There was always a chance that David would be home, and he never knew exactly how that would end, though it usually wasn’t in his favor. David was too much bigger and stronger.

Tyler sighed softly as he stopped on the porch and pulled his shoes off, splaying his bare toes on the porch and wiggling them against the wood. He crept up to the door and listened carefully, but didn’t hear any sounds from inside. He’d learned that the quiet didn’t necessarily mean David wasn’t there…but it did increase the odds that the purple dragon could make it to his room before his brother could catch him. He put his key in the door and turned it quietly, peeking his head inside. He let go of the breath he’d been holding as he glanced around. The coast seemed to be clear, at least for now.

He closed the door and locked it behind himself, sorting through the mail, feeling a little more relaxed now. He tossed the bills and things aside one by one before reaching the package and giving the label another glance. There was no return address, no name, just the address of his shop. Could it be a gift? Maybe something from his brother? Or an admirer? He slowly peeled the tape off and opened up the box, digging through the packaging until his fingers closed around something hard and firm. He raised an eyebrow as he pulled the object out, his eyes widening as he saw what it was.

It was about the size of a revolver, but the color was more of a gray metallic than the average gun metal. There was no obvious place to load it, either, but there was a dial on the side. There was only a sliding scale, smaller on one end but rising as the dial moved right. It looked almost like the volume on a radio. He stared at it blankly for a moment. “What...is this? Why would someone send me a gun?”

He toyed with it for a moment, fingers playing over the trigger, adjusting the dial. It made an audible click as he moved it from the center setting, turning it ‘up.’ He was moving to put the gun back in the box when his finger brushed the trigger, the gun firing with a hum. Tyler let out a gasp of surprise, expecting a bullet. Instead, a ray of red light flashed from the barrel of the gun, hitting the house plant in the hall way dead center. As the dragon watched, the plant began to change, the leaves seeming to shift. It took him a moment to understand what was happening, his mind having trouble processing it at first.

The plant was GROWING. Not just growing faster, but growing bigger, the leaves expanding, the stalk thickening...In just moments, it grew from a small shrub about half Tyler’s size to something resembling a small tree, nearly as tall as he was and just as thick. The pot actually cracked from the new, thicker roots, the soil forced upwards.

“Wow…does this mean…?” He stared at the gun in disbelief. “Is this some kind of growth ray?” He went back to the box immediately, inspecting it closely for any kind of logo or instructions, but there was nothing he could see. “Well…guess I’ll just have to test it a little…”

He toyed with the knob, this time dialing it back the other way, hearing the click at the center and pushing it all way ‘down.’ He looked around the room and found the perfect target: David’s recliner. It was a big, bulky chair, just like his brother, and Tyler had been the one who wound up paying for it. He smirked, as he imagined his brother laying back in the chair, blissfully unaware that his brother had a shrink ray pointed at him. A smile curled his lips as he took aim and fired.

It worked even better than he expected. A soft Green light fired from the ray, striking the chair and washing over it in a quick wave. Within seconds, the chair began to shrink, growing visibly smaller as Tyler watched, dwindling down, three feet, two feet…finally slowing until it was only an inch or so tall.

Tyler grinned widely, walking over to the chair. “What’s that David?” he said to the empty chair. “I can’t hear you all the way down there.” He smirked, hovering his bare paw over the recliner. “Oh, man…I could totally crush him at that size!” He pressed his foot down lightly, and even that light pressure caused something to snap in the chair. He laughed, bringing his foot all the way down, crushing it into the floor. “Ooops,” he chuckled. “Better watch out, bro!”

He chuckled, but his smile slowly faded into a more serious look. Could he really use the gun on his brother? It’s not as though he wouldn’t be justified in doing it…David was always lording his size over him, how much bigger and stronger he was. He thought about the look on his face as he walked through the door to find Tyler waiting for him, ray in hand.

He was so lost in thought in fact that he almost didn’t hear his brother’s footsteps approaching, the steps creaking with his weight. Tyler felt a flash of fear run through him. He had only seconds to decide what to do…if David saw the gun and got it away from him, it would be all over for him. He couldn’t even begin to imagine what kind of hell he would go through if David were suddenly much, much bigger than him. He was obnoxious enough at just a few feet.

what to do... what to do...

11112.content:
Rather than the beam of red light that shot out before, with the gun set to the shrink setting a bright green ray of light shot out of the end of it, hitting David square in the chest, causing his eyes to widen in surprise. The beam seemed to 'wrap' around his body, engulfing him from head to toe in a glowing emerald colored aura, that seemed to pulsate every fraction of a second. With each 'pulse' his body seemed to push inwards in all directions, body compacting downwards in size, smaller and smaller with each passing moment.

David was stunned, and having trouble even understanding what was going on. The Plant near the door (Why was it so big?!) had suddenly shot a beam of green light at him, and now his whole body was filled with a strange tingling, and he felt somewhat dizzy, like he was in a fast moving elevator.. an elevator going down.

Within moments his 7'3 height had reduced down to 7 foot... then 6'6... then 6... His head swinging around in shock as he watched everything around him growing larger and larger. The plant, the walls, the couch, everything was raising up higher and higher above him... He was shrinking. He had no idea how it was possible, but somehow he was getting smaller...! The top of the doorframe that his head nearly grazed every time he walked through it was now well out of reach, his height dwindled under the 5 foot mark and the couch that stood near the door, that he usually simply lept over the back of was now too tall for him to do that without having to climb over the back like Tyler did...

He was scared. He was shrinking and he didn't know why... or worse, didn't know how small he was going to get...

4 foot passed. Then three... then two... Everything was becoming absurdly large. Furniture that he usually had to be careful not to smack into and knock over, was now towering over him like small buildings... and his shrinking was only continuing to progress!

Tyler's eyes were just as wide, but instead of an expression of fear and confusion, his lips were curled back into a wide, self satisfied grin. Watching the towering 'beast' of a brother rapidly dwindling down smaller and smaller infront of him, until soon even Tyler would tower overhead was more than enough to make him the happiest he had been in years... in more ways than one. He reflexively reached down to adjust the front of his pants, pushing the swelling erection straining the front of his pants downwards, so it had more room to stretch out down one of his pants legs... the sight of ANYONE being so much smaller than him, was an incredible turn on... even moreso to see that it was his brother. (His mind far too distracted with the size difference, to make note that he was being turned on by his brother in any fashion)

By the time the green glow had started to fade... David was barely 6 inches tall. He stood in the middle of the tiled entryway infront of the door, looking around in awe and horror at the sight of how everything that was normally so small to him, was now much, much larger. The back of the couch looked like the side of a cliff to him... the legs of the small table beside the front door, each one was thicker than the biggest treetrunk he had ever seen... The shoes sitting next to the door were the size of small cars, he could probably crawl into one if he tried...! Then he felt the shaking

Thump. Thump. Thump. Thump.

The floor was noticeably starting to shake in a slow, rhythmic pattern, and a dark shadow cast across him... his head turned and saw something massive infront of him, that made his jaw fall open in surprise and terror... his eyes slowly starting to trail upwards, following those massive white clawed, purple toes... up the length of lean purple flesh for his calfs, and along the denim of his jeanshorts (And thankfully too awed by the rest of him to notice the obvious bulge pushing against one of the legs of those jeanshorts) as his eyes traveled farther up to the lanky shirt clad torso of his brother Tyler... his brother who, a few hours ago, would have been lucky to have been eye level with David's upper stomach... was now towering over David like a massive skyscraper, or some monster out of a movie... David's 6 inch form only as tall as Tyler's lower calf.


“ooooh... Lookey here...” David heard Tyler mutter... his normally meek, quiet voice sounding deep and powerful with him a dozen times David's size. Tyler's face screwed up in a massive, self satisfied grin. “Someone left me a little David doll... Its even got Cute little doll clothes...” he rumbled. That shadow growing dark, as the giant that was David's brother started to bend down, his free arm reaching out for David.

His first reflex was to yell and try to run away, but from either shock or fear, his legs seemed glued to that spot, only able to widen his eyes in horror as a palm almost as big as his mattress had been to him, pushed against David's front, and telephone pole thick Fingers wrapped around his back, pinning David's arms to his sides, before suddenly lifting him rather dizzily quickly High into the air, to be held infront of Tyler's massive, grinning face.

“I think I'm gonna have a lot of fun with my new David action figure...” Tyler rumbled out ominously, lips pulling back to expose his sharp, well kept fangs, as his tongue slid out to lick hungrily over them. Oh yea... he was gonna enjoy this.

111121.content:
David’s eyes widened at his brother’s rumbling voice, those words making him shiver. He cried out, tiny voice cracking in protest, “Tyler quit fucking around, I’m not an action figure!” He squirmed in those steel-strong fingers, but could not even move a millimeter in any direction.

Tyler growled softly and squeezed, increasing the pressure of David’s chest and waist. He smirked at the sound of his tiny brother wheezing, the air forced out of his lungs, “Good, I think I turned off that annoying little voice…”

David’s eyes bulged out as he was squeezed so mercilessly, his vision going black around the edges as he started to lose consciousness from oxygen deprivation. He gasped for air, squirming weakly and struggling to push those enormous fingers open. David didn’t have the oxygen to even be frustrated or angry at his brother; all he could feel was fear and desperation. He croaked weakly, before going limp in his brother’s grip, completely unconscious.

Tyler smirked and loosened his grip the instant he saw his brother go unconscious, “So fragile, my little toy brother…” He got to his feet and took the limp-bodied male to his room, amazed and amused at how easily he was able to make him pass out. He lazily tossed the six-inch male the short distance to his bed, smirking at the sight of him limp body flopping about on the sheets. Tyler stripped down to his boxers and knelt before the bed, resting his chin against the sheets and watching his brother closely for signs of consciousness.

David groaned and rolled onto his back as his mind finally slipped out of the darkness. He stared at the ceiling above, sighing, “What a horrible dream….” As his mind cleared, David frowned, something not feeling quite right. He curled his fingers and toes against the sheets beneath him, finding they felt much coarser than they should have been, almost as if they were woven with massive threads.

“What the hell…” David muttered. He flinched when a gust of hot air blew over him, immediately sitting up with a start. That tiny drake’s eyes widened when he saw the massive, purple wall of flesh that was his brother’s snout. He immediately scrambled backward a few inches, crying out, “It wasn’t a dream!?”

Tyler chuckled thunderously and leaned forward, his throat rumbling with a purr of pleasure. His brilliant white teeth flashed, his fangs easily as long as David’s arm. A low growl emerged from his throat, growing in volume when he saw David quivering with fear, “No, my little action figure, you’re not dreaming!”

David snapped out of his fear when his brother rumbled his amusement and called him an ‘action figure’ once more. He stepped forward and snarled, “I’m not an action figure, and you know it! I’m your goddamn older brother and I deserve some respect!”

Tyler rolled his eyes, “Oh please, my brother’s huge! You’re like a teeny tiny version of him.” He smirked and poked the drake square in the chest, sending him flat on his ass, “See? I could never hope to knock my brother down with a finger! You’re just a copy, a cheap imitation.” He growled playfully, “A worthless toy, really, I don’t even know why I keep you.”

David got back to his feet and leaped at his brother’s snout, absolutely fed up with the way his brother was treating with him. Not only had he reduced him to this ridiculous size, but he was doing one worse by pretending it wasn’t truly him! He hated Tyler’s mindgames, and this was one of the most aggravating versions yet.

Tyler lifted his snout out of reflex, laughing thunderously when the drake’s momentum carried him over the edge of the bed. David went careening off the edge, his little body slamming against Tyler’s lean pectorals, before falling down, down, down…

Tyler giggled with delight, leaning back after his brother landed, “Definitely not my brother. He’d never dive in my boxers!” He snickered. David’s descent had sent him headfirst along his brother’s smooth belly, until he finally landed…unfortunately for him, Tyler’s loose waistband – an artifact of his scrawny figure – had given way, allowing the top half of David’s body to slide right in, his snout buried against that warm cockflesh. Tyler’s shaft twitched against his brother, especially when he began to squirm. However, instead of taking advantage of the awkward positioning he lifted his brother by the tail, dangling him at eye level.

“You like what you see down there, little doll?” He smirked, giving his brother a wink. David merely snarled and started flailing, his tiny fists pummeling the drake’s snout. Tyler merely chuckled, “Oooh, action fists! I like that feature…Maybe I need to investigate what other features you have…That is, the ones that don’t involve you squeaking at me, or diving into my boxers.”

David’s eyes widened at this, and he immediately stopped his absolutely pitiful assault on his brother’s snout. He had no hope of winning; everything he did only amused his brother. He growled softly at himself, wishing he’d realized it sooner.

Tyler pouted slightly when that amusing barrage of feather-punches ceased, but he knew he could probably get his brother pissed-off enough to do more. That or he could just keep humiliating him until he broke down and started begging. He tossed his brother – shouting obscenities – onto his bed, happy just to shake him up. He nodded, “Oooh, based on some graphic novel, with all those horrible words! Interesting…certainly a cute feature, having one’s action figure curse you out.”

David got to his feet, panting and sore from having been tossed about more than once. He staggered, causing Tyler to burst into giggles, already inspired to observe more, “Realistic reaction to battle damage! I wonder how long it takes for him to heal…” He sneered, licking his lips and flashing his teeth, as if suggesting more pain.

“I swear I am gonna kick your ass when I get back to normal…”

Tyler knelt down before the bed, shaking David up when his massive knees slammed to the floor, his arms landing on the bed shortly after and making the drake bounce up a few inches, “Kick my ass? What a brave, reckless little action figure. Nice little attitude you have there, though I don’t think a scale model like you could kick a mouse’s ass.” He stuck his tongue out at the drake, reaching forward and sweeping his legs out from under him with a finger.

The bed shook beneath David as his brother chuckled at his misfortune. He had to get back his height! He remembered that device his brother had used…But how could he hope to get access to it? He’d have to figure out a way to get away from his brother. But how…He surely couldn’t run away…

David got his chance. A loud knocking at the door caused Tyler to flinch. He rose up, but not before playfully flicking David and sending him sprawling across the bed once more, "You stay right there, you little toy...I've got company, it seems..."

David waited for Tyler to leave the room before taking his chance. He'd be damned if he just sat there and listened to his brother's demands. No, he had to take action! He climbed down from the bed quickly and took off sprinting down the hallway. He had to get to the sizeray while his brother was distracted. It should be simple enough...He just had to use the time he was given by whomever was taking Tyler's 'playtime' away from him.

As David ran toward the living room he looked up and caught a glimpse of who was at the door, eyes widening when he saw that it was...

1111211.content:
“Hey there little guy” David heard a deep, but obviously feminine voice murmur out. The voice was heavily familiar, but from the deep tone that the size difference made it sound like he had trouble placing it until he got around the hallway corner and could see past Tyler to the visitor's identity. Jennifer... No, Jessica. That's who it was. He remembered talking to her a few times, and always having trouble figuring out if she was making fun of him or flirting with him. He always did think she looked somewhat cute, especially with that unique mix of her plush, snow white fur, and the contrasting bright pink color of her hair, but her personality kept him unable to keep track of whether she was being nice to him or making fun of him. Suppose it could have been worse... He didn't even want to think what would've happened if Fang had come over and found him in such a predicament.

Quickly, David started to make his way across the floor, trying to run as fast as he could through the 'open space' between the hallway and the couch, silently pleading that Tyler and Jessica wouldn't notice him. All the while the two were idly chatting it up at the door. Jessica asking if David was around and Tyler trying to make up some excuse of why David wasn't around. If the situation were a bit less 'desperate' David might be laughing at what were obvious attempts for Tyler to try to get Jessica to come in anyway. He'd seen Tyler checking Jessica out once or twice when David had drug Tyler to one of his football games, though he never knew Tyler had any actual interest in her other than a passing glance. More still, it was somewhat surprising that he had gotten the balls to ask her to come in when, at least as far as he told it, David wasn't around. He could only guess that his 'toying' with David in his current predicament had given him a much needed boost of confidence. Not that it made David approve of the situation anymore, he was still going to kick Tyler's ass when he was back to normal.

“Well I meant to just come over and see if David was around...” Jessica would murmur, though the coy tone in her voice portrayed that she wasn't exactly saying no.

“He might come back around later, I'm not quite sure where he went off to, but if you want, you could just hang around till he shows back up.” Tyler offered with a bit more hope evident In his voice than he probably should have let slip. That seemed to do the trick, and with an affectionate pat on Tyler's head, she stepped inside.

“Well aren't you just the adorable little gentlemen...” She cooed coyly as she gave an overly exaggerated swish of her hips when she walked in, even going as far as to let them teasingly bump against Tyler's side, who immediately began blushing heavily in response.

All the while David had been desperately struggling to climb up the side of the couch, using both his hand and foot claws to dig into the fabric of the couch covering to drag himself up along it. With a final grunt he hefted himself over the top of the couch's front and landed, sprawled out on his belly, atop the far left cushion, chest heaving and fingers sore from the effort. He didn't have much time, he could hear the two sets of 'thumps' from Tyler and Jessica's footsteps as they approached the couch. He glanced across the piece of furniture where he saw that large device Tyler had used on him, magnified several times larger than it had been previously thanks to his reduced size. In a final, desperate attempt at salvation he took off running across the couch, a bit unbalanced from the way the cushioned 'ground' sank beneath each of his feet every time he took a step, trying to make it to the device before he was spotted.

Luck or fate, whichever was deciding the outcome, seemed unwilling to cut David a break today as he heard Jessica's loud voice rumble out overhead...
1111211.title: Jessy, the punkish arctic fox!

"I'm gonna take you little toys home!"
11112111.content:
David had hardly any time to dive to the side, wedging his tiny body between the couch cushion and the back cushion, managing to squeeze into the crack and hide. He’d been lucky that – at his size – he’d been hidden by the couch’s armrest from the towering foxgirl. He’d barely escaped her gaze, however, but was lucky that she was more focused on the shiny, futuristic-looking device than the brief flash of blue that was his tiny form diving for safety.

Tyler’s booming voice was muffled by the thick cushion, but David could still clearly hear both giants as they spoke to each other.

“H-hey be careful with that, that’s a very delicate device!”

Jessica hefted the device, cradling it carefully in her fingers. She smirked at Tyler and playfully waved the raygun-like device around in the air, as if she were threatening to break it, “Ohh, IS it? I couldn’t tell…Looks pretty sturdy to me!” She playfully released it from her fingers, causing Tyler to cry out in surprise. She deftly caught it in her other hand, giggling.

“Sheesh, you’re awfully skittish about this! It must be important…” She teased, slowly running her fingers along its sleek design. She gazed at its construction, noting the dial on the side and wondering what it was used for. The purpose of the gun, entirely, was a mystery to her. She had a suspicion, at first, that it was some silly toy. However, now that Tyler had reacted so obviously, she knew it had to be something quite valuable! She needed to get the information out of him.

Tyler whimpered when Jessica aimed the device at him, “H-hey watch where you point that thing!”

“Oh? And why should I?” She gazed at the sizeray carefully, before focusing her aim at Tyler’s chest, “I’ve shot handguns before, shorty. This is no handgun, so it ain’t a lethal weapon.” She growled playfully, “Unless you tell me otherwise? A dark shadow cast over him as the behemoth that was his little brother crouched down over him, hands on his knees and lowered his head down to get a better look at him. “Hell. I had only meant to shave a couple feet off, give you a taste of my size for a while” he rumbled softly, more speaking aloud his thoughts than talking to David “Though this could be just as fun...”

David slowly pushed himself up to his feet, eyes wide with fright as he stared up at the giant that was his brother. All of his bravado was gone, replaced with fear of the enormity of his brother. Tyler could step on him like a bug without any effort at all. Tyler could swallow him whole without a second thought. Any number of things seemed possible now, and none of them good for David.

“C-change me back, damn it!” He yelled up at Tyler, his voice trying to still sound confident and demanding, though his words were studdered from fear, and his barely audible, high pitched voice didn't do anything to help Tyler take him seriously at all.

“Haha” Tyler's voice boomed out, louder than he intended and loud enough to leave David's ears ringing, as he covered his earfins with his paws. “Oops. Sorry, 'big' brother. Guess I'm not used to you being so puny that my voice can hurt you” he teased, clearly enjoying the whole situation. “Though I think we should explore this a bit before I change you back... why squander an opportunity to experience a bug's life” he murmured rather ominously, causing David's eyes to widen a bit as Tyler began to stand back up. “Ill give you a 5 second headstart...”

David started to yell up at Tyler, somewhere between demanding and pleading for Tyler to stop screwing around and to fix this. It wasn't until Tyler had counted aloud to 3, and started raising up one of his huge sneaker covered feet that David finally got the message, and turned to run. He ran as fast as he could off to the side, which was pretty damn fast normally, being a football player and all. But at an inch tall the progress he made was almost laughable. The carpet fibers were like thick grass to David, coming up nearly to his knees as he ran through them, and occasionally he'd trip and stumble, only to shove himself back up to his feet as he desperately made his way deeper into the living room to try to get away from his brother.

“Five...” Tyler rumbled out as his foot slammed down onto the carpet. He was far enough away that the impact was felt, but didn't unbalance David, though it certainly urged him to try and run faster. His head swung back and forth as he tried to think of a plan, though was constantly interrupted as he looked back behind him to see Tyler casually strolling forward at a leisurely, taunting pace. Each footstep causing the thick white sneaker to slam down into the carpet and send a tremor in his direction. David was at a full dead run, and Tyler's casual stroll simply from the sheer width of his stride was easily catching up.

He only had seconds before those footsteps overtook him, and from the look in Tyler's eyes, he wasn't sure whether Tyler would really step on him or not, and was too scared to find out. So he went for the only place he saw that he might help him get away, the couch! It was a low hanging couch, with only a couple of inches of clearance between the floor and the bottom of it. More than enough for the diminutive David to get in, but far too big for Tyler to get in. and David knew from experience the couch was too heavy for Tyler to move, as he used to have to move it for Tyler.

“Fee Fi fo Fum. I smell the blood of a bug sized brother” Tyler would taunt, clearly getting far too into the situation, as he 'chased' after David. Each footstep coming closer... shaking the floor more for the tiny blue dragon...

David was at the home stretch. And Tyler realized where he was going. An annoyed growl filled the air, and the next footstep hit the ground harder, as Tyler increased his pace. David lept forward, trying to dive for the goal, to 'safety' beneath the couch...!
11113122.title: David shrinks all the way down to 1 inch.

"...Fang!"
111132.content:
David snarled and got to his feet after briefly being blinded by his brother’s new device. He stepped forward swiftly and snatched the sizeray out of Tyler’s hands before the smaller drake could even react. He smirked and lifted the sizeray up to inspect it, a playful growl in his throat, “So you try to shoot me with some kind of raygun? What, were you trying to kill me!? That blast looked pretty gnarly, certainly more dangerous than some simple toy!”

Tyler simply stared forward, his eyes locked on something out in the front yard. David glared down at his younger brother, absolutely stunned and angry with his brother for what he thought was an attempt to inflict bodily harm. His own younger brother! David was impatient with Tyler, and didn’t wait long before shoving his brother roughly and demanding, “Well!? What the fuck do you have to say for yourself, you irresponsible little bastard!? This is completely unlike you!” He snarled.

Tyler refused to respond, his eyes wide as he stared at something outside. David felt the ground tremble beneath his feet, but didn’t seem to pay it any mind. He held the sizeray up for Tyler to see, “What does this thing do!?” He shouted angrily, “Were you trying to hurt me, or worse!? I thought I could trust you; you’re my brother!”

The ground shook again, more violently this time. David yelped and stumbled in place, glancing around with confusion. Tyler raised an arm and pointed out of the door, his mouth agape. He seemed to be struggling to form words, but he could only let out a weak whine of fear. David’s gaze finally turned to follow his brother’s. Outside he could see that the view to the street was blocked by one massive wall of fur. A wall of fur!? David’s eyes widened at the sight, and without understanding what he was seeing, he stepped forward, murmuring softly, “What the hell…”

A thunderous, booming chuckle caused David to cry out with surprise. Damn that was loud! But where did it come from…His heart started to pound as he crept forward, before freezing on the spot when he heard a deep voice resonate through the entire house.

“You shouldn’t yell at your little brother for what he did, David…I’m a little surprised myself, but I think this is quite the development. Why don’t you two come out here and show me how you did this?” The voice asked with an obvious tone of amusement.

Tyler stammered softly when David turned to him once more. The purple drake crept forward, gulping nervously, “I…I found a size-changing ray…W-who is that outside, David!? Who did I turn into a giant!?”

David laughed weakly and peered out the front door, gesturing for Tyler to follow him, “Well, after practice I wanted to hang out with…”
111132.title: Tyler's a Terrible Shot!

choices: "Go find some of the other guys!"
"See just how powerful I am!"
1111321.content:
Tyler and David cautiously stepped out onto the front lawn, their necks craning upward to stare at the grinning face of that towering kangaroo. Both drakes felt a sense of dizziness overcome them as they gaze upward into those big, eager eyes, and David especially was disturbed at how playful Marcus appeared to be. He figured that Marcus was easily 100 feet in height, though he couldn’t be sure. He hoped that he was wrong, and even more he hoped that it was some kind of disturbing dream he was having.

“How’s the view from down there, pipsqueaks?” Marcus boomed at both of them, a deep chuckle following that playful question. He shifted his weight and crouched down to get a better look at the tiny drake between his feet, a movement that caused both of them to stumble as the ground trembled beneath them.

Marcus’ eyes lit up at this, and with a grunt he lifted his footpaw and slammed it to the ground, compacting the earth beneath by nearly a foot and sending both Tyler and David flat on their asses.

“Haha, looks like I don’t even know my own strength!” Marcus boomed giddily, clearly amused that he could knock over his former “superior” in strength with a mere footfall.

David got to his feet first and shouted up at Marcus, “Go easy, you’re gonna crack the foundation on my house if you keep that up!”

“Aww, I didn’t mean to almost break your little DOLL-house, David.” He snickered. The roo’s tail thumped heavily against the ground behind him, the tip sweeping sideways and smashing through a house. This caused Marcus to flinch in surprise, before bursting out into thunderous, joyful laughter.

“And I definitely didn’t mean to break that one! That was kinda fun though…”

David and Tyler both watched in growing terror as Marcus looked over his shoulder to watch his own tail smash through the house in the other direction. They could already hear screams from inside both houses, the sound sending shivers up their spines.

“Marcus you have to stop messing around, someone’s gonna get hurt!” Tyler shouted, his voice quivering as he tried to remind the kangaroo that he was destroying people’s homes. He immediately whimpered when the kangaroo turned back to give him a toothy grin, “What’s wrong with a little fun, Tyler?”

David stood closer to his little brother and put an arm around him, trying to stand firm as he shouted up to Marcus, “I don’t think you’re really understanding the problem here, Marcus! I-I mean…this new size is amazing, but you’re ruining people’s lives in the process of having your fun!”

Marcus chuckled softly and shook his head, “I don’t think you quite understand what’s happened to me, David. But I’m willing to show you. Now why don’t you be a good little friend and grab that device you used to grow me, just in case I wanna get bigger.” He smirked.

David hesitated for a moment, before that massive kangaroo slammed his palm down on the ground in front of them, “Don’t make me wait, David! I don’t WANT to destroy your house…” He sneered, “…but I certainly would find pleasure in it.”

David growled softly under his breath before turning back to his house and running inside, plucking the sizeray up from the floor and bringing it outside. He lifted his palm from the ground and held it out expectantly, “Now, give it to me so I can be sure that I am the one in control of my size…I don’t quite trust you with my new stature, you see…”

The cobalt drake’s heart pounded as he stared at that huge, furry palm. Out of the corner of his eye he could see Tyler’s eyes widening as fear took over. David stepped forward and – with great reluctance – dropped the sizeray onto Marcus’ palm. He was rewarded with a smirk and a snort of amusement, “Good. Keep listening like that and maybe I’ll let you hold onto it for me…maybe.”

David gulped nervously and nodded, unable to say anything for a moment. He was terrified and infuriated at the same time. How DARE Marcus do this to him and his brother…or anyone else! He’d become a giant and in a matter of seconds he’d let it go completely to his head. It was a side of his friend that he’d never even imagined could exist.

The cobalt drake finally managed to speak up, “So Marcus,” he began, unable to hide the impatience in his tone, “what exactly are you going to do now?”

Marcus grinned toothily and without warning snatched both dragons up in his fingers, causing Tyler to scream in terror. David wasn’t much better off, though he managed to contain his fear at being suddenly caught in the impossibly strong grip of Marcus’ fingers. Both drakes struggled to breathe for those few moments when Marcus seemed to forget how fragile they were. After standing to his full height and lifting them up to his chest level Marcus arranged both drakes so they were in his palm, instead of being crushed in his grip.

“Well you two are gonna come watch as I…”
1111321.title: Marcus' Overgrown Attitude

choices: 500 feet!
He shrinks down instead!
11113212.content:
“Haha, man this is awesome!” Marcus boomed as his paws smashed down into the street, cracking the cement of the roads apart as if it were nothing more than dried mud, leaving massive, paw shaped craters in his wake. The ground shook and rumbled with each step he took, car alarms began going off well before his paws actually landed near them, and more than a few of the neighbors immediately ran into doorways, believing it to be some kind of an earthquake rather than something as absurd as a giant football player. “I'd say Fee Fi fo Fum, but I have a feeling even the giant from jack and the beanstalk might be a squirt compared to me now!” Marcus rumbled out to the two 'captives' in his left paw, grinning happily down at them and, at least in their opinions, having far, far too much fun with such an absurd situation.

Marcus suddenly paused mid step, the sudden jerking halt of his swinging arms nearly sending Tyler flying out from between his closed fingers and down to the ground below. “Oooh...” They heard the giant Kangaroo rumble out, spying One of the large City Metro buses stopped at one of the bus stops down the street. It was almost comical to see how little people seemed to be reacting to the giant Roo. Psychologists would have a field day talking about how people refused to acknowledge things they considered impossible. It wasn't until Marcus had raised an enormous Kangaroo paw up over the top of the bus that those inside seemed to realize something was wrong... eyes going wide as they looked out the windows to see the giant kangaroo holding his foot over the bus.

“Heehee... I always did like crushing soda cans... wonder if this is the same... “ His deep, rumbling voice boomed out ominously, giving those inside only a few seconds to flee from the bus before his paw abruptly slammed down, sending a small shockwave across the area, and the sound of screeching and warping metal mixing with the dull THUD of the impact, the bus reduced to little more than a crushed pancake of warped metal and fiberglass beneath Marcus's Enormous sole. “Mmm... oooh that feels even better...” He rumbled, licking rather hungrily over his lips in enjoyment. He could feel the glass as it had shattered before the frame began bending inwards, feel the sudden brief drop and the loud BANGS as the tires exploded and the frame crushed downwards into the ground, all in fast forward as the several tons of high powered vehicle, was reduced to rubble just from him stepping on it.

Tyler and David had a different expression on their face, looks of amazement and horror...

What Marcus seemed to not have noticed (or, worse, not have cared) Was that there had still been people inside that bus. So when his foot smashed down onto it... now they were nothing more than red stains smeared into the wreckage... Marcus had crushed almost a half dozen people, and didn't even seem to care!

“Woo man what a rush!” He boomed out loudly, beating one of his fists against his chest as if in 'victory', clearly enjoying his achievement... and what he didn't notice was his fingers slipping open breifly when he did. The two captive dragons watched with wide eyes as if in slow motion, they saw the size ray tumble down from Marcus's fingers, smashing down onto the road below and begin to shake, before a massive beam of red light exploded from it... and smashed right into Marcus's ankle.

“Whoa what the...?!” The already giant Kangaroo rumbled out as he felt his body beginning to tingle again, his paw starting to spread out wider and longer, covering more and more of the bus underneath his sole, his head starting to raise higher and higher into the air, and those huge fingers wrapped around Tyler and David began thickening and expanding around them... Marcus, already at a massive 100 foot height, was growing again...!

“Tyler, how big is that thing gonna make him?! David yelled out in worry as he tried to squirm his way free of the growing roo's grip, Tyler simply staring up at Marcus's face so high above in awe and worry... Tyler didn't know much more than David did at this point, he'd only had the gun for minutes before Marcus had taken it away...and could only guess how much of an effect it was going to have on the already enlarged Marcus.
11113212.title: A Titan's Tremor Testing

choices: ...allowing them to keep searching!
...punish both brothers for going against his wishes!
111132121.content:
David and Tyler both struggled in Marcus’ tightened grip, the growing kangaroo’s fingers slowly expanding, his grip growing too strong upon their relatively fragile bodies. Marcus was barely able to hear their screams of discomfort as he enjoyed the sensation of growth spreading through his body. With a deep chuckle the kangaroo simply crouched down and dumped them unceremoniously upon the grass by his right footpaw.

“How about you pipsqueaks catch your breath while I finish enjoying my new growth spurt…” He smirked and rose to his full height, the kangaroo letting out a thunderous groan of pleasure as he continued to surge upward. It was dumb luck – and not Marcus’ foresight – that had the massive, expanding kangaroo take a step forward, away from the discarded drakes. In their state of breathlessness they would not have been able to escape Marcus’ expanding footpaw, which – both from his widening paw and his widening stance – would have quickly crushed them against the earth as it grew toward them.

THOOM.

Marcus’ first step crashed down hundreds of feet away. His stride had already lengthened considerably, and he was fast approaching his final height of 500 feet. Screams rose up from the houses and vehicles all around them as David and Tyler watched that huge kangaroo test his growing legs. Bits of rubble bounced upon the crushed pavement nearby, and both dragons were fast understanding that Marcus was becoming as terrifying as any force of nature.

Tyler got to his feet and cried out, glancing all around, “We have to find the sizeray! We have to get him back down to his normal size before he destroys the entire neighborhood!”

David growled and got to his feet, his eyes scanning as quickly as Tyler’s, “Forget the neighborhood; at this rate he’s probably gonna only be satisfied with destroying the entire damn city!”

THOOM.

Both drakes stumbled as Marcus slammed his left footpaw to the ground, his second step larger and heavier than before. Tyler fell to the pavement and snarled, his hands stinging from having to catch himself against the sharp bits of crushed pavement.

“Damn him! Where the hell did this sudden zeal for destruction come from, anyway!?” Tyler snarled, glancing back at David as he picked himself up off the ground.

David growled as he kept desperately scanning the grass and pavement around Marcus’ massive footprint-crater, “As if I should know! Just shut up and find the damn sizeray before…”

SCRRRRRRRRUNCH…THOOM.

David’s eyes rose upward to see the source of that new, terrible grinding sound, just before Marcus’ footpaw slammed down once more. He fell to his knees just as he saw the newly-grown 500 foot behemoth turn on his heel – thus grinding the rubble beneath his heel into powder – and step back in their direction. He shivered and tried not to watch as Marcus lifted his footpaw high into the air. His last stride would easily carry him back to where he’d started; right on top of them. David’s pounding heart and frantic mind hardly gave Marcus the benefit of the doubt; if he took that next step he might accidentally crush them beneath tons of fur and flesh.

And just as that massive, dark shadow loomed above, both David and Tyler heard that deep, nearly incomprehensible voice boom from overhead. Marcus’ resonant speech filled their ears, nearly deafening from so close, “What are you two up to? You’re crawling around like ants…” He snickered deeply, “You must be up to SOMETHING…Are you trying to find the sizeray? Because I thought I said I didn’t trust either of you with it…”

THOOM.

David and Tyler both screamed when that titanic footpaw slammed down in the middle of the decimated street, sending them both sprawling on their bellies. David rolled over onto his back and shouted up to Marcus before the kangaroo could continue making such dangerous assumptions, “Y-yeah we’re trying to find it, but we’re just…securing it for you! You won’t be able to find it…but just imagine if someone ELSE found it! You can trust us more than you can trust a stranger, right? We’ll find it and keep it safe for you!” David argued urgently, hoping Marcus would believe him.

Marcus smirked and leaned over, his hands on his hips as he gazed past his enormous, swaying genitals at David, deciding that he would...
111132121.title: A Desperate Search

choices: He shot Marcus....Causing continous growth!
He shot Tyler and grew him to 100 feet!
1111321211.content:
Marcus had a thoughtful look on, carefully scrutinizing the two dragon brothers. "Okay, sounds fair to me. Careful though, I'm watching you two. One wrong move and..." he said as he raised a paw over yet another house and finished his sentence with a heart stopping stomp. Tyler and David remained silently horrified, imagining themselves inside that house. "Oh man that is never gonna get old. I could really GROW to enjoy this," he laughed.

True to his word, the kangaroo leaned down and unclenched his paw, shaking it slightly until Tyler and David rolled out onto the fractured street. They were almost knocked down again as they stood up though, as the huge kangaroo's paws created tiny earthquakes from just walking. While David quickly ran off to try finding the gun, Tyler watched the roo as he started having his own "fun." Tyler was dumbstruck as he watched Marcus rampaging around, using his tail and paws like wrecking balls across the whole neighborhood. Nothing stood a chance against someone that size.

Nearby, David pushed away drywall and bricks as he searched. "Tyler, quick! I found it, over here!" David yelled, breaking Tyler away from his thoughts. Tyler rushed over to the wreckage of a house, their former neighbors, to see how bad the damage was. David held the gun in his hands, which thankfully was still all in one piece. But there was a large dent in the side, and the dial to switch between grow and shrink had been completely removed. There was no choice for bringing Marcus back down to size now, at least not without more time to find the dial and fix it.

"So, we just need to find the dial and fix the size changing gun that we don't understand before Marcus stomps us into the ground like bug. No problem, right?" Tyler gulped, realizing how screwed they were. "Oh god, it's hopeless. We can't shrink him anyway, he'll crush us!"

David snorted in thought. "You know, I don't think he would do it. Marcus wouldn't hurt his friends on purpose," he said.

"We just saw him crush that bus, the people in it, and those houses," Tyler argued. "This isn't the same Marcus. Look at him, he's enjoying it! I think he gets off on stomping around with his paws this big."

David bit his lip and turned to watch Marcus down the street. He sure looked... happy. "Yeah, but I know him better than you. I've been with him on the team for years. He might be getting his kicks now, but he's not evil," David said, though he didn't sound very convinced.

"Do you really want to take that chance David?" Tyler asked, putting a hand on the gun. "There's no choice, we need to grow him. We can figure out how to stop him once he leaves us alone, but we can't do that if we're stains on his sole."

Before David could open his mouth to argue the point, the tremors started getting stronger and stronger, and a gigantic shadow passed over the two tiny dragons again. Marcus smirked down at them as he approached, coming to a stop with one paw covering the whole street, another resting on the roof of a house that creaked under the weight, and his tail draped off in the distance on top of a car. "Good news guys, remember that Trig teacher we all hated, Mr. Driver? Well I found his car, and... boom!" the roo said as he showed off a humongous paw. Jammed between two of his massive toes was the front bumper of a red SUV, and a popped tire was flattened against his paw pad.

With a teasing wiggle of his toes, the warped piece of metal fell from the sky and landed with a clang in front of David. "No more car," Marcus chuckled. "Ohh, you even found the size changing gun. Nice job dude, just what the doctor ordered for a growing boy like me. So go on... grow me!" the kangaroo said, not even trying to conceal his excitement,

It was do or die time. David gulped and looked all the way up at Marcus, then down at the gun in his hands. What if Tyler was right... what if there really was no choice? If Marcus grew again, he might leave them alone long enough to figure out a way out of this mess. But... what if he didn't? What if he just brought them along with him anyway? There had to be a way out of this somehow. Maybe... maybe someone else could grow to Marcus's size! Then he'd have to listen, and that someone could try to talk some reason into him. David closed his eyes and made up his mind, bringing the gun up as he aimed and pulled the trigger.
1111321211.title: A Damaged Sizeray: Found!

choices: Marcus moves into the city...
11113212111.content:
Marcus let out a rumbling growl of pleasure when his former teammate – who was fast becoming more of a “favorite bug,” really – shot him with the sizeray. David hung his head as the beam connected, softly cursing himself for what he’d done. The city was in enough danger and had experienced enough torment beneath those massive kangaroo paws…what would happen now? Tyler shook his head in disbelief, before shoving his brother roughly, “You’re crazy, that’s enough! You’ve given him enough of a shot!”

Marcus smirked at the tiny voice beneath him. He lifted his massive sole and slammed it back down, shaking both brothers up, “Don’t be so eager to tell your brother he’s wrong, Tyler…The biggest guy in town gave him a suggestion, and he followed it.” He folded his arms and grinned smugly at the little drakes beneath him, “And you boys know to follow my suggestions, right? Tyler?” He almost growled the name, the sound of rolling thunder making the name almost impossible to hear properly.

Tyler merely whimpered and nodded, unable to speak after being so firmly admonished by that towering giant. David lowered the ray and put an arm around his brother, whispering softly, “I bought us some time…wait until he leaves to have his ‘fun,’ and we’ll look for the dial, got it?”

Tyler couldn’t bring himself to even nod, so gripped by paralyzing fear that he couldn’t acknowledge his brother. Even the thought of the kangaroo discovering their plan was enough to keep him firmly rooted in place. He gulped nervously, finally letting out a soft whimper and putting an arm around his larger brother, hugging him close. David managed a smile, giving his little brother a firm hug, “Chin up, he’s not so big…”

Tyler managed to squeak a reply, “Speak for yourself…”

Marcus, of course, had heard none of this. Even if their voices had been loud enough to attract the attention of his bus-sized ears, Marcus was too busy enjoying the spreading energy of growth. At his size, the tingling sensation of growth energy spread slowly through his body, radiating outward from his chest and spreading at a delightfully slow pace through his body. The titanic ‘roo – while eager to grow – rather enjoyed knowing that even the powerful, physics-bending sizeray had to struggle to modify his body. It was empowering, even intoxicating.

And so, as that slow, creeping growth energy reached his toes and fingertips, the roo lurched into motion. David and Tyler both were shaken out of their mutual embrace, the drakes stumbling backward as the roo pushed off with his footpaw to begin his slow, lumbering pace. The ground trembled at the slightest shifting in weight, and as Marcus’ massive footpaw lifted into the air the pavement beneath his other paw cracked, crumbled and finally was ground into dust that couldn’t be told apart from the soil that once supported it.

Marcus grew slowly before their eyes, almost imperceptibly at first, even to every tiny eye that looked skyward to the kangaroo that dominated the skyline. Marcus took slow, deliberate steps, wanting to feel the growth as he lumbered along. His stride lengthened, and time seemed to slow for all eyes watching, an effect that would have delighted Marcus if he even acknowledged it existed. And although the perspective and fear of the tiny anthros beneath would surely amuse him, Marcus was even more focused upon his own perspective.

THOOM.

The first step taken. Marcus’ soft chuckle escaped his throat, the sound closer to rolling thunder for the ‘insects’ beneath him. He stumbled slightly, caught off-balance by the unexpected change in stride length. Marcus let himself stumble, his trailing paw sliding forward against the pavement. David and Tyler bolted as those massive toes – easily as wide and tall as a city bus, and slowly growing to make such a comparison obsolete - splayed widely, those heavy toes scouring tons of pavement and soil from the earth and creating vast trenches. Those tiny drakes fell to the grass, staring up from prone positions as that house-crushing footpaw slid forward a good fifty feet. At the end of its journey they could see the roo’s toes suddenly curl, digging savagely into the fragile crust of pavement and soil. And then, it all started again.

David and Tyler could only stare in horror as that trailing footpaw lifted, the ball of his foot crushing deeper into the pavement as the heel lifted, that heavy calf muscle flexing with enough force to drive the kangaroo’s toes another ten feet deeper into the soil, compacting it so firmly that the soil was nearly hard as rock. CRUNCH. At the very moment before that paw lifted, David and Tyler both could hear something deep beneath the soil crack. Bedrock, Marcus’ toes had split the bedrock deep beneath the soil.

With the ground trembling beneath their rumps, David and Tyler looked at each other, both realizing that something had to be done. Tyler spoke up, “Look at him, he’s already gained, like, fifty feet! And we don’t know how big he’s gonna get, without the dial on the sizeray!”

David growled and shoved his brother, “You think I don’t know that!?” He nearly roared, tensions heightened by the sensation of the roo’s every motion making the earth tremble. He got onto all fours and started crawling through the grass, “Look, just shut up and save your talk for later, we have to find that dial and reverse this before he gets too big to shrink!”

Tyler nodded quickly and began the search, though the outlook seemed as grim as the growing shadow from their massive friend.
11113212111.title: Monolithic Marcus: The Beginning

choices: But David and Tyler arrive with the repaired sizeray!
Marcus continues his pleasuring, uninterrupted!
111132121111.content:
“Haha, this is fuckin’ amazing!” Marcus boomed at no one in particular, feeling perfectly alright with talking to himself as he walked along. Just the sensation of putting on a few feet of height every second was enough, at first, to give him pleasure. But as the swelling titan approached the city he found that the novelty of simply walking at that deliberately slow pace was not enough. His lengthening stride had been a brief curiosity at best; now he was more interested in his growing strength.

Without a single thought as to who might be beneath him, Marcus increased his pace, turning a slow lumber into a steady, stomping pace. What had been a rather inconvenient, but constant trembling due to Marcus’ smooth, rolling steps now became a sharp, jarring quake every few seconds. Vehicles within the immediate area bounced on their shocks with each step and the pedestrians – those poor sole-fearing souls – fled the titan’s paws in all directions. The quick-witted, the observant and the clairvoyant made their escapes easily, either ducking into alleys or side roads, or taking refuge in the subway tunnels beneath. The rest, well, the rest were forced into a life-or-death game of chance, a game they had no control over. Where the footpaw landed was something they no hope of bending. And so they mindlessly ran, praying they would not be crushed to paste beneath that massive sole. But even the “lucky” didn’t escape entirely, as the great dust clouds the kangaroo kicked up hid the foot-paw shaped craters from their eyes. Many of them ran headlong into them, where the occasional rift into the subways beneath would swallow them up.

Safe as the smartest of anthros thought they were, it would not last long. Because, as Marcus grew, so did the pressure he put upon the earth beneath him. Each step carried an exponentially growing amount of tonnage with it. The shockwaves the propagated with each step grew in radius, and it would not be long before the entire city was feeling those jarring footpaws, and then no structure would be safe, neither above nor beneath the earth.

As for Marcus, he was rather enjoying the increase in pace. “man... that tasted kinda weird. Or maybe I just had too many” he groaned softly, idly rubbing at his head with his palm, eyes sliding closed as he felt a new wave of dizzyness spread across him... “oooh man I think I'm redefining tipsy...” he groaned out tiredly... seemingly totally oblivious to what had Tyler's eyes spread wide. He watched as Davids looming, muscular form began to pull in on itself, his taunt, skintight shirt starting to loosen and hang limp on him, waist no longer filling his work out shorts to the brim, instead leaving them hanging limply across his diminishing tush. Quicker and quicker David pulled inwards, arms sliding upwards and no longer long enough to reach the ground with him laying on his front. His legs, which normally hung off the armrest of the couch were now pulling past it and tugging inwards in mirror of his head... and barely half a minute after David had finished guzzling down the beer, Tyler could no longer see his formerly towering brother...

Tentatively, Tyler started to step forward, slowly reaching a paw out to poke at David's shirt, only to reflexively recoil when he saw a small bulge shift around underneath the fabric. Standing there and watching with rapt attention as the bulge stumbled and shifted its way towards the collar of his shirt, and out of it stepped a miniscule, doll sized version of his brother. Stark naked, obviously half aroused (Which was no surprise to Tyler, knowing full well that David got easily 'aroused' when drunk) and barely 8 inches tall.

“whoa... that felt weird...” David murmured drunkenly.

Tyler struggling not to burst out laughing at the formerly deep, rumbling tone of David's voice reduced to a laughably high pitched squeak. David stood with his bare tush facing Tyler, staring at the back of the couch, his head slowly raising to look over the cushioned expanse of the backrest curiously, alcohol-addled brain struggling to make sense of what he was seeing, before he heard a deep and (to him) Rumblingly loud voice growl out “oh David... over here...” Which caused him to turn around and find himself staring at a massive billboard sized grinning, purple fleshed muzzle staring down at him...

“Hey 'bro'... I think its time for a little-”

115.content:
“Oh pick up you motherfucker!” Tyler shouted at his phone. It was late, and he was walking home from his shop. He had classes tomorrow morning, and the fucking rat had never shown up to collect the keys.

His phone rang out. For the fifth time in three hours, there was no answer .“Filthy piece of SHIT!” Tyler spat as he stuffed his phone angrily into his pocket. Well, this is just great then isn’t it, he thought bitterly to himself. The new Trimester was starting, so he wasn’t going to risk pissing off the wrong professors by skipping the first class. But the damned rat who was meant to fill in while Tyler was at classes was avoiding him. Tyler ran through the next day in his head. Two in the afternoon. His store would be closed until he got there at two in the afternoon.

Tyler sighed in resigned frustration. Well, weekdays weren’t exactly the busiest, particularly mornings. But that was no excuse. His store was doing alright, on turnover it was turning a small prophet, but the bank overdraft was squeezing him. He couldn’t afford to have the store sit locked during perfectly good business hours. And this wasn’t the first time the rat had just wandered off.

He would have to get a more reliable assistant, he thought to himself as he cut through the parks and side streets that offered the most direct route home. There was no public transport to speak of, and a car was the rejected half of the car/discretionary spending dichotomy. So he would always have to hike the fifty minute walk to and from his shop, regardless of the weather.

And right now, the weather was looking ominous. It was much darker than it should have been in at that time in the evening, the scattered street lamps already the primary source of light as impenetrable sheets of dark clouds raced overhead. It wasn’t raining, but the constant distant rumbling and occasional flicker of lightening reminded him that things can change.

The warm air was mostly still, save for the occasional small, sharp local bursts that swept a layer of dust and leaves several feet across the street. There was an energy in the atmosphere, and everything about it suggested that Tyler was walking through the calm before the storm.

The purple drake picked up the pace, distantly adjusting his shirt as if to confirm that it was the only thing between him and the elements. He was still a good mile from home, so if it did start raining, there was going to be no escaping it.

A car slowly passed Tyler as he walked down the sidewalk of the seemingly endless residential estates. The purple drake wasn’t sure on exactly what happened next, but a sudden sound was the first thing that registered.

1152.content:
Tyler didn’t hear the deafening roar of the explosion so much as he was simply aware of its presence. It happened in an instant – one moment he was walking as normal, the next he was instinctively trying to pick himself up off the street, the roars of the world around him merely a muffled echo that sounded as if he was hearing from afar.

Between these moments his mind had only registered a handful of vivid tableaus. Here was a brilliant flash of white registering on his peripheral, followed by the thousand pieces of the white weatherboard house as it burst out in every direction, an enormous fountain of dirt erupting from where its foundations once lay. Then there was the scene of falling debris raining down from everywhere as he lay stunned on the road.

Tyler finally found his feet, but swayed uneasily as he witnessed the tail end of the devastation. Chunks of wood and metal rained down around him as the thick plume of dust slowed and settled, starting to swallow the scene as it descended. Traces of a far wall slowly buckled and collapsed outwardly onto the house next to it. And then there was nothing left of the structure at all, leaving only a settling pile of debris where it once stood.

Tyler took several uneasy steps backwards as seemingly the last of the debris plonked on the ground around him. It was a miracle that nothing had hit him, he realised as his senses began to return. The scene felt surreal, like a dream. He didn’t believe he was actually standing there.

Eventually a thought formed in his mind “What if someone was in there?” His instinct was to run from the scene, but the thought of possible survivors dragged him in, as unlikely as it would have first appeared. He coughed and squinted his eyes as the dust enveloped the space around him. The streetlights seemed unable to penetrate through the cloud as he stumbled towards the rubble in near darkness.

“Hello?!” he shouted ahead of him. Or at least he thought he did. He barely even heard his muffled voice through the ringing in his ears. He fumbled through the wreckage with near zero visibility, realising that it was a largely helpless, and very probably stupid undertaking to attempt.
He was about to leave the scene when…

11521.content:
A surge of adrenalin flowed through Tyler as he spotted what looked to be a white foot paw sticking out from underneath a pie of loose wood and broken plaster sheets. Tyler coughed through the thick dust as he crawled towards the foot, and began digging it out of the lose debris.

It soon became apparent that whoever owned the foot was either dead or unconscious. It remained limp and unresponsive as Tyler went through the gruelling cycle of trying to pull the person free, before removing some more debris, to trying to pull them free again. Minutes felt like hours and the purple drake frantically worked through the hazy darkness. He was not strong or fit, but that all seemed irrelevant now. His fatigue went unnoticed as his heart pounded harder than it ever had. There was only one aim, one goal to achieve.

Eventually Tyler’s efforts yielded results, as the body loosened itself under whatever was pinning it down, allowing Tyler to pull the body out from under the remaining rubble.

It was a rabbit. A very small male rabbit wearing dusty boxers and a loose, slightly bloodied tank top. A kid? Tyler asked himself as he picked the body up. No, not a kid. Just a very short rabbit, a good few inches shorter than himself, and light enough for Tyler to lay over his shoulder as he hurriedly carried him out to safety.

He lay the dusty white rabbit down on the sidewalk once he had reached it. He channelled all his first aid training he was taught in high school gym class all those years ago. Check his breathing. The rabbit wasn’t breathing. Hold his wrist like this to check a pulse… Tyler moved his hand into several positions. Shit, he couldn’t feel a pulse.

“OK, shit, ok…” Tyler tried to calm himself down. He could do this, he had to do this. he just had to focus and remember what to do next. The rabbit was still warm, so that must have been a good sign. But who knew how long the rabbit was out for? It felt like Tyler was digging him out for ages. If he wasn’t breathing all that time…

Focus. What was he meant to do first? Mouth to mouth or chest compressions? He stood paralysed for a precious moment as he tried to remember. “Fuck it!” he shouted to himself. Just do one, then the other.

He went through three cycles of chest compressions and mouth to mouth before the rabbit spluttered weakly back to life.
“Oh thank God…” Tyler gasped as the rabbit animated in his hands. Was he conscious? His eyes stayed closed as he coughed in spasms. The dust couldn’t have been helping, but Tyler had no way of controlling that.

“Hey” he said to the rabbit as he slapped him gently on the side of the face. “Hey, are you awake man?” he asked. The rabbit fluttered his eyes open, but it took a moment before he focused on anything. Tyler smiled as he looked at him. “uh, hey man…” the purple drake said, giving him an awkward little wave. “Uhm… How are you feeling?”

The rabbit panted heavily as he desperately sucked in air. Tyler suddenly realised he was doing the same. He was absolutely exhausted, only now becoming aware that his dry mouth felt full of dirt. The rabbit tried to speak but only groaned.

“It’s ok dude, you’re goanna be alright now, just take your time” Tyler reassured the rabbit, shaking with relief and elation. A realisation settled in on him. Hey, he just saved this guy’s life. He was a hero. They would probably give him a medal. This was probably goanna be a big deal.

The rabbit took a moment longer to recover, his breath settling as his own daze cleared.
