1223211111111211112.content:
Roaring and howling in fury, the mass of muscle looks obsessively for the amulet.

"WHERE IS IT!?!" The rough voice howls again.

A dainty light, squeak, comes from the door as there is a knocking at the door to the behemoth's room. The vaulted ceilings with expert acoustics probably makes the howling even more loud, echoing it around the mansion. Both of his parents at work like they always are. His mother, on some jet to some mega-conglomerate building and his father in a board meeting miles away. "WHERE IS MY AMULET!!!" he snarls with his sharp-teeth muzzle. Flipping his bed over in fury.

Breaking protocol, the mousy maid with curly hair entered the room. "Master Fang. Please what is the matter? I am sure we can find what you are looking for." Probably thinking he easily left it someplace and forgot.

Down to his underwear, the muscles on his black furred body rumbled with power, "Palmetto!!! What did I say about entering my room without my permission."

"Sorry," she cried, "sorry so sorry Master Fang. Shielding her eyes and looking for the doorknob to shut the door.

"I was searching for it all day yesterday at school after practice and I've search high and low for it here!"

"The staff had to clean this whole floor Thursday. Your father said he wanted the house looking perfect for a prospective new client."

Throwing the door off its hinges to the floor that was covered with the mess from his earlier tantrum. "WHAT!?! You were in my room!"

"Sorry Master Fang but we had to clean everywhere. You had so much trash and rubbish about, it was the only way to get the smell out. We even had to put in new rugs."

Fang did not care there were new rugs. He didn't even notice that his room was pristine and clean. The world revolved around him. How dare they touch his stuff; the absolute nerve. the audacity!!!

"You stole my preciously chained necklace, the one with a celtic knot."

"Your what? I'm sorry sir, but we cleaned out everything. Anything that was considered trash or not befitting the standards of Master Fang was thrown out."

"That was not trash... Standards? What standards?"

"Well you set them so high, Master Fang. Anything that was cut, or torn or under $100 dollars was thrown out. We can get you another piece of jewelry."

"NO!" he bubbled with lower fury, "there was nothing else like that, it could never be replaced."

Bowing her head, her tears streaming down her face, not wanting him to see her face, "My grandest most sincere apologies, sir. Had we but known a mere silver necklace had such sentimental value. We didn't know. Please Master Fang don't be too cross with us."

Crossing his arms above his massive chest as they lifted up and down while he breathed, he watched her weep, taking in all the moments of her suffering. He sneered at the torment he caused. His mind raced with alternative scenarios, like an Interactive Story, picking and choosing what to do next.

"You are dismissed! Leave me at once!" He got dressed, already seeing the effects of what would happen while being away from his precious amulet for so long...

It started years ago, quite honestly the only gift he ever received from his father when he was younger was the silver chained necklace adorned with a celtic knot. Though at the time, unbeknownst to anyone this amulet was magical and gave the wearer untold amounts of power and strength. The amulet lost in time was received by his father on a business trip from the British Isles. It was considered a valuable heirloom and was given to Fang's father for payment for one of his earlier real estate deals. His father didn't see it that way, and bulldozed the castle that was there to make way for another metropolitan success.

Before anyone knew of Fang the brutish college football star, he was also a little nobody. Rough with everyone he met, spoiled, not a real friend in the world. His parents practically abandoning him to be raised by the house staff. He grew angry and resentful at his parents and the world. He was quiet, reserved and picked on everyone just for being a wolf. Wolves in this world were feared by all with tales and stories of them being treacherous and evil. You try going through kindergarten, with all the fairytales they tell involving wolves being the bag guy at every turn. They made him out to be the bag guy and he bore the label well, like a Scarlet Letter to be seen by all. Though that didn't last long as he may have been fast and quick-witted for his age, he was still scrawny and small and in the mad world we live in there is always gunna be someone bigger than you. Another bully, an alligator came to the school, a new kid that was just as confused and upset, put Fang in his place. Losing his first real right, a T-bone over his blackened eye, his father gave him that silver chained celtic knot to raise his spirits.

Though over the first couple of days, several weeks really, Fang's family began to see a change in him. Growing bigger than all of the other kids and only in middle school, he learned his place real quick in this dog eat dog world. Bouncing between private schools for his rough, ill-mannered behavior, it was finally encouraged to put that 'growing boy' to good use in sports where his feats of pummeling and tackling could be put to good use. Fang became the wolf everyone respected out of fear. Fang knew by then how the celtic knot worked and during sometimes when he took it off for a couple of days his overall mass would decrease and would go down. He liked being big so he wore it most times, hidden under his shirt. Obviously visible in the locker room showers with the guys, but no one asked questions. It was his secret to his success that he guarded carefully... That is until now...

Stomping at the door, displaying his rage, "Master Fang don't forget you have your world science class at 11 and football practice at 6," a male frog in butler attire, ribbits while opening the door to allow Fang to exit.

"Yeah yeah," he dejects, waving dismissively out of habit, not by social norm. Taking his hot red convertible today, he needs to find his amulet. Hopefully it hasn't been to long and sold to some idiot that doesn't know what kind of power it possesses.

Checking a few, donation place, he wouldn't be caught dead in he stumbles into the old thrift shop in little Chinatown on the outskirt of uptown. Many tigers and lions roamed about here and he had to be extra careful. It was practically enemy predator territory and he was in the heart of it. Knowing full well he'd have to reserve his strength just so he could get his amulet if there was the slightest chance it fell into the wrong hands though he hoped he wouldn't have to come to that.

Dawning some shades over his piercing gold yellow eyes, he approached the store front as low-key as an animal of his size could. He was still plenty big probably bigger than that cobalt dragon on the same football team as him, but another day or two and he could lose his advantage thought Fang.

The inside was dark with minimal lighting, incense smoke streams finding his way to his nose was rendering any of his natural senses fairly useless at the moment. He didn't have to smell though, just see it and he could make it his again. He could sense it though but it would still need to be close though. He had be in possession of the magical celtic knot for so long that it had formed a bond with him, not that it could choose who it bonded with but something that happened over time. Reaching the glass display case with the jewelry and the valuables. Scanning the box, his sense or instinct directing him to an empty space, his body yearning to reunite with the amulet, grew shocked and he was unexplainably loosing strength and even on his knees collapsed, one could still see his bulk heaving up and down with each breath.

Out of the back behind semi-sheer veils, a jaded tiger woman with an oriental headfur style and fan emerge from the back, the incense smoke trails moving away from her. Her eyes were daggers falling upon him, but Fang too weak to see the look.

Waving her friend covering most of her face, her tiger eyes sharp and quick. Speaking coyly, "So you must be without magic that has been spent..."

Cryptic and not in the mood for cheeky gals, "Piss off lady, magic or no magic that amulet was mine, where is it. I can feel that it was here..." His voice was meek, but a gravely serious tone persisted.

"You are dealing with forces you can not dare comprehend lupe one."

"Cut the crap, where is my amulet?"

She waves her fan rabidly with a quick laugh, "You sound so sure I have your answer, yet you have no answers yourself. You are reeking of magic wolfkin and I can only tell it is of no use... Your kind is stubborn enough. Leave before things grow beyond mess you have already made."

Trying to pull himself up the glass case with weakened strength but with re-ignited fury and purpose, "I can't stop. I must find it. Its means everything to me."

Turning her back to him, "You didn't have anything to begin with."

Using all of his strength he put his paw to her collar and turned her around in a quick motion, making sure she was looking at him when he said, "I am not nothing..." Collapsing and losing his grip, he fell to the floor of the dark shop.

Closing her fan and whispering, "Maybe you aren't after all..." Clapping the silk fan in the air she disappears in jade green smoke as figures emerge from the shadows. Large tigers with expressionless faces each take an arm of the still large wolf and drag him deeper into the shop...

Hazy and feeling weak, but not so bad as before he feels his shirt has been taken off and around his neck another silver chain. A slight elation, it was just a dream that suddenly shatters as it is not of a celtic knot but of a Chinese dragon biting another dragon in a never ending loop.

"It is called wisdom's cycle. Meaning one thing feeds another while another thing feeds on it. One is all and all is one. One cannot survive without the other while the other cannot survive without it. The give and take. I believe the terms in the street is 'dog eat dog'."

"What am I in a lecture hall," Fangs says while looking up. A younger tiger with a similar comparison to the tiger he spoke with in the shop, but her eyes and the way she carries herself are different.

"No a shrine, a wellspring for magic..."

Looking around he sees multiple stone statues of various creature and sizes, torches glowing cyan colored fire. A singular gold statue in the middle with a sort of alter in the enclosed space. He couldn't see an exit to speak of other than the look of stars and moonlight from the skylight letting more light into the room. "Magic? That's not real..."

A voice echoed, "O but it is." A laugh took form behind him as the tiger woman before with the silken fan, he backed away from her towards the younger tiger girl in a half kimono and skirt. Moving back he noticed he wasn't nearly as bulky as he used to be, all of his muscle practically gone, how long was he out for, Fang wondered. "So it seems the Purification ritual was a success."

"Yes, the young tiger said softly, "he did live through it. His bond with the celtic magic has been cut."

Shaking his head, "Celtic magic? You mean my knot, my amulet, there was nothing wrong with it on me."

Waving her fan let a torrent of wind flush around the room putting out the torches. "Fool, you could have died..." Letting the words sink into the darkness, there was movement from behind him. After a couple of moments, the flames seemed to reignite slowly and all at once, the young tiger girl appeared in an awkward pose with sweat upon her brow. "You had become dependent upon it, eating away at the manasource of the world for years. You were a servant to the amulet and its base desires, not your own."

Realizing he was a bit caught up in the amulet, he didn't realize how he was revolving his life around the amulet for all these years. Remembering all the things he had done, all the pain and suffering he had caused, the amulet amplified his most wicked of traits. His head pinged and panged with inverted memories of the past, he was now on the outside looking in at what a monster he had truly become. The young tiger went to him trying to hold and comfort him.

"Leave him Leena. He must suffer through his own failures," the tiger lady snapped, returning her fan to its habitual position that covered half her face. Though hesitant, the young tiger girl patted him again on the back and withdrew to the outer circle. Tossing and turning, he felt the acts of his evilness take form in front of him.

As what looked like a giant ball of slime it rumbled and sprouted into what he looked like days ago. The big wolf behemoth that he used to be... Everything else seemed to disappear in the room except him and the monster.

He could sense a fear that always existed, but taking action now and over twenty years of fear, rooted him to the floor. The truly monstrous gloop took on a wolf-like face slushing and sloshing into a muzzle with words spitting out with pops. "Failure... Weakling... Pathetic... Unworthy... Weak..." Trying to cover his pointed ears with his paws, he wanted it all to go away like an awful dream, no nightmare that he could wake up and his troubles be gone...

The dark blob laughing otherworldly was disturbing to say the least and was beginning to make his way towards Fang one step at a time...

He was trying everything to convince himself it wasn't real... He was trying so hard to hide from his fears... He couldn't do anything...

A lightness on the breeze whispered gently in his ear, the voice of the young tiger girl, "Be strong, remember who you are..."

Her voice faded as soon as it had come. Be strong? How could he ever be strong against that thing. Nothing could stand up against it and take it down. He was the quarterback and that was a linebacker gunning for him. The way he could console himself was to try and think of things that made him happy. Though few and seldom he found self remembering the time he was on vacation with his family. The last time his family really did anything together where he was free to be himself. No expectations, no threats and no fears...

But ever paradise has its hiccup or two. While playing around the island, he found little whirlpools and puddles that were losing their water from the tides changing from high to low. He found gasping for the life in the sea was a pair of fish stuck in a puddle quickly evaporating from the Sun's mighty rays. Finding his bucket, he tried desperately to try and move both of the fish back in the ocean. But the pail was far too heavy. Soon the bucket's handle broke forcing the fish back into their small puddle that would surely be their doom. Taking it upon himself this young wolf pup, he went back and forth, back and forth refilling the puddle with water so the fish would live. After what seemed like an hour, he was growing tired, his energy mostly spent, the breath nearly out of him he still continued on for several more trips. Curious what their son was doing, his parents wondered over to ask what he was doing that was tiring himself out. Explaining as best as he could heaving in and out with deep breaths dragging the bucket filled with water. Soon his father put the fish in the bucket and returned them to the sea. Seeing them go in, he collapsed in his mother's arms and he had a long nap... For the next couple of moments, he could see images from over the years of the rare acts of kindness that helped to cover up his fears. He was afraid of being alone... He was afraid of not being strong enough... He was afraid of losing his family...

But more importantly throughout that fear, he was able to survive and overcome all odds. When he was playing football, when it was the last few minutes, and the enemy near to a field goal to win the game, he passed through the walls and acted when it really mattered. He persevered with his inner strength, and though not measured in pounds or inches, it was worth more than all the trophies, all the fake friends and all the things he possessed.

He looked out at the slimy wolf ready to engulf with his golden-yellow eyes beaming with determination and the knowledge that he can be stronger without all the muscle and bulk. It was just a thing that was really nothing, not him. He was something worth while and the dark goo shrank writhing in agony, disappearing entirely from his sight. As it did the torches, returned and everything else in the room returned looking clearer.

He saw the young tiger girl with joyful expression upon her face as he ran up to her and hugged her, lifting her up and twirling her around. He felt lighter, better and, well, he felt like himself, his true self that had been hidden away for so long.

After what seems like hours, the jaded tiger lady separated the two, putting her fan between them. "That is all well and good, but we have more matters to discuss. For instance, the amulet you activated has been released out into the world is on the brink of creating such an uproar that all the magic rings cannot undo."

Looking around and then pointing at himself, "You mean its not over?"

Rolling her stern eyes, with the wave of her fan, a transparent globe of the world was floating above them rotating as she pleased. "Britain, China and Egypt, the magic capitals of the world are facing a crisis that you caused and it can only be undo by you. The areas of the world started out bright, but they soon began to fade and dim drastically. The Celtic Knot has been creating holes in the manasource creating an imbalance in our world. I had a feeling one of the Americans would manage to end the world."

Thinking in horror of random black holes eating up the world and he was the cause, "Well, how do we stop it? What can I do?"

"That amulet has already been activated twice, and being fueled at a rate twice as powerful as before."

Confused and sick to his stomach about what he has done, "How could an amulet cause so much trouble?"

"It wasn't meant for the way you were using it, and especially not an outsider."

He looked hurt, "Great, being a wolf has made things worse for me again."

The young tiger girl put her hand on his shoulder, "She doesn't mean it like that."

The tiger lady nods, as she flicked the wrist with her fan, as the globe changed to what looked like a feral wolf creature, "wolves were nomadic and traveling the lands and while animals have always been conduits of magical energy, over the past two thousand years, animals' sense have grown duller and inhibited through their needs and wants. Only those that still practice the arts and belong to such lineage retain their magic sense. My granddaughter Leena has been under my care since she could walk. The magic sense skipping her mother entirely and like most animals, their magic sense dying out even earlier. Foxes, cats and raccoons are what we thought were the only three nomadic animals that could move between the three different magic rings of fire, water and air. We have never seen a wolf with magic sense for quite some time." Images of random animal species moving about the air and then disappearing one by one.

"Then why me and why now?" asked the dark furred wolf, cupping his hand with Leena's on his shoulder.

Waving the fan, letting the images fade away entirely, the tiger lady walked to where the golden statue was with the alter. "Although the magic capitals of the world have tried to find the Celtic Knot, like most magic artifacts created in the time before time, they are untraceable without the proper knowledge. Such knowledge lost ages ago. You have the magic sense attuned to it, only you can find it now."

"The Celtic Knot was in your shop, didn't you know what it was?"

"No, it hid its genuine intention from me, but it willed me to give it to its current owner, a Tyler Matthews. And to make matters worse a dragon. You must find this purple dragon."

"But I don't know who that is where to find him?"

"You waste your time with these questions, you must go, find the Celtic Knot and destroy it before it can destroy the world." the tiger lady bayed, fluttering her fan and with another wave of her fan, everything around him disappeared and he was back in the dark antique thrift shop. He was still shirtless, and not big and muscular like he was hoping though he looked to be lean and wiry. The Wisdom Loop still around his neck, he began walking out...

An old panda popping his head out from behind the curtain, thinking where did those crazy kids come from.

"She's not really a Queen, she's the head of our magic family back in China."

Feeling his hand, hold his necklace. "So this Wisdom Loop thing, its Chinese so its of Air."

"So what does this do exactly? Why do I have it and not you?"

"Since the darkness created in you from having the Celtic Knot for so long, its a darkness that has stained your heart and your soul. "Air is pretty cool, it feels like its better than the other two elements already."

It is the balance that helps keep nature and the flow at peace." Taking off the amulet, didn't exactly do anything for his older brother, heck he could still grow without it. And be honest, pfft when he lied to everyone that walked through his door. He sighed; bringing himself down was not the way to get ready for Jenny. She deserved better...

He couldn't decide between the large sport polo or the plain striped tee. What it was going to come down to was what he felt comfortable in. Getting it off was kind of hard. His arms felt a bit bigger around, but he didn't do anything to make them grow. He shrugged as he just unbuttoned it and shook it off. Imagine if he had wings, o boy that would make clothes shopping impossible. He didn't envy anyone with those kinds of problems, though they probably save a killing on car insurance. Though, having wings and flying around above everyone did have a nice feel to it, no one could really ignore you and you could be alone if you wanted. Trying on the light-colored tee, it was alright, but it was pretty boring. It didn't have any oomph to it. Putting on the sliming dark navy-colored sport polo actually felt kind of nice. The material was cool to the touch, even if he was having difficulty fixing in the back. The shirt was bunching up and he couldn't very well fix it as his arms made it difficult to bend certain ways. Man! this bulk was a chore to get along with. He was growing frustrated, wiggly trying to make the fabric unbunch and go down all the way.

"Here let me get that," a voice said from behind him, his back facing the door. He could feel the other hands go up, feeling his back scales and fix the bunching.

"Thanks a lot, I wanted to put on something nice and I went and got myself stuck." He gave hearty laugh at himself. When the job was finished, he turned around to give a proper welcome. He turned to see Jenny in all her scaley goodness. She looked amazing for just getting off a work shift. Did she do something with her headfur, she looked positively beautiful today.

"O no problem, the bottom part of your shirt was caught on your tag, you should really go tagless. It'd save you a lot of time with that kind of fabric.

"I'll keep that in mind," his voice box crumbling under the embarrassment of having her help him with his clothes. If he was getting graded, he'd surely get an F so far. "So Jenny how was work?" said Tyler trying desperately to make a conversation happen as best he could.

"O the usual. Coffee beans don't make coffee themselves," she said with a small laugh. Tyler wanted to show off a bit began taking some heavy boxes down and putting them on the floor. He was playing it 'cool' looking interested while moving the boxes. His flexes looking showed off well in the sport polo. "You know I work at that coffee place over by the Newton Museum. I heard they remodeled their indoor conservatory with all the star lights and constellations... You know space stuff..." Oh my goodness, Jenny was flirting with me. Was she trying to drop off hints about want to go, together. Tyler was very ecstatic about the whole thing.

"Yeah, thought I saw something on TV bout that. Didn't some actor do a voice over for it?"

You looked through her purse, "I think you're right. I had a flyer in here somewhere. He did a lot of stuff on the DDC..."

"Jones Earl Jameson?" Tyler gathered.

"That's the one. He does lots of voice overs. Anyhow I was wondering if you weren't too busy tonight or tomorrow night, I don't suppose you'd want to go with me?" she asked sounding both interested and disinterested at the same time.

WHAT! .... Did THAT just happen, thought Tyler. When you look this good, the girls ask you out apparently. Way to keep your cool, now keep this up and you'll have a heck of an evening. Rolling his shoulders from the heavy lifting he says nonchalantly, "Nah sounds good, was just bringing these boxes done for tomorrow."

"O that's sweet, bringing down those heavy boxes for Tyler. You're a good brother."

There it is, that's it. After all that, she still thinks I'm David. David doesn't certainly sound like me or David doesn't really look at me. But really he's cobalt and I'm purple. Though I'm a deeper, darker purple now you'd think people could tell us apart. Apparently, people probably think the same about big guys, they all look alike and you want to say that you've at least 'been' with a guy like that, just to brag to your friends. No wonder David comes how with different woman all the time. He can't keep one long enough. Man, being this big was a real drag, Tyler thought. It was nothing like he thought it would be. This was going awful, this was worse than worse he sighed. This was ten times worse than crumby, and he hated things that were just regularly crumby. But than something snapped in Tyler...

At a loss for words, he felt like he could never be anything other than trapped behind David's shadow. He couldn't escape it, he felt as though he had closed his eyes and every time he opened them, nothing. Just surrounded by an empty void. The exact way he was feeling. He couldn't describe it but he felt like he was falling. What's the use? He even lost Jenny to his brother, and he's still asleep in his room, Tyler could bet. Maybe it was time for a nice long rest too...

In the comic shop, an eerie blue light came from the amulet, blinding Jenny and anyone that walked past. It was coming from that heart-like gem in the middle of the celtic knot amulet and when Jenny could see again she was horrified as what she thought she was looking at a big, tall hunky dragon that could sweep her off her feet, but now the eyeholes were vacant with the body being covered in a black-like goo that was covering the who she thought was poor David. She thought she might freeze, like a deer in a headlight, but when the blob let out an otherworldly dirge like cry, she ran out the door and bumping right into Ned.

"Hey watch where you are going," said the crane feeling for his glasses on the pavement. "I need to have a little one on one with that dragon in there that calls himself Ty." Finally finding his glasses as they were shoved at him by the figure that bumped into him. A, a girl, he was speaking with a girl thought Ned, his glasses getting foggy.

"Ty..! Tyler?!? You mean that's Tyler?!?" the girl panicked and pointing into the comic shop as a large blobby dark mass was heading in their direction.

"Hey that was my discovery, o geez," he reacted trying to get up from the ground, both of them running down the parking lot.

Catching their breaths as they hid behind a car, Jenny was bewildered by the unreal events that were taking place. The dragon of her dreams just turned into a glob of black goo and was now trying to eat her. Worst date ever she thought. "Are you telling me that big dragon in the shop was sweet little old Tyler?!?"

Trying to stop hyperventilating, he didn't want to pull out his inhaler to reinforce the stereotype but his coke-bottle glasses were so foggy from being this close to a girl, this was the best and only date he had even been on, and he was sitting on the ground of a dirty parking lot."

"Come on bird beak, get with it!"

"O, well, the dragon that was manning the shop all day claim to be," holding his feathered fingers up doing air quotations, "Ty, a so-called cousin of his was taking care of the shop until Tyler returned from a convention. I had to go home real quick to check my scheduler and there isn't a significant convention that would even interest Tyler in the very least for another two week. Plus, everyone knows he wouldn't leave the shop without telling us about it. That and a few other things I noticed throughout the day. His precise 2 o clock Mountain Dew break. The way he scans cards, handles the register, they were both conveniently 'left handed" when they waved and restacked magazines." He looked back at her and he could see he weirded her out.

"Yeah so is that Tyler or not?" Looking through the window of the car they were hiding behind. The monster slowly looking for them.

"I have been coming here since it first opened. The dragon that was at the shop all day was without a doubt, with a less than 1 chance variable, Tyler Matthews. "

A look of shock and dismay swept over her, "No wonder he went ballistic and lost his mind... I kept calling him David."

"O he hates being compared to David you know, it really pushes his buttons. Unlike me of course, I'd never transform into monster and try to eat you."

Jenny shook her head at him, "Not gunna happen. O I have to fix this somehow. Its my fault he's like this..." She gulped in all her fear and gathered all the courage she could to stand up from her hiding place and walk towards the monstrous blob, trying to talk to it.

"What are you trying to do, get us both killed, I'm outta here," Ned said as he was fleeing into the street almost getting hit by a red convertible that screeched to a stop. A wolf and a tiger looking out in an odd serene yet panickless fear. Ned continued running off to save his own feathers, not interested in being a meal.

Shouting, "Tyler its me Jenny. I know its you. I'm sorry I didn't see it before. Please don't do this. Come back to us!" the blob moved at its pace seemingly unaffected by her words. Fang and Leena ran next to her.

Fang looked in awe, saying, "I didn't know the celtic knot could do that."

"Given enough time and sadness it can. You know what you have to do Fang. You have to help him confront his inner demons, find that amulet and destroy it."

Gulping his nerves, "I was afraid you were gunna say that." The whole group was moving slowly backwards while trying to speak with it.

Whispering to Fang, Jenny said, "Whatever you do, don't mention his older brother David..."

Then it clicked for Fang, unintentionally saying loudly, "O man, you mean David from football, we're on the same team. He had a brother," He never saw much of him on the field that is unless he was bullying him whenever he did see him. More painful memories of wickedness returned to him. Being the cause of all this his actions rippled out so far... Cupping his hands over his mouth to make his voice sound louder, "Tyler, Buddy its me... Fang."

The goo monster responded to that by rumbling angrily, forming dragon like appendages of arms, legs, tail and head, face with a glopping mouth and two rounded horns curving back. Forming sloppy words that raked through the air, "Fang. . . bad!" A car nearby was slammed out of the way while another was picked up effortlessly and thrown in the group's direction. Both instinctively moving out of the way, Leena floated off to the right while Fang did a super jump with Jenny in his arms. Landing as best as he could and bringing her to safely. The monster turned its mass to the direction of Fang and Jenny. "Fang take... Jenny. Fang BAD!"

"Come on Tyler. Please hear me. I am sorry for what I did to you. I really am. I'm not that wolf anymore. Please Tyler listen. You're brother and me we are on the same team, you remember the football team. He's a cool guy and I bet you could be a cool guy too if you wanted. David really does care that you're brothers."

"DAVID!!!" It made an ear shattering cry as it form bubbled with fervor and two tar black wings sprouted from its back as it begin to lift up and fly over them. The blob's dragon tail, snaking in and taking Jenny with it!

Super leaping to Leena, Fang helped her up as they were following it; Fang super jumping ontop of buildings, and Leena flying next to him. "There's gotta be a faster way, we'll loose sight of it soon."

"You could fly," she said spritely. Holding his hand in hers, his next jumped stayed in the air and he was sufficiently floating. The colorful particles appeared again and they were in constant chaos, much worse from before, heading in the direction the blob was going.

"Okay, hovering like this is great but they are getting away."

"You're gunna have to fly sepearately."

"You said I wasn't ready to fly on my own yet," Fang said clutching her hand a bit tighter and looking down for their altitude.

"Its okay, just think light thoughts. Its as simple as imagining yourself as a cloud moving through the air. Here close your eyes and visualize it."

He did, but he felt a bit foolish doing so, "I don't think this is working."

She smiled, looking at him a good three feet away. He bobbed a little at the sight, but Fang was able to keep up with hovering.

"How do I move?"

"Visualize yourself moving and being where you need to be, the air takes care of the rest," she said in a freeing fashion while moving a little bit further way.

Just making out the dark blob in the air against the night sky, he imagined himself going there, gaining speed and flying in front of it, he had to talk to Tyler.

And like that, he flew along the currents, gaining speed, flying was an unreal but empowering feeling, unlike anything he had done before. Gliding upon breezes like a bird. Steadying himself was difficult at first but grew with ease as he let the Air take him around. The blobby mess, though big and cumbersome was flying very fast. Jenny was moved up from the tail, to its drippy front claws. The flying mass of black goo was a horrific sight to behold.

Finally reaching it, he could see Jenny terrified, her screams turned hoarse from her constant screaming and attempts of talking with it. Jenny dared not look down to see how high see actually was, but the air was a bit hot and thin.

"Hey, Tyler can we talk this over," said Fang casually. The monster's face gave a quick glance, and tried to shove him out of the air by trying to ram into the wolf. Evading easily, and gaining speed. "So you want to do this the hard way, okay I can play that game..." Trying to get near Jenny, to secure her safety, he continued to try talking with the black gooey glob. "I know what its like Tyler. To not feel like you're not good enough. To not feel strong enough, I was just like you a long time ago. I took the easy way out and look where it got me. I was surrounded by fake friends. I was alienating myself from my family. I felt like I could never be strong enough to protect them or myself. That amulet turned my fears against me and turned me into a cocky self-centered brute that reveled in the pain and suffering of others. I cannot tell you how much regret I have from the actions that I had done and that I cannot undo all the years of hurt I caused you. Picking on those that were smaller than me, made me feel stronger, but it wasn't true strength. The true inner Strength that comes from inside you to help you overcome and withstand what life throws at you. You Tyler have been taking it like a champ for all these years. You and me we are survivors, we are the same..."

The monster bellowed, "Not SAME" in a gurgling mess. Using his long dragon tail to try and whip Fang out of the sky was much harder to evade, and the gooey mess smacked him a bit, but Fang persisted more though it was a lot more difficult to reach Jenny now.

Looking at Jenny who desperately wanted to be saved, but at the same time wanted Tyler to be okay too. Fang thought of another way to try and reach Tyler, because somewhere within that hulking mass was Tyler. He just needed help to see the light. "Tyler I was surrounded by fake friends, because I forced them to be there," he hated to admit it but to say it out loud made him feel very awful, "I wasn't very popular in truth. I was afraid of being alone too and it drove me to be do awful things. Jenny, how are you hanging in there? You say you are not the same as me, but here you are abducting this fine lady. What will you do? Force her to be your friend too."

The monster just growled internally and began swatting him again with his tail, the claws gripping tighter around Jenny. She felt the breath squeeze out of her and she blacked out, lying limply in the claw.

Fang grew worried and he had to break through to him somehow...

Feeling the need to take action instead of charging, he rams head first into the sticking gooey creature, diving in and being completely submerged. But instead of needed to hold his breath like when you go underwater it was an empty void. Similarly to how he was back in the shrine with the tiger lady. It was just the same, being in a place where awful memories played over and over. Trying to find a happy memory was hard for him, he couldn't imagine how difficult it was for Tyler. Even memories that appeared to be just passing moments, were here as well. All the times he was ignored and looked over. In the scenes and memories playing like multiple projectors all around this void, he finally found Tyler. The purple dragon, was little, but he seemed to have shrunk significantly like he was a doll or stuffed animal really. The coloring of scales were either dulled or darkened, making it the reason why he was so hard to find. Even while approaching him, Tyler's gaze was fixed on a single screen showing multiple, multiple times of his older brother receiving all the awards, appraises and attention. And him, ignored and alone. Fang saw a few images of his old self bullying him and he was none to proud. Poor Tyler, he didn't deserve this...

"Hey buddy," Fang said trying to begin again.

With a slight glossiness in his eyes, he said in a monotone, "What do you want?"

"To start over, to be friends..." said Fang, the most sincere he has ever been.

Dejectedly, "You must mean my brother, not me..."

"No, I'm here for you."

"You're tricking me. No one ever wants to be friends..."

"Well I wouldn't have come all the way here if I didn't consider you a friend." He finally looked away from the screen and at Fang now, nervousness superseded the tiredness and lack of energy from his face.

Slowly putting his clawed paw up, "Who are you?"

"Its Fang," he said but his glee turned sour as Tyler withdrew his hand entirely and turned his back to him.

"I know you. You've hurt me before. Leave me alone. Maybe being ignored is all I'm good for. I can't get hurt if they don't see me..." His gaze shifted to the side, looking at another screen with images of Jenny at the shop and him being too shy to even talk with her.

Fang grew saddened to see him completely withdraw within himself like that. Its like he was letting all the things he hated define him. He recalled when he probably first met David and Tyler together, it was at football tryouts in high school. Fang was a shoe in but this new guy, David was a contender too. He didn't realize he'd be on the same team with David for the next seven years of his life, but he had always been competing with David, not Tyler. He saw that Tyler often kept to himself, reading a book in the bleachers. A loner that Fang would often call out 'pipsqueak' or 'small fry' and soon Tyler stopped going to the football practices and he hadn't seen him since. Only in the montage of people he'd bully constantly. Fang and Tyler never really had a relationship to begin with, and if they did it was rocky at best. He couldn't believe how selfish he was to not even consider that he even had feelings, even earlier in the day he recalled how he treated Palmetto, his mousy maid. There was no telling how many bridges he'd burned and would now have to begin to repair to even start the road to forgiveness. But he knew that he had to start somewhere, and Tyler was a perfect place to start.

Fang was reaching out for him again when...

The look in Tyler's eyes was strong, but from Tyler's perspective the black wolf was very weary. Tyler now was steadily regaining more and more of his memories and the events leading up to this point. Tyler knew who the black wolf was. He who trying desperately to save him while risking everything for him, this was not the same wolf that would pick on him every chance he saw. It was a genuine change and he could see that him in. And poor Jenny, he put her through so much, not even fathoming things would turn out this way. Just because he loved her...

Well, he had, that was the truth. Never before did he feel so strongly for someone that he would go through all this mess just for the chance to be with her. Sure he wanted to be big and strong to compete with his brother, but he wanted to be a better version of himself for her. Someone she could be proud of to say "That's my dragon, he's taken," thought Tyler. He would never feel alone and he would never feel like he was stuck in his older brother's shadow anymore.

But he would up being a bit of a jerk and look where it got him... One false move and it would be game over... No, Tyler thought, 'this is not my end, I put her in this mess and its my job to be there for her, be her knight in shining armor, her caped crusader'. Feeling a lightness within him, he felt a warmth from the tips of his hands to his core. Not quite the burning and breaking of bones from before, but a special kind of feeling that he'd never felt before. He had a purpose, a real goal, a girl worth fighting for that needed him and he needed to get to her. Those thoughts spun within him as the feeling moved to his back and he could feel something strange happening. A new feeling as appendages sprouting from his back forming and closing, they were Wings, real Dragon Wings. His family of dragons wasn't the flying sort, but they did exist, so it was an all too new feeling to be flying there.

Fang through all this saw the nervousness and extreme shyness melt away as he saw coinfidence and a driven look grace his face, that and a pair of wings flapping behind him. "Care for a lift? As you have been trying to save me, friendship isn't a one way street. It works both ways. Thought I could help out a bit, so hang on," Tyler said grinning loudly, lifting off of the mountain and towards the amulet. Tyler using both of his hands to hold Fang's hand, while Fang's other hand outstretched ready to grab the amulet.

Swiping the amulet quickly and surely, the whole area around them seemed to crumble and fade away like fog.

The blobby creature seemed to rumble and bubble , still grasping the ill-fated Jenny, and then seemed to burst open with a deathly screech. A flying purple dragon emerged holding a black furred wolf with the blue glowing amulet in his paw. The blob mass seemed to be falling randomly, making sure Fang was fying, he let him go and dived to save the fair Jenny.

Screaming a bit, she didn't know what was happened, until she fell into someone arms. He was pretty cute, another dragon like her, but his scales were a deep royal purple and he had broad, leathery-sheen wings. He had the sweetest of smiles with a slightly square-ish chin and pronounced snout. His two horns curved back from his head from a shaggy mess of headfur. Her eyes fell to his. It was then she knew his eyes were the same. She smiled at him, both of them blushing a bit. "So if its alright with you, could we have a do-over for tonight. I uh wasn't quite myself," he said with a smile and apologetic face.

She saw his blush intensify, and she wrapped her arms around him practically choking him, "I've been waiting for you for ages."

Secretly, Jenny had always felt something for Tyler. She wasn't sure if it was the cute boyish way he carried himself or his sweet personality, but one thing for sure it wasn't really the comics she wanted. It was him. Though after months of trying to make advances, him oblivious or paralyzed with his extreme shyness for the opposite sex (still a cute quality) she grew tired of waiting. It wasn't until she saw his older brother, that even being a bit of a lug head, he too had that same charm. Sure she liked him, but it didn't compare to what she saw in Tyler. She thought he didn't like her at one point, but she was sure at that point, with her in his arms, she was safe and that's all she ever really wanted.

Tyler looking around for a safe place to land, felt like he knew this area, he couldn't gather why... But then it hit him...
