Tyler knew a direct approach would be the easiest thing the monster was expecting so he tried a different tactic. Circling around, evading his long whipping tail, and shooting tendrils from its back (that was new, thought Tyler) he managed to fly under the arm and close enough for Fang to swing in. Tyler's last words, "If you don't come out in five I'm going in after you!" With the black wolf submerged, the glob shrieked with vengeance. Setting its sights on the winged dragon and two girls.

"We should get moving!" shouted Tyler, "We need to keep it busy for as long as we can." Jenny hopping up into his arms again, the group flew off to a woody section, a mile or two beyond the neighborhood, to prevent any further damages or destruction.

Diving again into the sticky glob like goo, Fang found himself in the void again. But this time it was much different. The area was blindingly white with a checkered floor. White constructs of furniture, chairs and a desk filled the large room. Sitting at the desk was an unknown figure to him. It was just a man in a suit, he was pretty normal looking until you got to his face. His hair and blonde-colored goatee framed a terrifying image. In place of eyes and teeth, resided that dark black goo, dripping but none on his pristine white suit. He held a black cane that adorned several gems and diamonds, but the real ticket item was the Celtic Knot around his next. That was all that Fang cared about. Trying to make himself big, he stormed over to the desk ready to jump across it and grab the amulet. His feet quickly stuck to the floor as the rug under and in front of the desk became a square piece of black goo. He was not sinking, though he could guess why.

"So glad you could join us Fang, or did you want Master Fang. You don't have to hide from me dear boy. I know everything about you..."

He'll humor him, "Just Fang is fine. Its funny, you know me but I don't know you."

Holding a leather-black gloved hand to his chest, "O I'm hurt Fang. We've been the best of friends for the last 21 years." Fang's eyes grew wide, could this be... "Yes Fang," the gloopy mouth stretched its face, "you are right. I am the amulet you used to cherish and adore. You brought me back to life after my magic had been drained. You have been treating me so good, I thought I would return the favor and give you everything you ever wanted. I gave you power. I gave you strength. I made you the best player any team you joined. You wanted girls, I made you the most attractive wolf around. And this is the thanks I get! Destroy all my hard work!" It stomped its cane to the ground for emphasis. He paused to regain his composure and walked around the desk, twirling his cane as he walked around. "Too bad, you look like half the wolf you were if not less..." Some gooey tendrils sprouted from the goo square and began to bind Fang around his arms and muzzle. Taking his cane and sliding it underneath his neck. "I see you've replaced me so quickly," it sneered and outstretched his arms doing a broad gesture, "I've moved on to bigger and better things Fang." Snapping his fingers, a door opened and moving in sideways because he was so freakishly massive and built, David thundered with each step taking a place next to the evil orchestrator. "Don't take it the wrong way, but I've upgraded. Do you like what I've done with the place? It was fairly vacant so I moved right in." Moving about the room, the goo tendrils forcing Fang to look wherever he was going. "And here, what a glorious host this dragon is. So simple, yet so powerful. I should have found a dragon at first, but you were a consolation prize I suppose." Using his cane, he bopped the head of David, not even flinching. "Such simple desires and fears. So nourishing..." It lick its lips with a long goopy tongue. Making another broad gesture with his cane, transparent like screens appeared around the room like those other times before, showing images of David's successes and triumphs, filtered in with scenes from the last twenty-four hours. "I would have had another pet dragon if you left well enough alone, but he's outside trying to stop my monster, he won't get too far and he will be mine again very soon..." putting a gloved hand on the screen, on Tyler's image. With a wave of his cane, screens vanished and he turned to face Fang again.

His voice and laughs were becoming more otherworldly and strained, "To be the biggest. To be the strongest. To be the best!" He jerked, almost skipped a visual beat, one moment standing next to David, the next in front of him. He drew a hand back with his cane gripped at the handle, backslapping Fang and a laugh so evil it reverberated off the walls. Fang lowered his ears, feeling the pain on the side of his face. "That is what a winner looks like, Fang. To have the balls enough to go deep and grab the goal, the gold." He walked around admiring the room and returned to sit at his desk. Taking a silver pocket watch from his coat, and sighed. "I am fairly patient and," he paused snapping his fingers, releasing the tendrils and the tar square disappearing as if it were never there, "a good sport. We have some more time before the manasource collapses. So I have a little wager for you."

Having a chance to breath, the tendrils were constricting his lungs after all, taking multiple breaths between words, "What did you have in mind?"

"I am in a good mood, so I'll let you live if you can best my friend here," gesturing towards David, his eyes glazed over and nonresponsive.

"Do I have a choice?" Fang gulping nervous to face his jacked team mate.

"What do you think? The end of the world won't be as satisfying if I don't make a game of it. I grow bored too quickly."

"Well what kind of game did you have in mind?" Fang inquired a bit afraid of what the response would be.

"I don't care surprise me..." he said in a twisted fashion. "You choose the contest and I'll make an arena for you. If you win, you live, free to leave. If I win, you have to stay here without a fight and become my slave again. It would be just like old times. You get everything you've always wanted again for your complete servitude. Win - Win wouldn't you say?"

"No dice, the world is ending and your little departing gift has my days numbered anyways."

"O so you know about that. Well, they think the world will end, but it will go back to the way it was in the time before time. Magic running rampant throughout the land, and us the Magebloods will be on top again. Above you ingrate humans and animals, you once served us as slaves before and now again," he paused briefly and continued, "Why not, if you do manage to win, I will take the darkness away that's eating at your soul. But if I win, you must also retrieve the other dragon for me so that he too must become a slave only for me. It seems a shame that little Tyler should miss all this fun. Have we got a deal?"

Very reluctant but feeling as though he had no other choice, "Deal," as he outstretched his hand as the other thing outstretched its hand, tendrils from its sleeve holding his hand too. Fang pulled back quickly.

"So Fang, what contest do you wish to lose in?" the entity sneered, the dark gooey smile outstretching its face.
12232111111112111121111221121111.title: Fang runs foward...

choices: ...Speed would be his ally, He'd score to win.
...Strategically Lose, He Couldn't Beat Him.
122321111111121111211112211211111.content:
Knowing the only thing he was the best at, even during practice scrimmages, football was the only thing he could think about. He took a deep breath in before speaking, "I choose football. Flag football that is. First to five goals wins, a Goal is worth two points and a kick is worth one."

Grinning broadly with the gooiness bubbling, "Very well. Flag football it is." Waving his cane and turning back to his chair, the checker board floor began glowing, turning green as the white constructs of furniture, chairs and tables exploded into nothingness. A rectangular field of 50 yards appeared behind Fang as David walked forward to take position. A shadow construct helmet, similar to the light furniture but black, appeared on David's head. Some large, black spiked shoulder pads and a black flag over his tail also appeared on the brute as he stood ready to demolish anything that stood in front of him. Goal posts popped up on either end setting the stage for the final battle.

"Hey what about my gear," said Fang a little whiny, but more concerned than anything else. He was still only wearing his paints and amulet, he didn't even have shoes on, it had been a weird day for everyone.

The thing laughed, waving its cane as a light construct helmet, shoulderpads and flag for his tail appeared on him. They weighed a ton, Fang thought. The white suited man seemed to shift further back to the sidelines to get a better view, moving his chair and his desk with him. He put his elbows on his desk and leaned forward, intent on the action that would ensue. "Ready, when you are, Fang..." Calling out to his champion, "Don't fail me my pet!" David remained unaffected, his trance too deep and his mind only focused on winning.

Walking over there was just taking all the energy he had with all the gear on, but he couldn't leave himself unprotected either. With David's massive size he would slaughter him, brake bones and crack ribs. Fang gulped he had to do what he could, maybe something that big would be slow too, Fang could only hope. Getting in position, Fang looked around for the football. "Hey what gives, where's the ball?"

Performing a dismissive gesture, "He's your pigskin, you have the ball first." His gooey grin stretched again as if already knew the outcome. Appearing in his hands was a light construct football with black for the threading. The weight felt about right as he held it in his hands. Closing his eyes and breathing in and out, the entire world is counting on me, he was thinking to himself. "I can't let them down," he said under his breath as he crouched down. Calling out three random numbers then, "Hut!"

Almost instantly, the living mass charged into him pushing him to the ground, with more power to make him somersault back a few yards. He still held the ball, but the pain was all too real.

"I believe that's First Down," it called out with wicked glee.

Trying to pick himself up and resetting positions, it was clear to see that this wasn't going to be easy, not by any means. The rhythm coming back to him, sure muscle helps you take and give out blows, but that wasn't going to win the game. Calling out numbers again, he called early and made a dash to the left only to be stopped by a colossal fist. David's hand practically the entire width of Fang's waist. He dropped to the side, not loosing any yards, but his side hurt like hell. Hollaring out, "Flag football isn't a contact sport, you bastard!"

Smiling his gooey smile, "Perhaps but you didn't say so it isn't a rule. A down is when a player losses their flag or falls to the ground." He may have been accurate, but hell that wasn't fair. Fang could tell he didn't intend on scoring goals to win, he just wanted to beat him up and tire him out. The amulet enjoys watching others suffer he remembered. This wasn't about winning at all to him and Fang knew that even if he did win the sly thing couldn't be trusted to keep his side of the bargain but what could he do...
122321111111121111211112211211111.title: A contest of might of course, 1 on 1 football...

choices: ...The deal is off!
...The terms of the deal changes!
1223211111111211112111122112111111.content:
Sighing heavily, the equipment, though his only protection, wasn't doing him any bit of good. Throwing the helmet off and the shoulder pads off to the sidelines, they evaporated as they touched the ground, he was feeling lighter already.

"O tough guy, you must really have a death wish. You sure you don't want to forfeit? It would makes things so much easier."

Cracking his neck and rolling his shoulders a bit, Fang responded, "Like you'd even let me?"

"Prolly not, seeing your spirits get crushed is way too amusing," its gooey lips stretching again, leaning back in his chair to enjoy the rest of the show.

Let's try this again, Fang thought. Really planting his feet, letting the oddly real grass between his toes and letting his claws dig into the ground to give him an extra boost. He'd have to book it this time. Calling out numbers and starting early, he faked to his right and sprinted down the field, breathing heavily foregoing his victory dance for some well needed air. At least, once he got past David he was home free.

The figure turned narrow-eyed as it snapped its fingers making a light construct scoreboard appear on the other side of the field. A large square board, like the kind for basketball games. The names Home and Visitor appeared in black. The zero under Visitor changed to a two. Finishing his breathing and feeling a second wind come he went ten yards to make a field goal. Holding the ball, he watched that even though David's eyes were glossed-over the eyes never looked away from the ball, David wasn't even registering Fang at all from the looks of it.

Just calling, "Hut!" he kicked the ball making a broad arc over David and through the goal posts. The figure behind the desk rolled its eyes, as the two became a three. What the entity didn't realize was that unlike David, he actually practiced different roles instead of just being a Linebacker, he always knew that practicing to be a quarterback would come in handy, that and being a Quarterback was like a total babe magnet."Half way there, bro."

Gritting his teeth a little as his face returned to normal (if that could even be an appropriate way to describe it). "Consider your luck run out, Fang. Now its our ball." The ball disappeared from Fang's hand and reappeared in David's massive claws. There was no way he could block him. Going back to position, he could see David looking straight at the goal posts. Perhaps he could try talking to him.

In a lowered voice, "Hey David, buddy you in there. Its me Fang. Hey I don't know if you can hear me but if you can know that only you can stop this. If not for me, think about Tyler. If you win we all lose. Is it really worth losing everything, just because you want to win..."

Though the head didn't move, his mouth did, speaking in half thoughts, "expect ed to wi n.." Calling numbers and charging on the third, Fang jumped out of the way and let him pass, looking for where the flag was. His waist was so wide, Fang could give him a bear hug and his hands would be at least two feet apart. But the flag was still there, it was a long strip of black, but the main concern was his dragon like tail that would make it more than difficult to grab. The zero under Home changed to a two. Moving into position for the kick, Fang laughed to see the kick catapult the ball high into the air, shattered the magical football. The entity stood up in his chair, his goo bubbling with anger. So being all powerful wasn't what it was cracked up to be. Sure being big and powerful and a hulking mass of muscle helped in sports, but sports had finesse and a tactical element to them as well.

Snapping his fingers again the football appeared in Fang's arms, this time the football was bigger and heavier than before. So he wanted to cheat, Fang would have to make due as the old football weighed a standard pound, this new one must have been at least twenty. It was heavier, but not entirely impossible to move around with. It would be hard to fake with properly as the change in size made it awkward to hold. Calling out numbers again, he moved on the third count, and seeing the massive bulk ready to charge him again his arms out wider for the tackle. Tossing the ball up, David's focus remained on the ball as ducked under his arms and vaulted over the massive dragon tail to catch and jogged with the ball to the goal. The score under Visitor changed from three to five. That was it, it was over, he had won, but why wasn't everything changing back...
1223211111111211112111122112111111.title: ...Speed would be his ally, He'd score to win.

choices: Round 2, its all comes down to this...
Cut your loses and deny him...
12232111111112111121111221121111112.content:
There was no doubt Fang's energy was sapped from the last maneuver, even with his second wind, it just barely cut it for that last dash. He was sweating hard and he knew he would have to rest before he could do much of anything else, even a victory party would have to wait till he took a snooze.

But the sly suited creature wasn't done... Not by a long shot... From his desk to Fang in the end zone in a blink, he used his cane to pick up the black furred wolf under the chin. "Tired are we?"

Fang nodded as it was plainly obvious, he even sat down on the artificial turf. He rolled the ball over to him, "We had a deal, first to five. Its done..." The words getting caught in his throat.

"Aww, so naïve. We're not done till I say we're not."

He gave him a stern look, as if knowing the inevitable betrayal but played anyways, "A gentleman going back on his word doesn't seem too fair."

"You're right its not," as he changed his suit began to stain an inky black with the seen of latex. His goo breaking out as if it had been restrained, it roared in Fang's face as it quickly returned as the whiteness formed over like makeup covering a bruise. "Believe me I am being very civil with you Fang. My poor pet was so set on winning, heck winning is the only thing worth doing," it said with more emphasis, "So I am extending the game. Whoever scores to seven, wins. And this time the stakes will be much higher to be made worth your while... I assure you..." It grinned wickedly...

Sighing, knowing he won't have another choice, "I'm listening..."

"If you win this time, you'll also get a chance to free David. I know how much it means for you to save them."

Shocked he looked at him surprised by the offer, "You mean you'd be willing to give him up just because you want to win?"

"In a manner of speaking, yes..." his cane gripped in his hands.

Knowing better than to deal with this demon, "But, what's the catch..."

"But if I win, that amulet will be mine!" it shouted in muted anger, pointing with it's cane at Fang's necklace.

"What could you want this thing for?" Fang's curiosity drawn into what powers his new amulet held that he desired so badly...

"That's for me to know and for you to worry about later," he said waving his cane as screens popped up showing the outside world where his friends were doing their best to distract the giant blob monster that was destroying the forest area that they had lured it into. They were growing tired and he saw that poor Leena was walking now too, not knowing why she couldn't fly. Perhaps it had to do with the growing instability of the manasource. It must have been causing more interference. A raging whirlwind was in effect though, almost sucking everything into the blobby mess; leaves twigs and even whole trees were being sucked into the vortex forcing the giant to grow in size. They were running out of time, hell the whole world was... Fang couldn't trust him neither... was this really happened or was this a trick to throw him off his game, or even deeper if the manasource crashed what that really meant. Would he be free to roam an apocalapse-like earth and make everyone his slaves... Things were not looking good for anyone... "Do you accept the terms of our new deal?" it said extending its hand, tendrils at the ready to shake on it.
12232111111112111121111221121111112.title: ...The terms of the deal changes!

choices: Continue to the finish, quitters never prospered...
Give in and surrender, it was obvious there was no winning...
122321111111121111211112211211111121.content:
Standing himself up, looking at the screens and back at the creep, "I do, as long as you aren't going to go back on our deal or cheat," he said tapping the ball with his foot, "then fine. I accept your new terms..."

"Fine," in an eeire otherworldly draw that sent shivers down his spine. Walking back, and then blinking to his fancy chair in an instant. The entity looked on more focused and intent on winning. Trying to lift the ball again, it remained heavy, but with a glare and a snap, the ball returned to its normal weight and size but the screens remained up, a live action cam as to the fall of his friends and the world, as he played football. Just freaking terrific, thought Fang.

The being in the pristine suit called out, "Don't disappoint me, my pet. Crush him!"

His mind filled with gloom and uncertainty, could he really take David again, not feeling any reassurance from that last remark. This was growing monotonous and the weight on Fang's shoulders couldn't be any heavier. He sighed getting ready for the kick for his single point. Holding it in his hands, moving the football to see if David's focus was fully on the football which it was. Counting out numbers till, "Hut!" and David was in a full blitz, a steamroller heading for impact without stopping. Fang's nerves snapped halfway through the kick, and opted to jump to the side. The football not even making it close to the goal post. He couldn't risk just getting one point, if David was just going to trample him and seriously hurting him and rendering him unable to play.

"Its not too late to surrender, Fang," he said in a halting fashion as his gooey smiled curled more and more, like a Cheshire cat. Fang shook his head, he would have to make another touchdown to win this.

Lining back up in midfield, David's eyes still glossed over, was there no way to reach through to him. How strong was his hold on his former teammate, Fang wondered. Trying to speak to him again, maybe using the screens to his advantage, "Look David, while we are here playing our friends are out their risking our lives for us. Come on, break free, I know you can... Don't let him control you."

David's gaze remained unchanged, but it looked like his fists and upper body language was easing up. Talking halfly, "Can n't disss appoint," as his call for numbers began, springing early on three as his legs tore up the field. Trying to get out of the way and trying to bounce back fast enough to grab his flag, he was just a few centimeters away, he felt its breeze and then nothing. David's dragon tail, smacking him upside the head, his face still sore from the entity's cane slap from before. He'd been in more scraps than this, but without all his muscle or body weight to take some of the impact off, he was starting to get more bruises and cuts along his face and exposed body parts. His arms and pants covered in grass stains from leaping to safety so many times. The scoreboard changed to a four under home as soon as David crossed into the end zone, throwing the football into the ground to gloat. The entity was pleased, leaning closer and closer almost out of his seat at the anticipation of winning and owning everything Fang held dear.

Repositioning for his kick, Fang just watched, already knowing the result, exploded football. He took this precious time to regain some of his strength by inhaling and exhaling in deep intervals. The giant lummox thundered his steps and kicked in clean through the goal posts and into the unknown. The scoreboard matching the scores up, Home and Visitors where five each, one more touchdown would end it. Fang was holding his paw above his eyes, to see where the ball had gone. Then, suddenly the ball appeared in his arms at such a force, still moving with great speed, as it pounded into his stomach and arms; pushing him back at least seven yards. Catching it, but talking a blow similar to being kicked or punched pushed out some air, spit and blood. He had trouble getting up and the white-suited thing just laughed, reveling in the black wolf's suffering. Fang wanted so much to stay on the grassy floor and wished this all be over... Maybe this was some sick nightmare that he would wake up soon and it was all some sick dream...

He'd be back in his mansion, he's parents away on business trips, the amulet safely around his neck and he'd be on his way to football practice... Wouldn't that be nice, he thought trying to find some peace in the chaotic events surrounding him; the screens with his friends in peril, the estranged laughter of the gooey-grinned entity and the monstrous breathing of his friend David... What was he going to do?
122321111111121111211112211211111121.title: Round 2, its all comes down to this...

choices: David's Inner Strength emerges...
The Wisdom's Loop amulet offers some magical assistance...
1223211111111211112111122112111111211.content:
Opening his eyes, determined to continue. He couldn't sit idly by and let that thing win. He couldn't quit now. The phrases 'No pain, No gain' and 'Quitters never Win' on the gym wall in the college came to mind. He'd spend hours working out, running miles and building his endurance... This was nothing, he could do this in his sleep. That's why he chose this contest in the first place.

Because he could do it and will do it; push come to shove if not for himself than to save David, his friends and the world. He couldn't think what his new life world be if the manasource collapsed. He didn't want to lose his friends, his parents or Leena. It suddenly occurred that he wouldn't have come so far without her words of guidance and her comforting gestures. He felt determined than ever to win this thing, if not for everyone else but her. He had to do this. Make this one last play and he would at least be free to go see her.

Though his sights re-focused on Leena, the back of his mind still wondered how he was going to destroy the amulet, he wasn't any closer to it. Though once he freed David, maybe he could have some ideas...

His mood soared at the thought of finally winning. One more touchdown was all he needed. His gaze couldn't help but keep switching between David and the screens. Soon she would be safe. Soon...

Getting into position and staring down David, knowing that psyching him was an impossible challenge. He began calling the numbers, when suddenly a scream echoed from the whole arena, looking around, the screens were now audible and the sounds of his friends filtered in...

"Leena, Leena what's wrong?" Tyler's voice reverberated.

Jenny, sighing, " I don't know her head is all warm, she just collapsed..."

"We can't stop here, " as Tyler picked up Leena, flying low because the trees stopped his escape and to be close to Jenny as they proceeded further and further into the woods. Fang had been looking at maps of the city for quite some time since his father wanted to get him into his business, but his heart was on football at the time to take any heed from his teachings. But he remembered everything about these particular woods, his father was going to take down a large section of them for some kind of factory, that would 'legally' dispose of waste in the sea. Steep cliffs were at the end of the forest that led to a sheer plunge into sharp rocks and choppy waves. They were running out of time... Fang trying to block out the noise, the entity's grin literally stretching from ear to ear and then David ramming into him pushing him back!

"Hey," Fang shouted, "I didn't call it yet!"

"You're taking too long, ten yard penalty," the gloved fingers tapping each other in an impatient matter.

Could it get any worse, just than as he feared, his friends were nearing the cliff. They had run out of room and the now fifty foot blob monster roared, getting closer and closer. Tyler couldn't carry both of them to safety. He had to hurry this up.

Gritting his teeth at the pain, he got ready to make another go at it. Hunched down and calling numbers, feeling horrible about his friends' predicament, he ran on his second call hoping to catch David off guard while ducking under his massive left arm. Feeling great, just home free and smack, David's tail clobbered him. This was ridiculous. He couldn't dodge the hulking mass and his freakishly long tail, seriously did it get longer, thought Fang. He looked to the entity that was just sitting there, radiating pure evil...

He did not have time to be wrestling David and his tail, it was practically two against one. Man, did he need some help...
1223211111111211112111122112111111211.title: Continue to the finish, quitters never prosper...

choices: Touchdown!
Just a little bit farther...
12232111111112111121111221121111112111.content:
Feeling he wasn't getting help, no matter how much he wanted someone else to save him, it was truly up to him and his own strength; that and his inner strength that allowed him to persevere beyond anyone he ever knew. He was a survivor and there was no stopping him. Well, technically, two more downs and the ball would be David's and that would certainly mess up his plans for saving the world.

Calling out to the entity, "Don't suppose you'll give us a small break?"

The entity's face narrowed, "No, the world doesn't wait to end just because you're tired Fang. It has never been the universe revolves around you..." it retorted with a dark sourness in its voice.

"Sheesh, sorry I asked, a simple no would have been fine."

"And besides, does he look tired to you?" David, breathing heavily, but otherwise he lined up ready to go. There was no faltering his boundless energy and raw power... "Shouldn't it be mutual on both parties. The game continues Fang, or should I say my soon to be slave," he grinned the gooey drops from its mouth still not touching his spotless white suit. "Though if you want to take a break, you are more than welcome too, I'll take it as your admit to defeat. Failure is inevitable Fang. Just give up and it will be easy roads ahead of you. Think, you could have your muscle back, your strength, your size and vigor. Not this tired wannabe little pup that's barely hanging by a thread. Enter my fold and you will never regret it..."

"Not likely, slimeball," Fang said crossly.

"Than stop stalling and play!" It cursed with bubbling rage.

Maybe he had tried to stall, but a few more moments and some monologue from his villainous enemy may have bought him enough time to reserve some strength. Sure he was thin and his muscles were wiry and ropey, but that didn't really matter. If Fang really made it out of this alive and he did save the world. He could always train and earn his muscle and size back. Getting results instantly was not doing him any favors for him. Hell, he wouldn't be where he was now if he didn't take the short cuts he had. Letting the amulet build him up. Sure, he thought it was all him, there were moments were he would shoot in size and muscle like no one he had ever known. What high school freshman had an 8 pack and could intimidate any other player just because he was already over two times their size... He new than that the amulet was more than special, almost magical in nature... He had never truly understood the amulet, or its mysterious affect on him, other than it made him huge and a completely decked out athlete with muscle and curves in all the right places. Looking back, he was a fool to think things didn't come with a price...

And today he was paying it all back...

He got ready to line up, David's body eager to go, but his face seemed to soften. Fang had completely tuned out his friends so he could play, but his gaze returned to the screens as they had reached the cliff, with what looked like only minutes to spare till the monster would eat them or push them over. They needed him and he was done with playing the creature's game. They were fighting over who should be saved, trying to wake up Leena to see if she could fly but nothing, it was like she was unconscious and Tyler wanted to save them both, but his strength was waning too.

Taking in a deep breath, he counted again, going all the way to the third number and this time he'd make it, even if David was unresponsive, he could help him. Like a mouse trap, Fang shot off, his movements well planned with precision as he faked left and under David's swipe; here came the tail. He grabbed the tail as it came and vaulted over it, making a break for it to the finish line. Landing a little crooked, and crazy weak after he put the last of his energy to escape the tail he was moving in a slow power walk to the finish. The entity cursed and was yelling for David to react and chase Fang down. David managed to grip the ground to sharply turn after having charged practically all the way to his goal posts. Fang was now, doing a sort of gallop movement as his legs were burning. He just had to outrun him this last stretch...

10 more yards...

5 more yards...

He jumped falling forward as David was on his heels, he could feel his heavy, hot breath on the back of his neck. Practically charging and dog piling on top of him (it was definitely a dog pile considering his entire weight probably equaled if not more the entire defensive line of their football team). He could feel his ribs crack... He never wished for anything more in his entire life for the ball to be over the goal line. It just had to be...
12232111111112111121111221121111112111.title: David's Inner Strength emerges...

choices: Take the dive once more...
Or, Open the door...
122321111111121111211112211211111121111.content:
David finally got his over 700 pounds of muscle off of Fang, feeling like a pancake, his legs stinging and numbed from all the pain, its amazing he didn't get a 'Charlie's Horse' from all that running. The pain vaguely subsided, he saw his paw with the football over the end zone line.

I won... I WON, thought Fang. A sigh of relief watching the scoreboard on the Visitor's side change to 7 and than disappear. The entity shrieked with fury. His tendrils escaping from his sleeves as he pounded and destroyed his own desk. David, was on his arms and knees looking at the ground, the screens still on and playing, his friends meters from certain destruction. The white-suited entity, finished destroying his desk and chair as he blinked over to David. Giving him an earful about 'how worthless he was', 'how he would never amount to anything' and 'how he was the biggest disappointment he had ever seen'. He took he cane in hand and backslapped him across the head. David now a blubbering mess, half spoke meekly, "So sooo rrry, sorrrry, nnneveeer aaagaaaiiinnn."

Fang was starting to feel bad for winning and making him lose. As the entire arena seemed to fade, their positions had not changed, but the area rebuilt back to the room with the light construct furniture (his desk and chair fully repaired) and the checkered marble-like floor. Taking a step back from David, the entity slammed the cane's bottom to the floor twice. The squares David was on, turned black and he fell through, a sort of haunting moaning roar as he fell, a meter or two into darkness.

"We had a deal, you said I could free him..."

"I recall saying and I quote, 'a chance to free David' he is still bound by his personal desires and fears, like you and the other small dragon were. It is not my job to undo those bonds. So you can either waste your chance to save him," while the screens still up of his friends outside, "or pursue your freedom while I'm in a slightly giving mood." Using his cane to point behind him, as a large white door appeared behind him with blinding light escaping from the cracks. "The choice is yours..."

Of course there's a catch... What was he going to do? He couldn't believe that his actions from the past were having such consequences on him now. He'd never take an easy way out for as long as he lived, he swore it. But right not he had to make very difficult decision. He was literally between saving and losing, it was lose - lose all around. Leave without the amulet to help his friends or dive down the hole to save David and risk losing his friends...
122321111111121111211112211211111121111.title: Touchdown!

choices: Talk it out, the world won't end this minute...
Fuck that, he needs to get it together and be a man...
1223211111111211112111122112111111211111.content:
He didn't have to think about this twice, he had to save his friend David. It was the only way he would ever have a chance to get the amulet back. Taking a deep breath, he jumped into the squared hole that David submerged into moments before. His friends could last a little longer, he hoped. As the darkness was all around him, only now the screens seemed to be following him and clicking between the outside and to David's most personal memories. He saw many things, trying to decipher what could be holding his friend back so far. He thought David was actually a pretty well-adjusted guy. He didn't think he had any problems. He did well on the field, he talked highly about his younger brother during practice (though the memories of him pinning Tyler to the floor were a counter to that) and sure he had problems in school but what jock didn't. That wasn't anything to go nuts over. Fang didn't have any siblings to really understand the counterproductive behavior praising his brother while at the same time rough-housing with him to the extremes it would seem, they seemed to fight and disagree a lot...

Finally reaching an end point, he landed on top of a giant cage with solid black bars. Inside was David, massive and huge, his tail, longer than anything he had seen when he was at football practice, was snaking around trying to find room in the cage, only to have a third of it fall out the bottom. David as big as he was, though not as big as he was when he was just playing flag football with him, was really in a downer mood. This must be the real David as it were, where before he had only seen shadow versions, engrossed with power from the amulet. Similar to how he had to find Tyler, he had to make him see the light so he could free him...

David was crying bitterly at a screen in front of him, the blubbering, musclebound cobalt dragon was a sight for sore eyes. Even if he was a little dark and faded, Fang would find a way to bring his color back. He started out like he did before, "Hey David, hey Buddy how are you doing?"

"Awful, just fucking awful dude."

"Aww it can't be that bad bro. We'll get you up and out of there in no time..."

Looking away from the black wolf, "Ahh, whats the point. I've let my brother down. I've let me parents down. I'll lose my scholarship... everything man. Its over, game over man..."

"Whoa whoa calm down," Fang said trying to reach his arms in and to pat his wide back to comfort him. Wow, was he falling to pieces quickly. Fang felt this was one of those, 'grass is always greener' deals. He thought that David's life was perfect. At least David saw his parents every holiday and they even came to his big games. Fang barely saw his parents but a handful of times throughout the year. The family dinner table was always just him it had seemed. Well, perhaps the opposite was true, maybe having active parents was putting a burden on him. His expectation to excel all the time was similar to his. He really didn't think it bothered him, he hid it so well. Being the best is always a struggle and its a hard thing to overcome and to be the better person and to know when you've reached your limits... Fang remembered something he had read that reminded him about the way parents are:

“All parents damage their children. It cannot be helped. Youth, like pristine glass, absorbs the prints of its handlers. Some parents smudge, others crack, a few shatter childhoods completely into jagged little pieces, beyond repair.” — Mitch Albom


His parents were like that, and probably the only thing that the amulet was ever good for, was that he had survived his childhood, meetings his parent's expectations, and they were very high. His parents were never satisfied yet he always seemed to meet the mark... that is until it came to taking over the family business, finding a suitable wife and being an upright citizen in the community, with those topics all bets were off as far as Fang was concerned...

But David didn't have the amulet to help him do well and to exceed the expectations, Fang was lucky to escape his childhood a little unscathed from his parents, but David was a veritable train wreck, a bull in a china shop, that whole bit. Bouncing between football, school, social life and the addition of his little brother. His parents must have been wanting him to be the perfect role model and to always look out for his little brother, Tyler. So much was going on with David, the pressure to be the best, the pressure to always win, no wonder growing and getting big was an easy desire of his, thinking back on what the entity was saying about his 'simple' desires. David must have been carrying the world on his shoulders too, though not literally the world but the world that mattered to him...

He never really thought of David more than a teammate yet here he was at his lowest point and, him, Fang, his arch-nemesis, his rival, an almost physical equal back before this whole amulet nonsense gone awry, he had been making everyone's life a living hell. There was just no way around it, he was the worst being to roam the planet, he felt as a darkness stirred within him. His heart pained greatly, and his muscles convulsed a bit. What was happening to him, Fang felt bewildered and confused. It must have been the darkness on his heart and soul stirring within him. He felt like he was dying as he was trying to grasp for the breath of life that was escaping him.

Peeking from his depression, David looked on... "What's wrong? What's happening to you? Can I do anything to help you? I don't know how I got here or who you are but if there's anything I can do to help, please let me know."

Grasping his furred chest with his claw, Fang tried to augment his breathing while the other keeping a shaky hold of the cage. It was sweet that it didn't matter how bad he was feeling he always seemed to put others before himself. That was David, the gentle giant of the football team. Not so much a pushover, but hell David at least did some community service work and helped out his brother, as long as his brother never found out. He'd deny it though, even when he had helped clean his shop a couple of times and repair the roof when it was leaking. David went so far as to ask me to see if I could convince my father to give them a week extension for a late month's payment for the comic shop back when it first started out.

Well, past all the expectation and the need to be a good role model for his little brother, David was probably more caring and loving than Fang and even Tyler realized. He did out of love, a brotherly love that Fang seemed to know nothing about.

Really trying to do his best to keep it together, the pain still there but not an overly pressing thought compared to saving David, Leena and the world. He spoke with a light grunt, "No, I'm fine. Its you I'm more worried about."

David rolled his eyes, "Don't waste your time," his tone lowered to his deep bass. "I'm a waste of time, not worth a damn!" Scoffing as his gaze drifted back to the screens...

Fang was debating how to handle David's shattered ego...
1223211111111211112111122112111111211111.title: Take the dive once more...

choices: You must sacrifice something of great value for the darkness to go away...
Your amulet for mine...
1223211111111211112111122112111111211111.content:
Really, needing to hurry this up, Fang didn't need to hold David's hand. A good old reality check was what he really needed. If he could reach him, Fang would slap the shit out of him. "Don't be stupid David. You're fucking awesome! Don't ever say your worthless, EVER! I don't care what others say, you are a terrific guy that would do anything for others in need. You don't wait around to act, you never looked for a reason to help someone, you just did it. You can't sit there and tell me that Tyler doesn't think you're worthless!"

David's gaze shifted downward, as his tail ventured back into the cage, finding his clawed hands, he began to hold it like a dammed security blanket... "It's worse. He hates me!!! We had a terrible fight, I pushed him into a wall just because I wouldn't share the amulet with him. I was all about doing the right thing, but I wanted to be selfish. I deserve this," gesturing to the cage, "I should have let him have it. He deserves the amulet more than I do..."

"Believe me you couldn't be more than wrong," Fang laughed a little though the pain in his chest was getting worse, Fang continued with tension in his voice, "Why do you think I'm here and we're in this mess? Why do you think you're in a cage of darkness? The amulet feeds on negative emotions, giving you your desires as it destroys everything around you that you love. Sure you shoved Tyler into a wall, but you guys fight all the time. Its what you guys do, he'll get over it I promise..."

Looking away, still holding his tail, "But what if I do it again? What if I really really hurt him like I hurt you, I could have killed you," David slowly remembering the events upstairs...

"I knew the risk, David. I took them anyways, why do you think I came down here. Just to watch you suffer. No, you deserve better than that. You are my friend and I know that you'd do the same if I were Tyler. You need to know that your younger brother will always love you, even if you are acting stupid. It kind of happens when you are apart of a loving family. Your parents cared for you so much, that they only wanted what was best for you. I know what its like to have the pressure of meeting high expectations, my parents were the same way. And sure they can be strict at times, and sure you may have arguments with them, but by the end of the day your family will always love you no matter what. And that's something you can never hide from. You know its true..."

Feeling that was all the wisdom he had to give, he felt the area grow lighter somehow...

After a long pause, David let go of his tail and tried to stand in his cage. In a booming voice, "You're right. It doesn't matter what trophies I do or don't get, my family will always love me and even forgive me when I do stupid stuff." His color was retuning back to him, and his attitude was returning to his face. His dropping expression, turned alive and steadfast. He looked at the bars and with a sweeping motion of his arms and tail, the cage was gone and blurred like a smoky fog. As the cage disappeared, he caught Fang as he fell into his arms, David could sense something was wrong.

Although a pained smile was on his face, Fang had to put all of his energy just into breathing. It was awful that there wasn't anything he could do to help. Suddenly, all the darkness began to fade away and they were back in the white room with all the furniture and the entity with the now dirty white suit, he made a violent gesture with his cane, as all the screens vanished as they weren't helping him anymore.

"Come to gloat I presume! You mortals are disgusting! All feelings and emotions, all I wanted was to make you the best you ungrateful Sonsabitches, the lot of you. I gave you everything, and this is how you repay me. I can't believe I wanted you as my slaves..." his voice sounded weak but high-pitched. His face and fingers thinned considerably.

"Than you don't... understand us very well..." said Fang pushing the words out, still in David's arms.

"Preposterous, you humans and animals are all alike. Greedy, selfish and needy. You don't care for anything but yourselves. I've seen your kind for centuries destroy one another, the rise and fall of civilizations countless times... When the Mageblood were in control it was paradise. Peace throughout the world, that none of you could fathom. I wanted to make the world right again and you pathetic creatures don't even deserve to bask in the light of the Sun. Go, on and hide in your holes. The Manasource is moments from collapsing and all my brothers and sisters will be freed from their exiles. In moments, the whole world will be as it should. Go before I change my mind!" Throwing his cane, across the room and behind them at the white door, that now cracked open.

Trying to get up and out of David's arms, trying to walk to the entity, clearly struggling, his voice straining, "No, we're not finished yet. The darkness, take it away..."

The being's gooey mouth, returned with a smile, "Well, its not a complete loss I suppose. There's that. I could watch you suffer till your last dying breaths," the floor turning to more mudlike than slime, and the tendrils weakly tried to hold the black wolf in place just faded away as quickly as it had come. "But no, a deal is a deal. I never go back on my word. Though," he hesitated, that was never a good sign...
1223211111111211112111122112111111211111.title: Fuck that, he needs to get it together and be a...

choices: Deal!!!
No Deal!!!
1223211111111211112111122112111111211111.content:
"...the only way to do that is to wear my amulet, and you can't wear them both at the same time. As much as I like watching you suffer, I don't like the idea of seeing you explode over my nice suit. So a trade, your amulet for mine. Seems fair? You won't need it anyways once the darkness is gone."

David moving a bit behind Fang, putting his arm on his shoulder, whispering as best he could, "No don't, it's a trick. He'll control you again."

"No no. I can only control you when you voluntarily let me. Fang clearly despises me and would never let me back in again willingly," it spoke with eerie sense.

"True, I'd rather go back to climbing that mountain," David gave an odd glance, as Fang returned an 'I'll tell you later' glace, "than have you control me again. Then how will it work. Us switching amulets. What will it do?"

"Well," he said as he walked over to meet him half way in front of his desk, "when you wear my amulet again this time, the darkness that came from it will return to it. Kind of like how the dark blobs returned to the amulet before. You see, its true there is darkness stained to your heart and soul, but its my darkness and its a wanting that yearns to be reunited with me. If you just joined me it would have gone away in time. But these days, everyone needs it done now now now. The half-assed purification ritual your girlfriend did severed the connection forcing what was left to poison your heart and soul, not the other way around." Fang gave an angered look. "Its true. I will prove it. Everything that belongs to me, always finds it way back to me and my Celtic Knot amulet." He took the amulet off and held it in the air, walking around the room as the white furniture turned gooey and black and got absorbed into the amulet. Even his desk and chair, retreated into the amulet as he held it in his hand. "See, like I said. You don't have much time to think on it. With the manasource collapsing soon, will also mean the collapse of the connection the animals and humans share to the manasource. And when that happens, the darkness that has stained your heart and soul, that feeds on your bond with the manasource will begin to leech your life away as a substitute. And that process will be excruciatingly painful and will kill you. You think what you are feeling now is bad? Just wait till later, you will be begging to be put out of your misery. I have always been civil with you Fang, haven't I?"

Fang still tumbling the facts in his head, did nod a little. I guess as bad guys had come, he had been pretty tame with them. Sure, twisting the rules and cheating a little isn't too bad. If it really wanted Fang to suffer, it would have killed Leena. There wasn't enough howling in the world that could have spared his heart the pain of losing the only creature he ever truly loved.

"You see, I'm not a bad guy. I like getting my just desserts as do you."

"So what do you get when you get his amulet?" David asked standing his ground and being suspicious.

"Well, its no secret I'll gain more power I suppose. What's it to you? I can't exist without having a sustainable flow of energy, feeding off of your desires and your fears was the only way I could survive."

"O so you're like a vampire now?" David asked a bit annoyed.

"Not really, but sure if it helps you understand my plight," he walked around where his desk was, being a mime and feeling as though it were there, "Once upon a time, I was trapped, weak and asleep. But then this wolf came and reawakened me with the strongest desires, wants and needs that couldn't be bought. Showing my gratitude for awakening me and playing as my host for all this time, I repaid him with strength, power and size. Making his muscle grow bigger and greater than any athlete his age. He was an all-star, the very best! I thought it was what he wanted."

"You used me," Fang grumbled, the pain forcing him to his knees.

"See this isn't something you have time to analyze and think about. It's either yes or no. Life or death... Deal or no deal?" it implored.

Forcing you to make a decision quickly...
1223211111111211112111122112111111211111.title: Your amulet for mine...

choices: Leena is revived, time for closure and a happy ending...
Leena is lost, she paid the ultimate price, sad ending...
1223211111111211112111122112111111211111.content:
Sure if Fang felt there were more time to make an informed decision he would have gladly thought things over... Every moment that passed felt like he was dying and he had come too far to stop. He knew he had to pay for what he had done, but he didn't think he really had to pay with his life. That would have been to much, there was so much left that he hadn't done yet. He didn't tell his family and his house staff how sorry he was for being a jerk all these years. Sure Tyler was a first, but there were many others he bullied that deserved to hear him say how sorry he was. So many bridges burned that needed to be repaired so he could the process of forgiveness and healing. Its true he had done a lot of awful things, more than he cared to think about, but it had to be done and it wouldn't resolve itself if he died. He had to make things right, and heaven help him do the right thing now.

Speaking weak and soft, "Deal," as he outstretched his hand. The entity took his empty hand and tendrils and shook on it.

"And who knows, you may even regain some of your strength and muscle you lost," winking to Fang as they shook, which was beyond creepy as eyes sockets were filled with gooey goo, that would make anyone cringe. The idea of getting some strength back was reassuring to say the least, he couldn't even think about returning to football with his currently lightweight frame.

Taking his amulet off and having it in his hand to make the trade, David still behind him worrying and saying, "Are you sure you want to do this?"

Fang looked at him, cringing in his face from the pain of now having taken the amulet off. His chest on fire! "I don't have much of a choice."

Practically doing the trade, simultaneously, both had their hands out, releasing their prized amulets to one another. The white-suited entity laughing greatly as it merely held the Wisdom's Loop amulet, he began to fill out again. His thinned expression, was returning to what it was if not more. His chest expanding and the suit tearing at the arms, as his biceps tearing through the fabric. He was growing in size as the amulet began to spin around and around in his hands, growing outlandishly tall and sinister.

Fang on the other hand was bereft of his cure, as the pain was becoming too much to bear. Howling mournfully as he tried to grip the blue-glowing Celtic Knot amulet steady and trying to hold it to his chest, clearly it had to be worn to work. David was helping him put it on, but the pain was taking much longer than expected to leave him. David holding his hand, trying to give him support and strength, the entity laughing maniacally lost in its own power trip, the scene was a complete disaster. Fang pulled David in, whispering so light that no one but him could hear. With his free paw, sprawled on the floor, it pointed toward the door. Fang laid his head on the ground, as the amulet glowing blue lay face up on the checkerboard floor.

Watching carefully at the entity, it's focus lost in its own ecstasy, David used his extremely long tail to grab the cane by the door. The moment it was within his clawed hands, in one swift motion he flipped the cane and smashed the cane into the amulet, cracking the heart-like gem in the center!

Feeling the surge of power cease, the entity looked down at the scene of the broken amulet. In a bloodcurdling scream, it shrieked, and howled in pain. His white suit, what was left of it was turning black and gooey, as the bubbling mass began to fizz down, slowly but surely being called back into the Celtic Knot amulet. The room around them too became gooey like, and the white door behind them began to turn into the black goo as well.

"Time to go," David hollered as he picked his weakened friend up and exited through the shrinking light.

The giant blob monster from outside suddenly froze and rumbled in place. The black goo bubbling furiously as it exploded into nothingness. The colorful particles it had been collecting and stored within its mass shot out in the sky looking like a meteor shower around the world, restoring the Manasource.

David and Fang appeared in the massive clearing of trees that came up to the cliffs edge. Where were his friends, Fang wondered as he awakened with a jolt, his hand cramping from holding the Celtic Knot amulet so tight. David was trying to get his bearings as he wondered around the cleared area and looking into the wooden areas on the edges. Calling out for his Brother and Leena...

Hearing some noises, coming from the cliff side, Fang dragged himself over looking down to see that on the edge of a thick tree root and Jenny's strapped bag, they were able to make it over the ledge with Tyler holding the unconscious Leena and Jenny hugging fast to Tyler's waist. His wings flapping softly to support them.

Fang smiled to see them safe, but he hadn't the strength to pull them over. He could barely stand, yet he called out for David to assist him. Not instantaneously, but within a couple of moments David popped his head out of some bushes as he made his way over to them. Laying on the ground and extending his arm over the edge, he pulled his littler brother up with the two girls with ease. Tyler gave a sigh of relief and blushed smile as David hugged him rigorously with a noogie for his headfur. Jenny than clasped her hands with Tyler and thanked him properly for being so brave.

"But I'm the one that pulled you up from the cliff..." David said wanting some credit too.

"Fine, she said as she punched him in the shoulder. "If you two didn't take so long we wouldn't have had to." David rubbed the side of his arm, pretending it hurt. He looked over to Fang with Leena in his arms as he pushed back her headfur, the strict bun that her hair was in was loose and made her more serene and at peace. She didn't have a fever now, but why wasn't she waking up? Fang looked on gravely...
1223211111111211112111122112111111211111.title: Deal!!!

choices: Breakfast with a side of Epilogue... and bacon...
Something stirs in the night...
1223211111111211112111122112111111211111.content:
"Uh, I don't know if this would help but, anything is worth a try," said David, as his long Dragon tail maneuvered to Fang with the Wisdom's Loop amulet still intact. Fang looked up to him with a thankful expression as he hastily draped the amulet around her neck. Her eyes not a flutter or movement in her chest. He held her closely now, crying like he had never cried before. The love of his life that was so kind to him, she didn't even know him but he had saved him countless times. How could he thank her for being his inspiration, for helping him get through all these tough times. Today, Fang had faced all of his deepest troubles and challenges that could not be compared with any of his trials and tribulations in his past. And now this, he held her closing wishing for her to be alive again just so he could, at the very least see her smile on her elegantly calm striped face. He cried for her, hugging her tight once more. A cyan - green light glowed from the amulet around her neck, splitting into two pieces, the two dragons that were forced to round forever, were separated with one half adorning her next and the other on Fang's neck.

In a few moments, Leena gasped for air as her breathing returned. Her eyes flew open as they darted around, afraid at first, but the moment she laid eyes on Fang, she smiled and knew he had done it. He had saved the manasource, he had saved everyone and finally he had saved her from the abyss and death's door. With the manasource weakening and her need to use her powers, she just couldn't drink from a well without any water as they say, and she fell ill and mana deprived.

"Thank you," she said soft but sure as she kissed his cheek.

Returning the favor, "No thank you. Because without you I couldn't have help myself or anyone else." She shook her head, clearly embarrassed, yet humbled. "No its true. I think it goes without saying that we all wouldn't be here right now if it wasn't for you..."

"O, this guy," she said holding her paw to his face, "such a sweet talking." She smiled again and nuzzled his nose, as their cold, wet noses sent a spark through one another. Leena taking her moments with Fang slowly, she broke away to look at Tyler and Jenny snuggling it out. "And thank you Tyler for carrying me when I could not walk. You must have been carrying me for a couple of miles."

"O it was nothing," he blushed, "its what any gentledragon would have done." David about to hit him upset the head, but Fang held his arm and shook his head.

"So bro, how'd you get those?" David said looking at his wings intently.

"O these," said Tyler hovering up and around, "probably the same way you got that crazy long tail of yours."

"You think so? I'm thinking of naming it Taily. It has a mind of its own sometimes," David joked and looked around, "so how do we back home from here?"

"Home? Don't you remember, you destroyed it?"

"I did?!?" David a bit afraid. "O gosh, what are we gunna do now."

"O peep down over there. Can't a guy get some sheesh. It's the least I deserve for saving all of youse. As soon as we get into town in the morning, I'll for my driving to pick us all up. We can have breakfast at my place and we can work things out from there," Fang said yawning as he curled with Leena by his. After getting lost in each other's eyes for a bit, they soon fell to sleep. Dreaming about the rest of their lives, and the time they would spend together.

With Jenny, Tyler settled down at the stump of one of the trees, letting his wings settle softly before leaning back. Jenny cozied up with him as they held hands, overlooking the cliff and what seemed a never-ending shower of meteors and twinkling stars in the colorful night sky. It was clear out here in the wild and nature held the best view of all.

Being about between the two couples, David laid his head on the ground staring up at the sky with lights moving around and the stars twinkling. Sure, he had skipped school and football practice that day, but if he meant to do it on purpose, he couldn't think of any better company than his closest friends and his younger brother... Yeah, life was good, but life would be better with bacon, "Will there be bacon?" he openly asked the group.

The couples responded with shushes and sighs, Fang said, "Whatever you want. Now be quiet and go to sleep. Tomorrow is the start of something new..."

As David was drifting off to sleep, he thought simply of a story he knew long ago. A story he and his brother knew by heart when they were much younger, but now have forgotten. The characters and colors danced in his mind, blurred with footballs and his studies, the words rhyming and soft with their own self-made tune. Though simple and few, it made him remember of what fun times he and his brother shared that carried him to sleep this night:

Today was good. Today was fun. Tomorrow is another one. -Dr. Seuss
1223211111111211112111122112111111211111.title: A Happy ending with well-earned rest...

choices: Back at the Matthews' House...
Along the way...
1223211111111211112111122112111111211111.content:
Waking up to the sunrise first, David got up stretching. The light filtering through the clouds was pleasant. He didn't feel any different, other than maybe being an inch or two bigger all around with his tail practically twice as long as before, he couldn't be too sure without a tape measure. Waving it back and forth, picking up things with it, he could totally use to help during football he thought. Hopefully the coach won't be too mad about them skipping practice. They did have a game on Monday David thought, as he shrugged his shoulders. Looking around at the two couples, it was kind of nice seeing them with a special someone. He couldn't really think about it with the prospect of the game on his mind. Stretching his legs before walking around, he saw the Celtic Knot amulet below Fang's hand. He must have dropped it in his sleep. He wondered if the nightmare really had been over, but he couldn't muddle through all the thoughts that were going through his head. He thought he could scream, but picking up a nearby stick, he began to draw shapes in the ground to keep himself busy as he awaited for the others to wake. His stomach grumbling for food as he hushed it. It felt like he hadn't eaten for days, though its probably only been just one. He looked back at the giant cleared path of trees the glob monster had cut into the forest. It was a long way back to town. He sighed, finding some hard pieces of broken ground and rock, throwing them over the edge.

Jenny seemed to wake up yawning and stretching, slightly bewildered but than a quick flash of her memories and she remembered it all. She saw Tyler, his head tilted, drooling a little. In a cute way of course, she couldn't help herself from taking off her jacket and putting on him. Other than some pants, he and Fang were both pretty barebacked. A lot had happened yesterday as she softly walked over to David, her arms crossed, supporting her self as the wind was gentle and soft. Looking at him. "So how long have you been awake for?" she asked softly, not to wake the others.

"Maybe a half hour, not too long really. What a crazy day yesterday, huh?"

"Yeah," she gave a forced laugh, could he really take things so lightly, "a lot did happen yesterday. I'm still trying to get some of the images out of my mind."

"What do you mean?" he asked clueless of Jenny's experience in the comic shop parking light and the fearful flight across town. Explaining as well as she could, he was a bit shocked. "Whoa, wow... I'm sorry about all that. While I was busy sleeping, you all were going through hell."

She shook her head, "Its not too bad, but that gooey face, that monster so formless and terrifying. I don't think it will leave me soon. It came in my dreams in the night, I hugged Tyler closer but I didn't want to wake him." She looked at Fang, "Seeing just the aftermath of what Fang has gone through, I can only imagine what you and Tyler went through as well."

"What about it?" Tyler perked over, rubbing his eyes.

"Sorry honey. I was saying how Fang, David and you went through a lot yesterday and it doesn't compare to what I went through at all."

"O," trying to pull her closer to comfort her, "that's okay. Its probably better if you didn't think a lot about it, it was quite rough. Though," he said putting her back and putting his arm under his chin, "I did spend the morning shopping for new clothes." He said trying to lighten the mood.

She managed a real laugh and said, "O Ty we'll just have to get you some new clothes then now won't we." She smiled back at him, but he glared again.

Wiping some dust off his pants, "If you don't mind I'll just stick with Tyler. It's just it reminds me of trying to be something I wasn't Jenny."

"O," she said covering her mouth, "I'm sorry I didn't know. I thought you liked it."

"At one time I did, but it just never really worked out the way I wanted," said Tyler knowing that anytime anyone would call him Ty for short, he would have flashbacks of the events of yesterday, both the good and the bad.

"O that's nothing, I played football yesterday with Fang. We tussled a bit, but Fang beat me out in the end," his mind suddenly went off like a lightning bulb moment, "wait a second, that's Fang as in Fang I play football with on the same team."

Hearing the whole conversation, Fang and Leena laid where they were looking at them as they grasped their hands a little tighter as they slowly stood up. The colorful particles were in the air, gently moving about in no particular fashion.

"You mean the biggest guy on the field, to that," he said gesturing to the black wolf next to Leena.

"Yes Fang, we've all been through a lot."

"My wolf went through the most," said Leena playing with his headfur and playing with his face trying to massage and de-stress him.

"Aww dude, I don't know if coach is gonna let you play looking like that," he said disheveled.

Pushing Leena's hands away and taking a moment to stare at the Celtic Knot amulet, he picked it up and put it in his pocket. "And I'm okay with that," he said with determination. "Now if ya don't shaddup you won't get any bacon. We have a long walk ahead of us."

"Why walk when you can fly," said Tyler, swooping Jenny up as Leena with fang flew up as well.

Running behind them, "O come on you guys, that's not fair," following them along the cleared path.

Finally, making it to the Matthew's House a good two hours before noon, a bunch of cops and media vans were about. They didn't think of that, they looked on frozen in shock. Fang and Leena, stopped flying so no one would see them.

Maybe five or ten minutes later, David was up behind them out of breath. "Hey why'd you guys stop," noticing all the cars and vehicles. One of their neighbors pointed out to them and they were swarmed by cameras and reporters, even that steamy fox from channel 7 was there. All talking at once, throwing out words such as hurricanes, meteor showers, destruction and such. They didn't know anything about the amulet. Only that their house was the only thing destroyed in all the bizarre events. Fang managed to push them all off, making up the excuse that they were camping in the woods when it happened. And they thanked their lucky stars how they weren't in the house at the time. Some cops took down the rest of their statements. Tyler having to file a report for insurance purposes, a call he really didn't feel like making. Apparently they all thought they were killed and they were reporting on what they thought were natural disasters not of the supernatural phenomena kind. After, Tyler made a rather lengthy call, David called out!

"Not the fridge!" as he knelt in their half destroyed kitchen. He cried a little as the others were assessing the rest of the house for damages. The second floor structurally unsound, there wasn't any real way to get their things past the first floor

"Insurance said they were have people out by the middle of next week. David, pick yourself up off the floor and call Mom and Dad and let them know we're alright."

"Why am I doing it?" he feebly protested.

"Because I just handled a half hour long phone call with our Insurance to make sure all the damages and the things would be replaced. I am not in the mood to be speaking with them."

Defeated, "okay okay. Don't have a cow. Afterwards then can we have breakfast?" he asked dialing on the landline which was still working, despite the gapping hole in their house starting from his room.

"After my phone gets charged a little. I'll have my Dad's chauffeur come and pick us up and have some food ready for us back at the house. Sound good?"

"Eyup!" David said happily as the phone was ringing and his tail was swinging back and forth. After moving some rubble from the closet door, he took out a luggage bag and started collecting some clothes and books, being responsible and taking the things out of the safe too. Important records, cards and papers that couldn't be left there, his parents already taking all of the super valuables they had with them to Florida. Jenny helping him sort through the wreckage for things he may need. "Tyler, mom wants to hear your voice to make sure you're alive."

"Yea yea, hi mom, busy trying to save some of our stuff, can't come to the phone," shouting from across the house from what was their living room. Good thing their furniture was cheap but their TV had like two more payments left, he was hoping Renter's Insurance covered that. He was shouting out things for Jenny to write down so he could send them to claims. Leena was just looking around at the destruction, all of the other houses untouched, but theirs. It was extremely unfortunate but at least no lives were lost, so that kept her spirits up a bit as she looked a Fang who seemed to be having a hard time to convince his driver it was him, just because he said 'thank you'.

Hanging up the phone a bit heated, but calmed he said aloud, "Okay he'll be here in fifteen. If we don't get it all Tyler we can come back. Would that be okay Tyler?"

Nodding his head, "Yeah, I'm just about finished, I am a bit worried to grab anything from upstairs. Any real movement could drop the second floor on top of the first and not even wanting to thing about all the old stuff in the attic.

"Why not, you know, fly up?" Jenny said pointing at his wings with the pen she was holding.

He laughed a bit and replied, "O gosh, I totally forgot about that. O good. I can grab another bag and get some of the electronics. Good thing it wasn't really a storm or we'd have to have those replaced too due to water damage." Flying up with his dragon wings, he was being careful to move things as he threw a duffle bag over his shoulder, grabbing more clothes to protect any of the electronics he put in like his laptop, the tablet and his game console. Stowing some of the games in to play later if he had the chance. Maybe hook up to a motel TV and de-stress. "O man, the comic shop. I can't just leave it closed."

"We can stop by their real quick and you can post a sign and take a personal day," Fang suggested his house was a mess and he knew that he'd have to do more with insurance before the day was out.

"That sounds good," he said as he was flying his way down with two bags ready to go.

"Okay, love ya too. Tell Dad not to get so mad on the golf course, his blood pressure, ya know, okay bye..." he sighed, hanging up the phone. "O sheesh, well they said for us to get the stuff from the safe."

"Already taken care of..."

"And a list."

Jenny responded, "Yep"

"O you're good. Call them before the day is through. They worried about you too little bro." Deliberately landing next to him to compare sizes. He wasn't so small and diminutive anymore. He was a good foot and a half tall. Six foot five was average for dragons, and David laughed. Messing with his headfur, David said, "You'll always be my little bro no matter what happens to you."

Rolling his eyes and pushing the bags to him to carry, a long stretch car similar to a limousine, but not quite showed up. Honking in the front, Fang walked over to the driver window, as the driver pushed the window down, blown away by Fang's appearance. "Master Fang!" he exclaimed. Fang told him to calm down as everyone piled in, getting the suicide doors open for the girls while the trunk was popped up for David to put the bags in. They all sat there relaxed as the crushed velvet maroon seats felt like clouds from heaven.
