Giving directions to the shop, Tyler ducked out to see his front door covered in black like goo. Not too much damage, but he'd have to clean it up still... But to hell with that, the idea of a personal day sounding better by the minute. The car ride was relaxed with the exception of David who was complaining about how hungry he was.

Not a minute he was in there, a lanky white bird in suspenders meandered in, squawking about, as Tyler was checking everything to make sure nothing was broken or stolen. "I knew it was you!" He said pointing a feathered finger at Tyler who was walking through the curtains with a cardboard box with some papers and valuables."

"What do you need, Ned?" Tyler said looking over his desk for his keys and his probably dead cell phone.

"O don't play that card with me again, Ty."

His face tensed up, and some bad images of yesterdays affairs zoomed in and out like a passing car. "If you don't mind I would like it if you never called me that again."

"O come on you were a rampaging monster, channel 7 is gunna want to hear the exclusive from me about how I rescued a damsel in distress from the monster made out of goo," he said with a snicker.

"Sounds like the start to a bad monster movie Ned, no one is going to believe you. They think it was a natural disaster. You got no proof."

His eyes going back and forth, scanning his mind, he was right he didn't really have any proof, looking back at Tyler, "Well, how do you explain those? Those wings? You just suddenly have wings now huh?!?"

"Drop it Ned," too tired to really go at it. "I'm thinking of extending my personal day to at least two now."

"I know what I saw," he said red in the face and flustered.

"Look Ned, its pretty much you say, I say right now. So as far as I'm concerned nothing happened. If you just want to keep cool about it and not say anything to anyone, I'd really appreciate it."

"But I... You..."

"Don't make me ban you from coming back here Ned, I am not in the mood for it!"

"Is that guy giving you problems bro," David said, standing in the doorway with his arms on his waist. His masculinity enough to intimidate anyone with a weak heart.

"No, I was just leaving," Ned said as his gaze narrowed, making his way to the door. Using his feathered fingers, he was pointing at his eyes and back to Tyler repeatedly, "I'll be keeping an eye on you. This isn't the end of Ned," he proclaimed as he cautiously moved past David and ran off to his car to drive off.

Sighing, "thanks," Tyler said finding his phone in-between some papers.

"What a whack job, you deal with some strange people, you know that..."

"He saw everything..."

"OK," he said pounding his fists into one another, "need me to rough him up a bit."

Putting his arms down, "nah, he's pretty harmless anyways. It'd be a waste of your time... O wow!" Tyler said with some surprise.

"What is it? What is it?" David said moving towards Fang at the counter.

"My phone is still working," he said as he was looking through his messages, "Your coach called me."

"Aww man," David said as threw his arms down, though his tail had a different agenda as it snaked around and grabbed the smartphone from Tyler. "Let's see what else he said," as he looked through the phone.

"No wait, stop!" Tyler said as he was trying to grab his phone. David, still able to hold him back with one hand on his head, even with wings, his tail pulled one of his legs down.

Tyler left his screen on the photoscroll, David grinned a bit, "So this was you huh? After you grabbed the amulet from me."

"O come on man, don't bring that up. I was deleting them."

"Aww, why they're good you handsome devil you. Fuck, some of these are my poses aren't they."

Rolling his eyes, "Come on David give it back, I was deleting them."

"Why these selfies are pretty good. With a bit of muscle you turned out to be a real stud. And you were like this for a whole day! Bet you got some nice compliments."

"I did, but that's not me anymore. I don't want to be that jerk from yesterday. Had to hide behind the counter the whole time to hide my hard on. I was practically turned on the whole day. It was something I don't care to remember so I'm getting rid of all the evidence."

"Why do that?" he said with a different tone, "you can't delete parts of who you are. You may be Tyler the dragon who owns this comic, game and hobby shop. But you're also a young male. You're thinking of getting with Jenny right?" Tyler blushed at the thought, he wanted to take it nice and slow with her, he wasn't some guy who needed to satisfy himself whenever he felt like it. "Thought so, but you know better. Leave that to remind yourself every once and while who you don't want to be. Because safe to say it bro, there is a hound dog in all of us and you gotta let him out sometime." Holding the phone in his fist, and lightly punching Tyler in the stomach, "besides, you could use some more muscle anyways. It wouldn't hurt for you to go back to the gym. I'd even help ya, you know. Just cause I have football and college these days doesn't mean I won't make time for you..." Tyler was trying to say something, but his tongue was tied with the deepness the conversation had gone. "And I'm sorry about before," David said in a lower tone, dropping the phone in Tyler's hand.

Looking at the phone and then back to David, Tyler thinking this was probably the most intense conversation he had ever had with his brother, "Sorry for what?"

"For pushing you in the wall that day. I was being a jerk and you were hurt and I shrugged it off."

Tyler recollecting the events the night he stole the amulet back from his brother, "O well, it wasn't so bad. We were just being you know brothers, its what we do. Don't gotta get so emotional about it."

"If I hadn't been so rough with you, you wouldn't have taken the amulet back and got all gooey and in darkness."

"Its not all your fault. The blame is clear to share. My own jealousy wanted the amulet back, and my own fears forced me into a prison. I didn't think I could be anything other than your shadow. I lost who I was just because I couldn't measure up to you..."

David gave a hard look at his younger brother, they were both kind of opening up to each other about the whole thing for the first time, "Don't ever think that you have to ever measure up to me. We're not the same and that is what makes each of us, you know special..."

He sighed, pocketing the phone and leaving the pictures alone, "I know that now..."

"We're both pretty messed up," David said halfheartedly.

"Well, I was going to say was, but if you still feel that way, you're the messed up one."

"You ass," he said as he gave Tyler a noogie to his headfur.

He rolled his eyes as he tossed David the cardboard box. He walked out as Tyler turned to close the door and lock up, the black smears on the glass not something he wanted to think about. He eagerly jumped back inside the limousine, safely with Jenny and the rest of the gang. They sped off to...

Taking the drive through Uptown, and through areas of high aristocracy abodes, they made it to the end on a hill where Fang's five story mansion rested.

Taking the road loop around a giant fountain with expertly landscaped trees, bushes and other lawn ornaments, they came to a sudden stop. The Driver opened the door and bowed his head. Five more animals in suited-attire, three were at periodic intervals on the large stone steps while the other two came to retrieve the bags from the trunk. The gang was flabbergasted at the royal treatment, their mouths hung open in awe at the grandiose fashion of everything, and they were just outside.

Fang, holding Leena's hand as he escorted her up the stairs, while everyone else moved quickly behind them hoping to not get lost.

The Frog footman from before opened the two large double doors of the grandest of Oak. Inside a grand hall with a double staircase that joined, many doors, fine marble floors and a picturesque chandelier of fine crystal and gems at the top of it all.

The mousy maid, bowed nervously as she held out neatly folded clothes for Master Fang to wear. She shook as Fang approached her, looking at the floor and dared not to look him in the eyes. "Here you are Master Fang. We managed to repair the door to your room and I found some clothes for you to wear. Are you alright sir? The driver gave such grave news and I was worried."

Even after all he had done to her before, Fang thought, she was still trying to be nice to him. He felt bad, he knew he had treated the rest of the staff just as awful as he treated Palmetto. He put his hand to take up the clothes, knowing full well the clothes were too big, they fit the old him. Speaking with a stiff tone, "These clothes are much to big, Palmetto..." She flinched, with her hands free she folded them over her skirt, bowing repeatedly saying 'how sorry she was'. "No no," said Fang a gentleness that had never been known in these halls, " Please there will be no need for that. Its okay my dear. I will find something for myself to wear. Well, I mean to say is that I should be the one apologizing to you." He put his hand on her shoulder and lifted her up so she could stop groveling and for once be looking like civilized folks. Her eyes grew wide, but her face stayed reserved as it has been for so many years. "I would like to apologize for my behavior yesterday and for so many times before. I had treated you especially awful Palmetto receiving all my years of wrath first hand. I am sure the things you've told the staff about me are true." He looked to everyone, all the faces he'd seen over his years of living. Not even knowing all of their names, he was just beside himself. No wonder the amulet liked him, he had made all of them suffer with his verbal abuse, reducing them to nothing. Well he had to make amends, and he was hoping he could change the way they thought about him. "And that goes for everyone here. I know how you all must think of me as a horrible wolf to put up with, but I want to put your minds at ease. That is not who I am anymore and no one should fear me, especially within my own home. I hope you all can forgive me in time for my insidious behavior. And as a sign of my new self, you all must have the rest of the day off, paid in full. You have done a lot of hard work and the place looks amazing for father's guests tomorrow evening. Please take the day for yourselves and may you come back to know the better me."

There was such a silence in the halls that a pin dropping would have been heard through the mansion. Then slowly they began to disperse, their footsteps in an energetic pace and surprised whispers. Palmetto remained only not afraid or trembling, but rather glad with tears rolling down her face. She had been the one taking care of him for all those years and to see him turn into a rampaging beast nearly broke her heart. But today, she was so happy to see that he had made a change.

"O Master Fang," she started, "it makes me so happy to see that you are doing better..."

Holding a finger up, "Not better, great!" He put the oversized clothes tucked under his outer arm as his other arm held hands with Leena again. She too was smiling seeing the grand gesture and generosity that seemed to make the old Fang vanish completely.

In a bold mood, she leapt to hug the two of them, smiling, "O thank you, thank you kindly, Master Fang. I can only tell that this young lady is the cause for your change, but to see you standing together so happy. Words cannot express my gratitude to you fair tigress." After a long hug and squeezing their necks, she hopped down and made her way out of the hall, looking back every so often and sighing with ease and longing.

"O wow Fang, what was that all about?" Tyler said breaking the silence.

"You know, repairing bridges. I had gone on too long with anger inside me, that now I must makes things right again. Like I did for you."

Blushing a bit, "Well, we kind of helped each other out so it was no big deal. Let bygones be bygones you know."

Turning around to face Tyler and David, "Not exactly. You and your brother are without a home because of me. I insist you stay here while your home gets repaired for however long that should take."

Tyler taking a step back, 'stay here in this castle' he thought. But David went up to Fang, picking him up as he said, "O thank you thank you Fang. I knew we were buddies! We can go to class and practice together."

"Think nothing of it friends," Fang said with strain under David's enormous muscles crushing him.

"O sorry," David said putting him down, forgetting he wasn't the big behemoth he used to be...

Tyler trying to be very civil with him, "Fang thanks but you really don't have too"

"Nonsense I wouldn't dream of my closest friends staying in some rundown motel when I have plenty of room to spare. Your bags have already been brought up to our guest rooms. What's mine is yours."

David made a b-line across the floor, Jenny said quickly, "Where's he going?"

Taking a smell from the air, the fragrant aromas of the meal already prepared for them, "There can only be one answer to that..."

David already finding a seat at a far end near a giant turkey, ripping the leg off as he began eating and trying to fill his monstrous appetite. The others joined him on the same of the table. Fang sat at the head of the table with Leena to his right as the windows on the side of the hall were letting in such might from the sun; scattered slices of colors from the glass and crystal. Fang smiled broadly to see the dining table to be filled with such joy and splendor, the rare yet required business dinners he had to attend for his father were hardly considered quality family time. But this, with his friends and Leena, this was more than he could have asked for. He was mad hungry, but with a normal helping, he didn't need to wolf down as much food as David did. He knew David was just bulking up for the game tomorrow.

He did have a football game tomorrow, but how could he go there looking like this. He certainly couldn't play linebacker anymore. Being an athlete and playing football was his life. He wasn't sure what else he could do. Fang dreaded the thought of going into business and following the footsteps of his father. He wasn't all the good with numbers or finances that was true. He couldn't do something he didn't love. He liked being active and doing sports. The first time he was suited up in his gear to play High school football was the greatest feeling he had ever had. He felt like he finally found a place where he belonged. Even though he didn't look like he could play, he couldn't deny what he liked to do regardless of his current size. It was the same reason why he challenged the entity to flag football. He couldn't think about doing anything else. He sighed...

Enjoying some delicious soup, Leena glanced over to Fang. His face was indeed lighter and happier, but there were just some things you can't hide. She held his arm, slowly moving to his paw and one by one their fingers locked together. She gave him a reassuring gesture, but the worry from his brow didn't dissipate as well as she would have hoped. "What's wrong Fang? Do you not like your food?"

Shaking his head, trying to put a fake smile, "No no. The food is great I was just thinking about tomorrow. I don't know how I am going to explain to the coach why I can't play."

Jenny eavesdropping a little asked cluelessly, "Why can't you play?"

In between bites, David spoke up, "Because he's too small. He'd get crushed."

The table kind of took a moment to think about Fang's dilemma.

"Well, I don't know," said Tyler thinking a bit, "Couldn't you switch to another position? You're still plenty strong."

"This late into the season? They wouldn't allow that. I'll probably get benched for the rest of the season," Fang sighed again.

Pausing and putting the turkey leg down, David said with optimism, "That's not a bad idea bro. I mean you'd have to prove it to coach, but you could probably be a wide receiver or even a Quarterback. Those guys don't got to be so big, they need to be fast though."

"Hey if it wasn't for your tail, I could have run circles around you," Fang said lightheartedly.

"There you go, can't see why we can't give it a try," looking at the large grandfather clock in the corner, "We got about another hour or so till football practice, neither of them had classes on Sunday. "What do you want to do?"

David pictured the kangaroo as he quickly relived their interaction. “Not really. Maybe now that you mention it. I dunno, I’m not good at picking up on shit like that, I guess.”

The two drove in silence for a while. The night had long switched from very late to very early, and there was literally no one on the roads to stop them as they drove under sequential flashing yellow lights. David turned to his brother. “How did you know that Fletcher knew Markus was gay?”

Tyler returned David’s look quizzically. “What do you mean?”

“You just blurted out that I was his boyfriend as if he knew. But Marcus wasn’t… he wasn’t open with us, I had no idea he was gay. How did you know that his dad knew?”

Tyler’s eyebrows rose as his lips curled slightly upwards. “You mean you didn’t suspect anything? Are you serious? I barely have anything to do with him and I could tell something was up. You mean you’ve showered naked with him and didn’t even suspect anything?”

“No.” David sighed as he looked out of the passenger window at nothing. “As I said, I guess I’m bad at picking up on that shit.”

“Oblivious.” Tyler offered. Another moment of silence followed before Tyler’s musings ended it. “It must have been hard, to be gay and all, and try and keep that a secret. From the whole team and all his friends.”

“I don’t care.” David said swiftly and bluntly. “I could have handled what I said better, but I still hate him. Nothing excuses what he did. I really don’t want to see him, but… fucking hell, I have no choice. This is fucked.” David rubbed his face in frustration before staring out of the window again. “I want shit to stop happening tonight.”

Another silence. “Hey David… “ Tyler cautiously probed. “Don’t… look, I’m just gonna say something, and you can take it for what it’s worth, ok?”

“What?” David asked as he eyed his brother sceptically.

“Well, you remember how when Fang went up to your room, how Markus split his lip and he was bleeding?”

“Yeah?”

Tyler swallowed. “Well, after he… grew… he didn’t have a split lip, did he?”

David cocked his head as he remembered the wolf standing over him. “Hey, you know what? I think you’re right, I don’t…” He abruptly scowled. His gaze shot towards his brother, his retracted lips barring a generous amount of teeth, “What the fuck are you getting at?”

“I said I’m just putting it out there.” Tyler said defensively. “But you know, if Markus is in a serious condition and all…”

“Fuck off Tyler!”

“Hey, I’m just saying –“

“WELL DON’T!” David roared into his brother’s ears, causing Tyler to flinch.

The purple drake sighed as they pulled into the hospital’s parking lot. There were plenty of open spaces at this hour, and Tyler ended up parking across from Fletcher, close to the emergency ward entrance.

“I’ll wait here.” Tyler said as he cut off the trucks engine.

“Oh no you won’t!” David snarled in surprise. “You fucking got me into this mess, you’re coming in with me. I’m not going out there alone!”

Tyler flailed his hands. “I have no reason to go up there. David, he’s not my friend! You chose to play the part dude, this has nothing to do with me.”

David snarled at his brother as he heard Derek’s door close behind them. “Fuck you!” he spat as he opened the door.

12411221221.content:
“Can I help you?” A rather fat, unattractive cow asked as they approached the reception desk. Her words were amicable but her tone was anything but.

Derek leant on the counter. “Yes, we’re here to see Marcus Fletcher…”

The receptionist tilted her head forward. “This is the emergency ward, immediate family only. What relation are you?”

“I’m his father.”

“Do you have identification?” The cow raised a single eyebrow.

Derek was taken aback “I was his emergency contact!” he said as his hand retrieved his wallet. “You called me.”

The cow maintained her expression as he slid his drivers license under the window. She gave a brief, sceptical look at it before returning it. She looked at David. “And you?”

David recoiled. “I’m… I’m his…” his eyes darted between Derek and the receptionist. He didn’t want to say it. He wanted Derek to do the introduction, but the roo was preoccupied with putting his license away. David sighed dejectedly. “I’m his boyfriend.”

The cow stared at him a moment before she gave a quick snicker. Derek whipped his muzzle in her direction, giving her a cold, sharp stare. But if the cow noticed it, she showed no sign of caring. “You are allowed a brief visit, but after that you have to wait in the designated area.” Her stern gaze shifted between the two of them before she spontaneously shouted “CARA!”

Both Derek and David filched as she screamed the name. And then they were dead to her. The cow turned her attention to some paperwork she had splayed out in front of her.

It took a long moment before a much more attractive nurse appeared behind the cow. She was a young, thin cougher, and if David was in a more normal mindset, he would have come up with a few things to say to her.

“Take them to C fifteen.” The cow said without looking up.

The cougher exited the reception booth and addressed the two visitors. “Ok, if you’d care to follow me…” she said as she started walking away.

The cougher led them down a corridor into a large, open room that was partitioned by countless curtains. She parted one of them and ushered the two of them in.

Inside there was a single bed and a lot of machines. The sight stopped David’s breath. The overgrown roo was barely recognisable as he lay still on the bed. His muzzle was buried in a ventilator mask, and the rest of his face was black, bloodied and swollen. A disturbing array of machines beeped and flashed, connected to the roo through a messy network of wires. He was wearing only his boxers, exposing his bruised body that barely fit on the large bed.

“Oh thank God…” Derek breathed out relieved. It was in complete contrast to how David felt. He gave the old kangaroo a shocked look. Derek looked at the nurse as he pointed to Marcus. “That isn’t my son.”

The cougher blinked in surprise “Um…” she said as her eyes darted between the two kangaroos. She quickly retrieved the clipboard attached to the foot of the bed and hunted through sheets of paper. “You aren’t the father of Marcus Fletcher?”

Derek scowled. “What? Yes, but that’s not my son, what the hell is going on?”

David opened his mouth dumbstruck. The nurse held a similar expression “Uh… well, this isn’t Marcus?” she asked nervously.
“No!” Derek snapped. “My son’s only half the size of this man! You’ve got the species right, but that’s it! Where’s Marcus?!”

The realisation finally hit David. “Derek…” he began awkwardly. Oh crap, he thought. This was going to take some explaining. How could he not have considered this earlier? “That is Marcus.” He said carefully.

“What?”

“That’s Marcus. I know you have good reason to think it’s not, and no, you aren’t going crazy. But that’s him. Honestly, it’s him.”

Derek gave a quick evaluation of the injured roo in front of him before wrinkling his nose in distain. “I know my own son when I see him! What’s wrong with you?!”

“Derek, please…” David began as he shot a quick glance at the confused cougher. “I’ll explain it in a minute. But please, I’m asking you, please trust me for now.”

Derek shook his head softly as he mouthed words that never eventuated, but he didn’t argue.

“Well… ah, ok.” The nurse interrupted. “It um, it says here that he’s still in a critical condition. He has some severe internal bruising, and potential brain injuries. Unfortunately, we won’t be able to find out exactly where he stands until his condition has stabilised. But the doctors have evaluated his initial scans and acted on them. For now, there’s nothing that can be done but wait. I can leave you here alone for a moment, but he won’t be able to respond to you.” She placed the clipboard back on the bed.

Derek looked at the injured kangaroo with painful confusion. “Those are Marcus’s boxers…” he mumbled to himself. “Shit.” He said, as if finally believing that it could be his son. “Where are all the doctors?! Shouldn’t they be here looking after him?!”

The cougher made a placating gesture with her hands. “Sir, I can assure you that if anything was to happen here, one of those machines will go off and this whole bed will be swarmed by them. But for now, there’s nothing more that can be done but wait.”

Derek nodded softly as he studied Marcus’ busted face.

“I’ll leave you alone.” The nurse said as she parted the curtains to let herself out. “I’ll be back in a few minutes.”

And then she left. David stepped forwards to stand across the bed from Derek. The kangaroo looked up at him. “This… David…”

The drake bit his bottom lip. “Look, this is going to sound absolutely crazy, ok? But you can see for yourself.” He gestured to Marcus. “You go to our matches, don’t you Derek? Well, you must have noticed that I’m bigger than I should be, right?”

Derek stared at the drake a moment before shaking his head and shrugging. “To be honest, I did think that, but you’re a big guy David. It’s hard to tell. Why?”

“At the party, there was…” David trailed off. He wasn’t about to tell him that his cock dispensed magical growth potion, but he decided that given his recent success rate for making shit up, it would be best to skirt as close to the truth as possible. “There was a special drink. It made us bigger. Marcus had some, and that’s why… he’s over seven feet tall now.”

Derek shook his head, the look of distain returning. “Oh, what are you talking about David?”

“You know that’s Marcus. I’m being honest here; I wouldn’t make shit like this up. Fuck man, I COULDN’T make shit like this up.”

Derek looked at his son again. He contemplated in silence for several breaths. “What was this drink?”

“it’s… kind of like a drug?” David asked more than told.

Derek’s eyebrows rose in alarm “What, like steroids?!”

“No!” David said reflexively. “I mean, no, but maybe.” He mumbled, realising to his dismay that it probably wasn’t an entirely inaccurate comparison.

“And it made you two bigger?” The kangaroo asked, cocking his head slightly.

David nodded. “Yeah, and Fang.”

“In one night?” Derek insisted.

“In less than a minute, actually.”

The kangaroo waved his hand dismissively. “That’s not possible.”

David sighed. “Look, I know it shouldn’t be. But you can see for yourself.”

Derek studied his son for a long moment. The steady rhythm of medical beeps was the only thing to break the silence. “What happened? Who did this to him? Were you there?” His questions came out fast and with purpose.

The suddenness and tone caught David off guard. “No, I wasn’t there, that’s why my brother drove him here. But it was Fang who beat him.”

Derek’s brows furrowed in confusion but his eyes were hard. “Greggory Nathaniel? Why?”

David shrugged. “I honestly don’t know, I don’t think he had much of a reason.”

“Did anyone see him do it?” The kangaroo quickly followed up.

“Yeah, Tyler was there. So was just about everyone else at the party.”

“Where is he now?”

David shrugged again. “I don’t know. The last time I saw him was when the two of us fled our house from him.”

“He chased you out of your house? Why?”

The drake looked at the floor. “He… look, it doesn’t matter. I don’t know where he is now.”

“No David. It matters. Tell me.” The kangaroo’s voice was hard and his expression was stoic. David suddenly realised that he wasn’t talking to Marcus’ father anymore. He was talking to a police officer. And had been for some time. Oblivious.

David was suddenly very nervous. His eyes darted everywhere but on the kangaroo. He scratched his neck. “Well he choked Tyler and almost broke his neck, and he tied me up…” He trailed off obviously.

Derek didn’t need to be a veteran police officer to read him. “You’re still withholding something.”

David sighed. He scowled in annoyance. “There was some… abuse involved, OK? He tied me up and abused me.” He had to fight hard to supress a tear. He kept his eyes on the floor.

The two stood in a terrible silence that seemed to drag. When Derek finally spoke again, his voice held far more empathy. “Oh David. Why didn’t you say any of this earlier? None of this has been reported, has it?”

The drake shook his head softly.

Derek sighed before saying

124112212212.content:
"I’m going to wait here a while, I suppose. What are you going to do?" Derek said with a sigh.

"Uh, dunno... Me an' Tyler were planning on going to the shop," David replied.

"Oh? I thought you were coming to visit Marcus?" the older kangaroo said with a hint of suspicion.

"After we visited Marcus," David corrected. His heart stopped for a moment, wondering if Derek had uncovered his ruse.

"Never mind I said anything. I'm-I'm sorry, David," Derek said as he approached the blue dragon and pulled him into a friendly hug, "It's just all very hard to understand. But, I'm glad you came. It's good to know someone cares for him."

David reciprocated the hug and hoped for the moment to end quickly. When the kangaroo pat his back and released, David had to fight hard not to let out a sigh of relief. Derek held out his hand and David shook it.

"David, if you see Greggory, call me," Derek said sternly.

"You mean the police?"

Derek clenched his hand, squeezing harder than he meant to and David just looked at the older kangaroo shaking. Derek seemed to calm down before letting go of David's hand and saying, "Yes, of course, call the police."

"I'll do that," David said softly and turned around.

Before he could turn the corner, Derek called out to him, "Oh, and David? I don't know what you and Tyler were doing in that truck... But stay out of trouble, I might not be there next time..."

David lowered his head in embarrassment and picked up his pace, not looking back at kangaroo. He made his way through the labyrinthine white halls, desperate to escape. He mulled over Derek's words, but couldn't think of anything suspicious like Tyler had thought. When he finally did make it out, he breathed deep, enjoying the crisp night air stinging its way down to his lungs, glad that the scent of antiseptic was long behind him. He glanced around at the empty parking lot. Empty? David began to panic, he saw Fletcher's cruiser near the entrance, but Tyler's truck was no where in sight.

"I'm gonna kill..." David trailed off. What if Tyler didn't get rid of his 'little' accident? What if he's off somewhere growing? What if Tyler was bigger than him? His mind went through a million scenarios, all which ended badly.

He sat on the curb, his head hung down, his posture slouched over. He began to reflect on what had happened over the last 24 hours and tried to make sense of his now incredibly messed up life. He looked down at his crotch and cursed at it. He stayed there, slouched over cursing at everything screwed up; Fang and his sociopathic tendencies, Tyler trying to sneak a 'taste,' hell maybe he did. He continued to grovel for what seemed like hours, the cold air biting into his skin. He couldn't tell what time it was. He looked back at the hospital and cursed at Marcus. "This all that queer's fault," he muttered.

"Who's?" a light voice came from behind.

David turned around and his eyes met the young cougar's from before. Her lithe frame was covered unattractively by her scrubs and a wool jacket, though David uncouthly undressed her in his head. He shook his head a little, snapping back to reality, looking back at her face, one of her eyebrows raised in a questioning expression. "Uh, no one. Carrie, right?"

"Cara," she corrected. She smiled sweetly and sat down on the curb beside David. "You know, visiting hours are over, but I can sneak you back in to see your boyfriend if you want. I'm sure the father would like some company."

"Uh, no, I'm good," David said, shuddering at the thought of having to spend time with Marcus and Derek.

"You sure?" she said quietly, holding out her paw and gently comforting his. She continued softly, "Look, I know it can be tough seeing a loved one like that but-"

"Uh, Cara, Marcus isn't a loved one," David interrupted. The cougar was taken aback, a surprised expression across her face. There was an awkward silence between them before he continued, "He's not my boyfriend."

"Okay, wait a sec, bud," she said, her tone completely changed, "What was that in there then?"

"I kinda told Mr. Fletcher I was Marcus' boyfriend because he was too scared to come alone," David lied. Not through his teeth, but a lie nonetheless. "I didn't plan for it to get this far."

Her demeanor softened and she spoke, "That's sweet of you." She flashed him a small smile and he gave her a toothy grin back. Unexpectedly, she punched him in the arm playfully, "Dumb, but sweet." She sat back and yawned, tired from her long shift. David, acting like, well, David, took the opportunity to fake a yawn back, moving one meaty arm behind Cara for an good old-fashioned yawn-and-reach. He gave her a goofy smirk and she just rolled her eyes but let him keep his hand on her shoulder.

"I'm David, by the way," he said smoothly.

"Yeah, I know," she said with a hint of annoyance. "Think everyone on campus knows who you are."

"You go to the university?" David said surprised. "Me too, I play football," he continued, bouncing his pecs for her to see, oblivious to the fact that she wasn't impressed. "What's your major?"

"Nursing, if you couldn't tell," she replied, disbelief in her voice that she could be sitting next to someone with so much air in his head. "You?"

"Uh, science... I think?" he pondered, not sure what exactly he was doing at university other than playing football. He kept his cool however, and flashed her another toothy grin, showing off his handsome jaw, "So, I'm not doing anything tonight, and you're not doing anything. Why don't we do something together?"

"It's late, David," she said, yawning again for emphasis. A car pulled up, the headlights beaming brightly in the ill-lit parking lot. David squinted, but could make out a skinny Dalmatian boy at the wheel, probably some starving-artist type. David hated starving-artist types. "Oh look, there's my ride," she said with relief, prying David's ham-hock of an arm of her. "You want a lift home? I'll tell my boyfriend to sit you at the back," she said with a smirk.

"Uh, no, I'm good," he said, even more embarrassed than before.

"Suit yourself, stud." David couldn't tell if it was a sneer or her just being playful. Given that he was such a fine specimen of blue hulking dragon, he rationed he had charmed her enough for it to be latter, or at least, that's what David always tells himself. The cougar climbed into the passenger seat of the car, kissed the dog on the cheek and they were off, the cat giving David a single wave as they passed by.

Abandoned, David was smoldering. That was, until he saw a familiar pair of headlights approach from the distance. The truck unmistakably Tyler's. The blue drake clenched his fists. He was going to give Tyler a piece of his mind, though he probably had more fist than mind to give. He geared up for a confrontation.

That was until he saw the truck pull up closer. In it he saw his brother Tyler, the purple drake,...

1241122122121.content:
David’s blood froze as he saw Tyler thought the windshield as he approached. And then a second later, it boiled with rage. The purple drake was filling the cabin. For a brief second, he almost believed that it simply wasn’t Tyler. But as the truck pulled up in front of him, there was no mistaking the driver as being a much larger variant of his brother.

With a square jaw and furious eyes, David snapped open the driver’s side door as soon as the truck stopped. Tyler looked up at his brother in confused surprise, his mouth gaping. David’s snarl tightened as he looked over his brother’s body.

His face was recognisable, if somewhat more angular as well as simply bigger, but his body was not. Ripped bulging muscles clung to his wider frame as if he had spent most of his teenage years in the gym with David. His shirt was tight and ripped in several places, every muscle group clearly defined as the fabric stretched taught across him. There was at least half a foot of exposed flesh between the bottom of the shirt and the top of his tight pants, which were themselves practically bursting at the seams and riding up his feet.

David growled angrily as he reached into the car and grabbed at Tyler. “Hey!” Tyler cried out in a voice that sounded completely foreign to David, but he was otherwise helpless to stop his bigger brother from practically throwing him onto the asphalt as he was ripped from the truck.

Tyler stumbled forwards before regaining his balance, his footsteps thudding loudly as they landed. He turned back to face David, his face a mixture of confusion and anger. “What the hell man?!” he cried out loudly in a voice so deep and foreign that even his own eye’s widened in surprise at the sound of it.

It was impossible for David to tell how tall his brother was as he stood in front of him, as his own point of reference was all messed up. But at a very rough estimate, Tyler had to be nearly seven foot. His purple head only came up to David’s neck, but that was still a major step up from his ‘normal’ height around his sternum.

“You filthy fucking traitor!” David yelled at his brother with guttural fury. “You said you wouldn’t drink that shit! You lied to me!” he curled his hands into fists by his side as he advanced towards Tyler.

The beefy purple drake backpedalled as he held his hands out to calm David. “This isn’t yours!” he cried urgently. “David, this isn’t yours!”

“What?” the blue drake snarled.

“This isn’t yours! I told you I cleaned it up. I told you I couldn’t bring myself to drink that!”

“Bullshit, you’re fucking huge!”

“I know.” Tyler said, a distant smile briefly formed on his snout before it was quickly wiped away. “But I didn’t drink your… stuff.”
“Bullshit!” David spat. “How the fuck did this happen then?”

Tyler gave an uneasy smile. “Well, you know… it was, kinda mine.”

David blinked. “What?”

“Well, I was wondering to myself, how the hell would your cum manage to make people grow. And that got me wondering if it could be… genetic? That perhaps it was something I could do too, like a family trait and all. So I…you know, I tried it out. Just to see how it turned out.” His smile returned in earnest as he gestured at his body. “Tada!”

David shook his head in exasperation. “How do I know you’re not lying to me?” he demanded.

Tyler’s eyes abruptly narrowed as he arched his back. “Because I’m telling you I’m not.” He said indignantly before sneering. “Anyway, do you remember me sucking your cock? Or have so many guys done that tonight you can’t recall?”

David’s eyes widened in shock as his brother's words cut him. How could Tyler say that to him?! A heartbeat later, David’s face contoured into a fierce snarl as he leapt forward and lashed out at his brother. “Fuck you Tyler!” he roared as he half pushed, half punched his brother in the chest, sending him flying backwards into the truck behind him.

The truck jolted behind Tyler’s mass as he hit it, and as he regained his composure, David saw an unprecedented fury pass over him. Tyler’s eyes glinted as if they were about to combust, his snout snarled fiercely, revealing rows of long, razor sharp teeth. His own claws curled into fists as his biceps flared, preparing to launch himself fearlessly back at David.

The blue Drake wasn’t physically intimidated by the display, his own stance was ready to take whatever his still smaller brother could dish out. But emotionally, it was frightening that Tyler looked at him like that.

But a moment passed, and Tyler’s fury quickly faded. His eyes softened and his breath slowed. The last of the tension faded when his eyes darted away from his brother. “I’m sorry David. I got angry and said something stupid again. I shouldn’t have.” he mumbled guiltily.

David didn’t change his stance. “You didn’t have to suck my Cock. You could have put it in a bottle when you ‘cleaned’ it, or something.” He said flatly, looking squarely into his brother’s eyes.

“I didn’t. This was mine.” Tyler repeated, looking earnestly into his brother's eyes.

David didn’t know if he believed him or not. It was a possible story, and his brother appeared to be honest. But Tyler was also clever. He had enough time to come up with the excuse, and could play the part convincingly if he wanted to. When they were kids, the little purple drake would always manipulate any situation to reflect poorly on David. He wouldn’t put it past Tyler to be lying to his face right now.

The blue drake shook his head in frustration. He had no way to find out either way. “Let’s just go then.” He muttered dejectedly.
The truck’s suspension groaned as the two heavy drakes squeezed themselves back inside. Their shoulders touched for one moment as David leaned slightly inwards to shift his weight to the side.. He scowled. The cabin was getting crowded.

Tyler was clearly on a high with his new stature. After all it was what he had always wanted. The impossible dream. But David couldn’t feel happy for him. In fact, it was quite the opposite. He was resentful .It had taken the blue drake years of hard work to get the muscles Tyler now sported for free. In a way it wasn’t fair. It was a balanced dynamic before - Tyler had his smarts and academia, and David had his body and athletics. Now Tyler had both. Where did that leave him? Jealous.

David pouted softly. “Why the fuck did you take off?” He demanded petulantly to Tyler as they started to drive off. “You said you would wait for me, why did you leave?

“There’s a guard…” Tyler replied, pausing to look around the vacant car park. “…Somewhere. And the parking lot is well lit, and the truck is surrounded by windows. Guards can see through windows in good light.” He said with a grin.

“So where did you go?” David asked, still coming to terms with his brother’s new voice.

“Just around the corner. Where it was dark. Then I went to a gas station and cleaned up after the mess.” Tyler shot David a knowing look as he shrugged. “There was a lot of mess.”

David didn’t argue. The proof was in the smell. He rolled down his window as they pulled onto the street.
“How was the hospital?” Tyler asked to break the silence.

David sighed. “Terrifying. But over.” He wasn’t going to elaborate any further. Suddenly, he seemed to realise that they were heading in the opposite direction to when they came. “Where are we going now? Home?” He looked at Tyler.

“Yep.” He said, the smile not seeming to fade from his face.

“What if Fang’s still there?” David asked cautiously. “We have to come up with a plan in case he’s still waiting for me.”

Tyler’s smile widened as his eyes beamed eagerly in the darkness. “If he’s still there, then we’ll kick his ass together.”

David sighed and closed his eyes. “No, we won’t”. he said slowly, as if talking to a child.

“What?” Tyler asked in surprise as his gaze darted between his brother and the road. “You don’t want to kick his ass after what he’s done tonight?”'

David scowled at Tyler. “No we CAN'T, then.”

Tyler chuckled in disbelief. “Of course we can! He’s only got a foot on you now, and I’ve got a ton of new muscle!”

“Which you don’t know how to use.” David immediately retorted.

“What do you mean?” Tyler demanded, taking offense to the accusation.

“I was pushing you around in the parking lot like you were still five feet.” David said flatly. “You don’t know what you’re doing. You’ve never been in a fight before, and you’ve only had that body for a few minutes, even if you had.”

Tyler’s eyes narrowed. “I’ve been in plenty of fights.”

“Getting beaten up doesn’t count as being in a fight Tyler. What are you gonna do when Fang starts using his teeth? Think about it man. This is serious stakes; this isn’t a high school scrap. We’re not fighting him. End of discussion”

Tyler gave an annoyed grunt, but didn’t soften his expression. “Alright, what do we do if he is still at home then?” he challenged hsi brother.

“We run away and call the police.” David said flatly.

Tyler gave David a micking grin. “Really man? That doesn’t sound like you.” He goaded.

Anger flashed over David. “Well nothing you’ve said since we left the fucking hospital has sounded like you!” he all but yelled at Tyler. He could never have imagined that one day he would have to talk his brother out of fighting Fang. Perhaps the purple drake had more testosterone in his system than he was used to. David sighed heavily. “One of us has to be the voice of reason.” he mumbled to himself.

“I just wanted some payback is all.” Tyler said defensively. "Not just for tonight, either."

“You’re being stupid.” David replied bluntly. The big blue drake may not have every light switched on in his head, but he knew that Tyler was blindly stumbling into his domain. There was no way the two of them could overpower Fang, and even if they could, it would come at a terrible cost. The wolf was the type who would likely fight to the death. Fang had already done more than enough tonight to get some serious jail time. It just wasn't worth Tyler getting hurt over.

“Hey David…” Tyler began in his cautious tone, alerting David that he was about to say something that he was going to hate. The blue drake closed his eyes as he braced for impact. “We could easily beat him up if we were bigger though, right?”

David groaned, burying his face in his palms. That’s all he needed tonight. More shit getting out of control. “No, Tyler!” He said firmly. “Get that thought out of your head. It’s not worth it. Would you seriously alter your body permanently just to win a fight with Fang?” he asked his brother slightly despairingly.

The frightening thing was, he honestly didn’t know what his brother’s answer would be anymore. He seemed barely recognisable. He unconsciously held his breath as Tyler looked at him stoically, as if considering the question. Suddenly, the purple drake started chuckling. “Wow, you really are the voice of reason here.” He said with a hint of amazement.

1241122122121112111122121211111211211222.content:
“He’ll never be like you!” Fang roared as he practically flung himself back onto his feet. Shaking with rage and fear, he pointed an accusatory finger at the dragon, tears streaming freely down his face. “You’re weak, like I was. David is strong; he’ll never give in to the power!”

Tyler lifter his head defiantly, looking down on the wolf at a sharper angle than before. “You’re still weak, Fang.” He said with a smirk. Slowly, his enormous wings shook and began to stretch outwards, the action effortlessly intimidating. “You will always be weak.” The dragon continued, his breath shimmering in the night sky. He ominously filled his lungs and took half a step backwards. “Your era of dominance is OVER!” Tyler roared, letting lose a column of violet flames in the wolf’s direction.

As the fire left the dragon's maw, his wings clapped together in front of him, the force so great it forced Tyler’s colossal form onto his back foot. Fang could only watch the pillar of fire appear to explode in front of him as the pressurised air hit it. For a brief moment, the campus looked like it was bathed in sunlight as the white hot fireball sped towards him. Fang had no time to react, aside from closing his eyes and lifting an elbow to shield his face as the wall of fire and air stormed into him.

Fang was swept off his feet, the wall of air hitting him harder than anything he had felt before. His ears felt as if they were ripped open as the air pressure suddenly exploded, the deafening crack of the wing's sonic boom was barely audible as the world turned into a dull roar. And then there was the heat. Fang knew that he was on fire, that his fur was burning as he flew through the air. His skin boiled underneath, the immense pain striking him seemingly everywhere at once.

Fang yelped out in a loud, high voice as he slammed into the ground a hundred yards from where he had stood. The atmosphere was in turmoil, the campus buildings exploded under the brunt of the shockwave. Fire licked into the sky, spiralling in several whirlwinds as the atmosphere tore itself apart in the turbulence.

Tyler laughed loudly at the sight of the burning wolf as he flailed on the ground wildly. And it wasn’t just Fang that was burning. The whole college was lighting up in a yellow glow as the fields and buildings caught on fire. The dragon sucked in a powerful breath as his eyes traced the burning embers rose and fell across the campus, glowing as they floated through the night like fireflys. There was so much destruction, and it had been wrought all so easily. He was simply unstoppable.

The dragon turned his attention back to David. The drake was writhing in his hands “Fang!” he gasped as he fought against the drake's grip. “You fucking bastard! Let me go, you asshole!”

With a grin, the dragon complied, releasing his grasp on the blue drake and sending into a hundred foot free-fall. David hit the earth with a thud, sprawling onto his back. He looked up as the dragon bent down, reaching out at him. David snarled at the black claw in front of him, and with a wild snarl, lashed out at it with his teeth.

The blue drake tried to throttle the hand, he tried to pierce the scales to cause enough pain to make the dragon recoil, but it was futile. The dragon’s scales were like metal underneath his teeth, and David soon cried out in pain as he felt one of his teeth break in half at the exertion.

“Are you finished yet, David?” Tyler chuckled, completely unfazed by David’s attempts to harm him. He rested the claw on top of the drake’s torso, the scales on his wrist were not so much as scratched. “Do you see how pathetic you are? How weak your mortal flesh is?”

The blue drake snarled out in frustration as his broken tooth throbbed and bled. He knew that Fang was badly hurt, but he couldn't help him. Tyler’s hand was simply unmoveable, and his scales were impenetrable. There was absolutely nothing that David could do to free himself. Tyler’s smug grin faded from his face as his tone turned serious. “I was pathetic once too, David. But then I awakened. Now I am a god, and you can be one too.”

David shook his head in despair. Fang had claimed he was a god, Rick had claimed he was a god… but with Tyler, the claim was frighteningly tempting to believe. As David looked into the dragon’s eyes, he realised that they almost seemed to be glowing in the darkness. “I don’t want to be like you!” He cried out.

“I didn’t either, at first. I was afraid.” The dragon said solemnly, his voice soothing as if he was empathetic. “I feared that I couldn’t control the power that awoke with in me. But then I saw that you don't control it. It is greater than our mortal selves. It is to be embraced; to be bowed down before. And it will reward you. There is nothing to fear.”

David felt a tear fall down his cheek. He didn’t know if that meant that Tyler was gone forever, or that somewhere beneath the dragon, a piece of Tyler remained. “Tyler…” he whined. “Please, Tyler wake up.”

The dragon’s face didn’t change. “This is my planet now, David. But I meant it when I said that the wold would have to fit in with us. I want to share it with you, brother.”

David closed his eyes and shook his head. The dragon continued. “They will try and fight us. They will throw all manner of wicked weapons at us. But together, we can make each other stronger. By the morning light, the world will be subservient.

“You’re insane!” David shouted up at the dragon. “Tyler, please wake up!”

The dragon shook his head incredulously. “How can I make you see, David? This is divinity I am offering, don’t I cast it down.”

“I don’t want to be like you! You’re a monster!”

“You fear what you need not fear!” Tyler snarled down at David, plumes of smoke fuming from his nostrils.

“Tyler, get off him.” Fang’s voice growled in front of them.

The dragon raised his head to look at the wolf. Fang’s golden eyes stared defiantly into his own. But his stare was a lonely island strength. The wolf was shaking violently, barely standing upright, his stance wide and stiff. Only charred remnants of his once healthy black pelt remained, sporadic clumps of short, singed hairs dotted his form. His exposed skin ranged from an angry pink to dark, bleeding scabs. He was scarred with messy pattern of embossed skin, the severe burns in many places running deep into the flesh beneath.

Tyler raised an eyebrow. He had to admit to himself, the wolf was putting on a gutsy display. Fang knew that he was powerless to stop Tyler, but he still dragged his painful carcass over to try and do something.

“Fang, do you really love David?” The dragon asked stoically.

Fang heaved at the question, his body trembling harder as he breathed. “Yes.” He finally growled with a broken voice, the act of speaking clearly painful.

The dragon eyed Fang as he slowly hooked one of his wings around the wolf. “David. Do you love Fang?” he asked without looking down.

David sobbed under the Tyler’s claw. “Yes!” he cried out.

The dragon cocked his enormous head. “Then this is how I can make you see.” He said calmy. In one action he lifted his claw off David and shifted his weight as he brought his wing in from behind Fang. The wolf cried out in surprise and pain as the wing shoved him roughly towards the dragon. With a loud slam, Fang suddenly found himself lying on his back, the dragon’s enormous hand pinning him down.

The wolf whined out in agony as the dragon roughly dug his claws into the wolf’s meaty chest, five enormous daggers piercing his flesh. Instinctively, the wolf thrashed his arms out to fight the dragon's hand, but the movement only served to twist the claws in his flesh.

“TYLER!” David roared in panic as he lunged towards the injured wolf. With a contemptuous sneer, the dragon batted him away effortlessly with his wing. As David hit the ground he looked up, tears flowing freely down his face.

The dragon eyed him coldly. “Drink your own seed; become reborn like me, and the wolf shall live. Refuse, and I will remove him from the world; cutting one of the strings that binds you to this pathetic mortal existence.”

David crawled to his knees. “You’re blackmailing me?!”

The dragon eyed David sternly, raising his snout into the air. “You will come to understand.”

“Don’t give in David!” Fang cried out from under Tyler, his face closed tightly as he seethed in agony.

David pleaded on his knees. “Tyler… no, please, I know you’re in there. Fight the power!” he cried out in desperation.

The dragon’s face was stoic, seemingly deriving no pleasure from David’s grovelling. “I am the power, David.” He said solemnly. “There is nothing left to fight.”

David shook his head. The dragon had sounded almost remorseful. “No... no, that’s not true. I can tell you’re in there Tyler. I know you are!”.

The dragon scowled, clearly intolerant of this tangent. “Make your choice.” He growled impatiently.

David felt paralysed. He knew that the dragon was serious, that he had no inhibitions with killing Fang. And David was physically powerless to stop him. The only way to save the wolf he loved was to capitulate to the dragon’s demands. But as much as he loved Fang, he couldn’t bear to simply write Tyler off. He didn’t know why, but be believed that his brother was still alive, but fading. David could either try and save Fang, or try and save his brother. He didn’t know if he would be able to save both.

1241122122121112111122121211111211211222.content:
Tyler dug his talons further into the wolf below him, eliciting a pained yowl from Fang. "Well? Do we have an accord?"

David didn't even know what an accord was, but shook his head anyways. "No, Tyler. I won't give up on you."

"I don't think you should be worrying about me, David," the commanding drake glowered. Tyler let out a deep grunt, a small burst of angry flames seethed through his closed mouth, telegraphing the monstrosity's irritation. He looked down at the charred wolf beneath him. “I’ll kill him, you do realize that? Do you?”

“No… No you won’t, Tyler,” David said calmly. “I know you’re in there, I know you’d never hurt me. If you kill him, I will never forgive you.”

“Then hate me David,” the behemoth chuckled. He began to squeeze harder, Fang writhed, but made no sounds; his body too wracked with pain. “You’ll have to grow to stop me.” Tyler’s chuckle grew to sinister laugh. “And then, you’ll understand. He’ll be beneath you and you’ll forget all about the pathetic mortal.”

Davis sneered up at his brother. Fang was so close to dying, but he had to continue. He loved Fang, but if he went along with Tyler’s plan, he didn’t know what he’d become, he didn’t even know if he’d still love the wolf. But now, it was painfully clear, he was going to lose Fang either way. But, he just had to know.

“Do you still love Jessica, Tyler?” he asked weakly. Tyler’s cocksure smirk was marred with a slight sneer, if only for a moment, at the name. It was slight, but it was just enough for David to notice. “Well?” he asked more pressingly.

The powerful drake let out another annoyed grunt, the flames spilling out from his lips. His answer was resolute. “No.” Tyler’s voice was unwavering, as if he believed it fully. But David knew better, he could see the sorrowful look in his giant brother’s eyes.

“You love her, don’t you?” David rephrased his question, more certain this time.

“It does not matter,” Tyler responded, the tone obviously mournful now.

“No, it does, Ty. It means you’re still in there,” David said flatly, not looking at his brother. He was staring at Fang now, the wolf’s pained breathing laboured. Tyler still loved Jessica; that meant he’d still love Fang if he gave in to Tyler’s demands. “Just stop with this ruling the world thing. Do it for Jess.”

“No,” the behemoth replied, his tone icy. “This world is mine, David. Mortals tried to use me. Fang used me as leverage against you and he used me to kill the bear. Jessica… she didn’t love me. She used me; I was her guard dog!”

“Tyler, you’re wrong, Jess-“

“She’ll never love me!” Tyler spat. He growled before he continued. “My love makes me weak. I realize that now.” The dragon paused. “To truly be this world’s god, I must sever the last of my bonds.”

“What do you mean, Tyler?”

The dark dragon let go of Fang and David as he stood at his full magnificence. He spread his wings, displaying all the power he had at his command. He surveyed the land around him; he knew he couldn't find Jess. But he could guess; the crowd had only seemed to grow, it was likely she was there too. He was going to kill her and put an end to the feelings that still clung to his heart. David would try to stop him, and that meant only one thing - David's ascension. Yes, David will soon understand.

David saw Tyler eyeing the crowd at the edge of campus; he knew what Tyler meant now. "Tyler don't! Those are innocent people!"

"Innocent?" Tyler rumbled, looking down at his brother with contempt. "No mortal is innocent, David." The giant drake began to take a step forward, towards the crowd. "Excuse me, brother. I have a world to rule." Tyler was about to move forward again when he paused. His final words to his brother were, "Enjoy your time with Fang. But, you will join me, I know you will."

Tyler was going to kill everyone there. David had to do something. But he couldn't kill his brother. Deep down, inside that monster was Tyler. But he couldn't save him; Tyler was too far gone, beyond redemption.

The tears streamed down his face. He knew Tyler had to be stopped. And that's what made his decision that much more painful. He crawled over to Fang. The wolf was bloodied and barely breathing, his skin charred and oozing.

"David," Fang said weakly, straining to just call out the drake's name. He would've said more, but David hushed him.

"Shh, Fang," David cooed. "Fang, know I'll always love you."

The wolf's eyes went wide. "Davey, don't. Don't give in," he groaned.

"I won't, Fang." David began to heave on top of the wolf. With resignation, he began to pump his shaft; forcing himself to have an erection. He panted hard, looking up to see what Tyler was doing; a wake of destruction lay in Tyler's footsteps. This only fuelled David's urgency.

"I won't give in, Fang," David started. The last thing he said to his love was, "That's why I need you to do something..."

Tyler was wrong. Jessica did love him. When Tyler's voice rang throughout the world, "She'll never love me!" Jess turned to weep into Alli's torso. This was all her fault, she should have never brought that cum to him; she'd take Tyler in a wheelchair over this. But, Tyler's words rang true; she had been using him - using him to feel safe when what Fang did to her left her feeling so vulnerable.

"What do we do, Alli?" she cried. Tyler's threats didn't sound empty. Already onlookers were beginning to back away, the policeman forming a line looked worried too.

The dinosaur looked at the grey wolf standing beside her, exchanging solemn glances with Ryan. Neither knew how to comfort the sobbing fox. "I don't know, hon," was all Allison could say.

Just then a sonorous boom echoed throughout the campus. Everyone in the crowd looked up to see Tyler begin to advance in their direction. Jessica was nearly swept off her feet by the blast alone and when she finally recovered she heard a pained whining coming from beside her.

Allison was on the ground, a thick piece of glass wedged into her thigh. The debris must have been swept up in Tyler's last roar and the dinosaur was just collateral.

Ryan got up from the ground as well and rushed to Allison's side, a worried expression painted on his face. "I don't think it's too bad. Just let me..." He placed his paws on the shard of glass, the dinosaur roared in pain as he ripped it out. Blood started gushing out of the wound. "Oh, shit. Oh, shit. I'm sorry, Alli."

"I'm okay," the t-rex replied in pain. Her pain turned to terror. "We have to move. Now." She pointed at the approaching dragon. With that, the three of them began to scramble, Jessica and Ryan helping Allison to hobble away.

"Let's get to the truck," Jess said. The other two nodded. All around them, people were screaming and running as well, even the police line had broken, some fleeing, some helping others escape.

Another roar boomed from Tyler's mouth, this time fire spewing into the swathes of people. Jessica could feel the heat as the cone missed them. A nearby car exploded, sending shrapnel everywhere - including in Jess' direction. She could see a piece of metal flying towards her, as if in slow motion. She was angry, she hadn't made her peace yet. She didn't want to die.

And she didn't. A force pushed her forward sharply, knocking her to the ground. When she looked back, a dead man with a piece of metal jutting out of his neck greeted her. It was a cop, but not just any; she recognized Officer Fletcher, having busted a couple of the parties she's been to and also because she knew Marcus. She looked up at Alli and Ryan, both of them as stunned as she was.

"Don't let it be in vain," Ryan said flatly. Holding out his paw to pick her up. They looked up to see Tyler looking around at the destruction he had caused. "We have to move."

They hustled to Tyler's truck, Jess hopped into the driver's seat while Ryan and Alli took the back. She fumbled with the keys before finally igniting the engine. Speeding off into the distance, she looked back through the rear view mirror, watching Tyler destroy everything he loved. She also saw Ryan tending to Alli's wound, using her shirt to stymie the blood. She grimaced, she should be back there, trying to break through to Tyler.

She wasn't watching the road. As she sped through an intersection a car nearly clipped her. Swerving to the side, she lost control, the truck slamming into a nearby ditch.

"Fuck! Shit!" Jessica screamed, slamming her fists into the wheel as she began to weep. Everything was going wrong. Alli was in trouble, Tyler was on a rampage and she was helpless.

"Ryan," she said sternly. She pulled out a giant water bottle from her purse - one she stole from Allison's knapsack. In it was a pearly white substance. She had snuck her way back onto the field with it earlier. She had light injuries from her encounter with Rick, but to her chagrin, the only thing the stuff did to her was give her a nasty taste in her mouth.

"I know you like Alli, Ryan. You need to carry her to safety," she said stoically. She added sombrely, "Get her to the hospital. If you see Marcus in there, if there's any left... Give him some, we- I owe his dad at least that much."

"What are you going to do?" said Alli.

"I'm going to end this."

1241122122121112111122121211111211211222.content:
The night was alive. Flames roared the suburbs blazed, fueled by a wild, restless gale that seemingly changed direction on a whim. Residents and onlookers were driven running and screaming onto the streets. Vehicles sped and screeched as they fled the area, as the distant whaling of a hundred sirens echoed into the night. But the choir of chaos was merely an ambiance.

It was the sounds of the dragon that dominated the night. His grating, guttural breaths rattled through the suburbs, the bassy tremors caused by his footfalls shaking the earth and everything on it. The occasional clapping of the dragon’s wings caused a sonic boom that crackled like thunder, followed by ghostly moans of torn air in the distance. That was to say nothing of the sudden roaring explosions as the dragon breathed his infernos; or the deafening blasts of his furious roars; or the hollow crunching echos as he demolished buildings with the swing of his tail.

The dragon was terrifying enough to hear, but as Jessica rounded the corner, her tired body already fatigued by the run, it was nothing compared to the sight of it. The dragon was hunched over with his head low to the ground, walking the earth on all fours is he angrily searched through the fleeing survivors. The hulking monstrosity didn't look awkward; Tyler’s transformed body so anomalous that it seemed equally adept on four feet as two.

The dragon’s breath shimmered in the night; faint plumes of violet light flickered from his mouth and nostrils. With a deafening roar, Tyler breathed fire down on a fleeing car, the column of flame lifting the back wheels off the ground before it exploded. Jess shielded her eyes from the light, and by the time she could see through the fading aftereffects, the car was a black burning shell, like so many around it.

Jessica stumbled in front of a parked panel van and fell to her knees. She sobbed loudly as she leant against the grill. She was terrified. She had always thought of herself as strong, able to face whatever was in front of her. But that image of herself had been shattered. Her stomach churned, screaming for her to flee. But she knew that all the carnage that was happening was, at least in part, her fault. She had a responsibility on she could bear.

A man ran past her. He paused as he saw her. With panicked eyes, he yelled something at her, before turning and running away. The man’s screams sounded like muffled noise in her ringing ears. Jess breathed heavily as she tried to force herself to calm down, but the streams of tears were impossible to control. Shaking, she slowly picked herself up. In that moment, she felt herself leave her body. It was like she was watching her movements from a distance.

She stepped back out onto the street and started walking towards the dragon. She knew that her weak voice wouldn’t travel ten yards in this chaos, so in order to get Tyler’s attention, she started waving her arms above her head. Although she was small, she stood out. She was the only figure walking towards the dragon, in the middle of an open road. It didn’t take long for Tyler to lock eyes on her. Jess’s heart froze under the gaze.

The deepest pits of hell could not have been half as horrifying being under the dragon’s attention. The burning city cast a dull orange glow on the dragon’s epic form, his black scales showing a brilliant purple iridescence. The flickering light illuminated the dragon’s underside, making him appear more sinister than should be naturally possible. With a smug grin, the dragon lowered his head and began to advance towards the fox.

His hands sank through the road as they fell, sending a vast network of cracks in the bitumen as it elevated around the imprint. The earth shook under Jess’s feet with every step, the initial shock jolting her briefly airborne, before the residual aftershocks gently bounced her.

From the corner of her eyes, Jess could see the dragons enormous wings slowly hook around her, the imposing monster enveloping her with his presence. “Jessica.” He rumbled as he came to a stop. “I was afraid I had lost you.”

“Tyler, please stop!” Jessica pleaded up to him.

With a smirk, the dragon shook his head slowly. “I don’t obey you. The days of your influence is over. You used me, Jessica. You’re the last thread I have to cut.”

Jess cowered under the dragon’s voice; it was so loud it hurt her hears. “It’s not True Tyler! That I could never love you, it’s not true. I do!”

The dragon blinked slowly. “Love?” he chuckled as he took another step towards her. “You have no idea what that word means. You were with me for a day. Before then, I was nothing to you.”

Jessica pursed her lips as she shook her head. “That’s not true!”

“What did you know of me, Jessica?” he dragon said with a sneer. “How can you love that which you know nothing of? I was an ornament to you.”

The fox shook her head. On one level it was true; it was like the two of them were from completely different cultures. But she knew more about Tyler than he could have known. “I know you hate the fourth rule set.” Jessica called up to him. “You think it’s a formulaic, methodical system without room for any creativity or imagination. But none of your friends are interested in going back to three point five. You think that it’s only saving grace is that there’s more merchandise to for you to sell.”

The dragon lifted his eyebrows, scoffing as he gave an impressed smirked. But as his mind processed it further, his expression melted into confusion. “How did you… I never…” The dragon’s brows suddenly furrowed. “There’s no way you can even know what half of that means.” He growled at her skeptically.

“I don’t know everything.” Jess admitted. “But I get the gist.”

“How did you know all that?!” The dragon demanded angrily.

“Allison told me.” Jess said, flinching at the dragon’s aggression. “She always talks to me about nerdy stuff. I never listen, I don’t know what she’s talking about, and I don’t care.” The fox paused as she licked her lips. “But I do when she’s talking about you.”

The dragon sneered as he took another step towards her, his hand landing just ten yards away from her. “Why?” he demanded, his breath bearing down on the fox like a furnace.

“Because…” Jess trailed off as she struggled to articulate an honest explanation. “Because Tyler, I’m immature, alright? I care about status, and that means I date the most narcissistic, vacuous assholes on the planet. I’m shallow, and bitchy.” Jess shook as she looked into Tyler’s eyes. She didn’t know what future she had at this point, but if she died, then let this be her final confession.

“I’m not happy.” She said, her tears flowing freely again. “I often step back and look at myself. I don’t always want to be like this, but it’s all I know. You’re a nice guy, Tyler. Nothing like what I had come to know from the others. I could have never have been seen dead with you, but that doesn’t mean I couldn’t dream.”

The dragon’s snout twitched, but otherwise he stood deathly still. Jess ran a hand through her hair and down her neck. “Alright, maybe love is too strong a term for that, but I did have a crush on you. And then when you and David came in last night and saved me…” Jess cut herself short as her voice broke. After a few steady breaths, she managed to keep her composure. “Tyler, today when you came back, and we went shopping… I’ve been with a ton of guys, but you were different. For the first time in my life, I was happy. Even after last night, you made me happy, Tyler.”

The dragon’s upper lip rose as he cocked his head. Jess swallowed as she continued. “If I don’t love you, then I don’t know what love is. Maybe I don’t. But even if this isn’t love, it’s all I need.”

“No.” Tyler snarled contemptuously. “You used me for protection. I was a bag of meat to you, like all the others! You never even looked at me until I was like them!”

Jess trembled under the volume of the dragon’s words, her hears pressed down and back. “I’m sorry, if that’s how you felt. I’m so sorry, Tyler.” She cried. “And I’m sorry if I didn’t show you affection today, I was shaken up by what happened last night. So if I was distant, or cold, then I’m sorry. I was being selfish.”

“Selfish?!” The dragon’s eyes flashed. “You wern’t being sel…” Tyler cut himself off, his eyes widening in surprise. He had caught himself about to comfort her! His face immediately darkened as he barred his teeth at the fox. He was right, she was making him weak. He needed to cut this tie.

“I am not Tyler anymore Jessica.” He said with dark conviction. “If you loved me, then you loved me for what I was.”

The fox shook her head firmly. “No, David is right. You’re still there Tyler. I know you are.”

The dragon chuckled. “And how would you know that?”

Jessica’s shoulders drooped. “Because if you weren’t, you would have killed me by now.” She silently hoped that her word’s weren’t going to be accepted as a challenge. “All of your excuses… They’re for you, not me. You’re trying to convince yourself that there is no love. That Tyler is gone. If any of it was true, you wouldn’t bother talking about it. I’d be dead, because I’d be nothing to you. But here we are. I know you’re in there.”

Tyler sneered down on the fox, his eyes wide and confused. With a sudden rush of fury, he lifted his head and roared into the night. He looked back down on her and opened his mouth to speak, when…

1241122122121112111122121211111211211222.content:
Through the crackling fires that spread throughout the suburban streets, a low sorrowful song was picked up on the winds. The menacing black dragon turned his head at the sound, grunting with flames as he pinpointed the source to be the campus grounds. He growled low before looking down at the small fox. "Stay here," he glowered, baring more fangs than need be. "I am not done with you yet."

Jessica picked herself up, her own ears twitching at the new sound that rang through the twilight. In the back of her mind, she knew it was Fang. "No," she said stoically.

"Do not defy me!" the dragon snarled, raising his voice as dry heat blasted out of his nostrils.

"I'm coming with you, Tyler," she demanded boldly.

"And what can a pathetic little girl like you do?" he hissed at her, bringing his head low, staring at her with feral eyes, trying to intimidate her. However, the little fox stood her ground, her pink hair billowing in the draft of Tyler's hot breath. Upon seeing her resolute courage, the dragon's scowl softened, his eyes half-lidded. In a tender rumble he used his snout to nudge her as gently as possible, closing his eyes as he tried to feel her presence. "You'll get hurt, Jess," he said at his softest, his voice cracking.

"I knew you were in there," she said, smiling as he opened his eyes. Instead of a little hug on the snout, she curled her fist into a ball and punched him as hard as she could, barely tickling him. "That's for making me worry about you, big guy," she said, a slight smirk on her face, her tears still streaming down her face.

He gave her a weak smile. He raised himself onto his haunches and stood. He began to heave a bit, his own tears beginning to stream down his face. "I killed people, Jess. I'm a monster. Did you... did you see me kill someone?"

Jessica nodded her head slowly. "You killed... a lot of people. You- you killed Marcus' dad, Tyler."

Tyler shut his eyes and looked away.

"Tyler..." Jessica said. But the black dragon wasn't listening. "Tyler! You did terrible things, but it doesn't mean you can't change."

The dragon smirked sorrowfully. Where had he heard that before?

Jessica ran over the desk at the side of the room and continued watching this titan continue his exercises, that bicep bulking out bigger with every flex of his arm, she could even hear the subtle grunts and groans with every rep. With Tyler apparently out of her way she started moving along the baseboard, hardly thinking to keep a careful eye on the purple titan as he rummaged through the kitchen, apparently looking for something to snack on.

As long as it took for Jessy to make her way down the hallway – having to trudge through the thigh-high carpet threads and tripping over many, many times – she lost track of time. She watched with horror as those huge footpaws slammed into the carpet, the thick toes – easily wider than she was tall – curling into the thick threads and displacing them more than she ever could imagine her tiny body doing. To her he was carrying tons of weight, and any sort of contact – even from a toe – was likely to crush her. At least, this is what went through her mind, her instincts driving her. She felt her stomach turn as that massive palm raised her high into the air, her tiny body laid flat against a plateau of warm, purple flesh.

And then suddenly her view was filled with the grinning face of her crush’s little brother, the last person she’d wanted to have capture her. His thunderous chuckling filled the air. Jessy’s heart was pounding, every fiber of her being screaming at her to jump off, or to fight back. And yet she was frozen with fear.

Tyler’s hot breath washed over her as the drake’s lips parted, and for the first few moments she forgot that his booming voice was even speaking to her. She managed to catch the last bit, her eyes widening at what the drake had said…

CLACK.
